analyzed: sa bon gyi sgra yang khyad par gzhan mi spong ba can khyad par thams cad nang du bsdus pas 'jug pa na chos can brjod pa yin la /
translated: The term seed also, without excluding any other distinctions, includes all distinctions, and when it is applied, it expresses the subject.

original: cha de tsam gyis na chos can dang chos can gyi sgra rnam par dbye ba byas nas tha dad pa'i rten can gyi rnam par dbye ba byas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha de tsam gyis na chos can dang chos can gyi sgra rnam par dbye ba byas nas tha dad pa'i rten can gyi rnam par dbye ba byas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: To that extent, the terms subject and subject-matter are distinguished, and it is taught that the distinction is based on a difference.

original: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ni skad cig ma snga mas bsdus pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang / rngub dang dbang po dang blo dag go //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ni skad cig ma snga mas bsdus pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang / rngub dang dbang po dang blo dag go //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the exhalation, inhalation, sense faculty, and mind included in the previous moment.

original: dbyung rngub ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa'o //
analyzed: dbyung rngub ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa'o //
translated: Exhalation and inhalation are the exhalation and inhalation of breath.

original: thal 'gyur phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: thal 'gyur phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: The refutation is stated in the line â€œbecause of the consequence of . . .â€

original: gyur pa nyid du brjod pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi gsal ba'i khyad par thams cad la mtshungs pa dang / skad cig ma nyid ma yin par gang gi tshe gzhan khas len par byed pa de'i tshe khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gyur pa nyid du brjod pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi gsal ba'i khyad par thams cad la mtshungs pa dang / skad cig ma nyid ma yin par gang gi tshe gzhan khas len par byed pa de'i tshe khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and because it is said to be a transformation, it is the same in all the specific manifestations of the four great elements, and it is not momentary.ğŸ”½When it is accepted by others, then it should be understood.

original: gang gi tshe gsal ba so so la de kho na nyid tha dad pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe sun 'byin pa 'di 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gsal ba so so la de kho na nyid tha dad pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe sun 'byin pa 'di 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: When each manifestation has a different reality and is momentary, then this refutation is not applicable.

original: de la yang sel ba gzhan ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu dpyod pa'i skabs su ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang sel ba gzhan ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu dpyod pa'i skabs su ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, another exclusion will be taught in the context of analyzing the cause of appropriation.

original: dper na da ltar ba'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa la sogs pa rgyun gyi 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na da ltar ba'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa la sogs pa rgyun gyi 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the so-called present view is like the engagement of the continuum of inhalation and exhalation, and so on.

original: de ltar na re zhig mi la sogs pa la dang por 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi srog chags rnams kyi rang gi rigs la rag lus pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mi la sogs pa la dang por 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi srog chags rnams kyi rang gi rigs la rag lus pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first, the nature of living beings such as humans that arise in the beginning is taught to depend on their own type.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs 'das pa'i skye ba sgrub par byed pa bstan zhing /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs 'das pa'i skye ba sgrub par byed pa bstan zhing /
translated: The treatise master has taught that the position that arising is not momentary is established by the past arising.

original: da ni phyogs 'di nyid la ma 'ongs skye ba grub pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½nyid mtshams sbyor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni phyogs 'di nyid la ma 'ongs skye ba grub pa'i phyir / nyid mtshams sbyor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to establish future arising in this very position,ğŸ”½he says, â€œIf the future were to exist, it would be connected to the present.â€

original: gang med ces bya ba ni phyis kyang thams cad yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang med ces bya ba ni phyis kyang thams cad yod pa yin te /
translated: â€œ If it does not existâ€ means that later everything exists.

original: 'chi ba'i dus na yang dbugs dbyung rngub dang / dbang po dang blo dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dag gi ngo bo rnams yod pa nyid phyir ro //ğŸ”½'chi ba la dus phyis zhes bya ba ni blo dang dbang po la sogs @91a * //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus na yang dbugs dbyung rngub dang / dbang po dang blo dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dag gi ngo bo rnams yod pa nyid phyir ro // 'chi ba la dus phyis zhes bya ba ni blo dang dbang po la sogs @91a * //
translated: This is because at the time of death, the entities of the homogeneous causes of inhalation and exhalation and the faculties and mind exist.

original: pa'i skad cig ma tha ma ni 'chi ba yin la de las dus phyis te 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: pa'i skad cig ma tha ma ni 'chi ba yin la de las dus phyis te 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: â€œ Later than deathâ€ means that the final moment of the mind and faculties and so on is death. Later than that is the moment of birth.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ The entities of the nature of the faculties and so onâ€ means

original: bdag nyid skye ba la yang skad cig ma tha mas bsdus pa dbugs dbyung rngub dang dbang po dang blo rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bas bsdus pa'i dbugs dbyung rngub la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid skye ba la yang skad cig ma tha mas bsdus pa dbugs dbyung rngub dang dbang po dang blo rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bas bsdus pa'i dbugs dbyung rngub la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The last moment of inhalation and exhalation, faculties and mind, which are included in oneâ€™s birth, are the cause of the inhalation and exhalation, etc. that are included in the future birth.

original: gal te dbugs dbyung rngub la sogs pa de dag gi tha ma yod na gang las rgyu dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: gal te dbugs dbyung rngub la sogs pa de dag gi tha ma yod na gang las rgyu dang bral ba yin /
translated: If the last moment of inhalation and exhalation, etc. exists, then from what is it devoid of cause?

original: 'bras bu mi skyed pa la rgyu dang bral bas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skyed pa la rgyu dang bral bas khyab pa yin la /
translated: The absence of the production of an effect is pervaded by the absence of a cause.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang bral ba yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //ğŸ”½'gyur bar ni 'dod na gal te 'chi ba'i dus na dbugs dbyung rngub la sogs pa nyid grub par 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang bral ba yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // 'gyur bar ni 'dod na gal te 'chi ba'i dus na dbugs dbyung rngub la sogs pa nyid grub par 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: And the contradiction of that is also the absence of a cause. Thus, the pervasion is the observation of a contradiction.ğŸ”½If one asserts that there is a change, then at the time of death, inhalation and exhalation, etc. would be established. Therefore,

original: 'chi ba'i dus phyis dbang po la sogs pa skyed pa la rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus phyis dbang po la sogs pa skyed pa la rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'gyur na /
translated: after the time of death, the cause of the production of the faculties, etc. would be complete.

original: dbang po la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyang de'i tshe yod pa yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyang de'i tshe yod pa yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: And since the faculties and so on exist at that time, the reason is not established.

original: de'i phyir ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond: Therefore, it is not the case that it is not established.

original: lus yan gar ba las skye ba yin na rigs mthun pa'i rgyu dang bral bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: lus yan gar ba las skye ba yin na rigs mthun pa'i rgyu dang bral bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the body were born from a single factor, it would be devoid of a homogeneous cause.

original: 'on kyang de yod pa ma yin te thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de bas na rigs mthun pa nyid ni nye bar len pa nyid kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang de yod pa ma yin te thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de bas na rigs mthun pa nyid ni nye bar len pa nyid kyi sgo nas /
translated: But that is not the case, because it would follow that the body would not be a product.

original: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since a homogeneous cause is the cause of a homogeneous effect in terms of being the appropriator,

original: skad cig ma tha ma'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa'i snga mas dbang po la sogs pa skyed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa'i snga mas dbang po la sogs pa skyed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: the reason is that the prior homogeneous cause of the final moment of the faculties and so on generates the faculties and so on.

original: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na dbang po la sogs pa yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na dbang po la sogs pa yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: In that case, it is established that the faculties and so on exist at the time of death.

original: de dag kyang glo bur ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa dang bral ba ni bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang glo bur ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa dang bral ba ni bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: But it should not be thought that they are adventitious and devoid of the capacity to produce rebirth,

original: gang gis sngar rigs mthun pa skyed par byed kyi phyis ni ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis sngar rigs mthun pa skyed par byed kyi phyis ni ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are not such that they produce a homogeneous result earlier and not later.

original: ji srid bdag tu chags pa dang ma bral ba de srid du gang las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa nyid dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: ji srid bdag tu chags pa dang ma bral ba de srid du gang las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa nyid dang bral ba yin /
translated: As long as one is not free from attachment to the self, one is not free from the capacity to produce rebirth.

original: de yang 'og nas rgyas par bstan par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gzung bar bya ba ni gang char skyob pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de yang 'og nas rgyas par bstan par 'gyur ro // gzung bar bya ba ni gang char skyob pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: This will be taught in detail below.ğŸ”½The object of grasping is that which is grasped,

original: gzung bar bya ba yin pas na gzung ba ste /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba yin pas na gzung ba ste /
translated: or it is the object of grasping because it is grasped.

original: lag pa gzung bar bya ba zhes 'ga' zhig la grags so //
analyzed: lag pa gzung bar bya ba zhes 'ga' zhig la grags so //
translated: Some people say that the hand is the object of grasping.

original: bzhus pa las zhes bya ba ni mes bzhus pa las so //
analyzed: bzhus pa las zhes bya ba ni mes bzhus pa las so //
translated: From the melting means from the melting by fire.

original: dri ma ni bzhus pa'i dreg pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma ni bzhus pa'i dreg pa'o //
translated: The stain is the sediment of the melting.

original: de la zhes bya ba @91b ni sa'i khams bzhus par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba @91b ni sa'i khams bzhus par gyur pa na'o //
translated: In that means in the earth element that has become melted.

original: srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar de las zlog pa dag las sa'i khams gser gyi rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab rab tu tha dad pa nyid yin pa de ltar de las gzhan
analyzed: srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar de las zlog pa dag las sa'i khams gser gyi rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab rab tu tha dad pa nyid yin pa de ltar de las gzhan
translated: The meaning of â€œdistinctnessâ€ is that the nature of the elements is different from the nature of the mind, just as the nature of the earth element is different from the nature of the particles of gold.ğŸ”½The nature of the mind is not different from the nature of the elements, just as the nature of the particles of gold is not different from the nature of the earth element.ğŸ”½The nature of the elements is not different from the nature of the mind, just as the nature of the earth element is not different from the nature of the particles of gold.

original: pa dag las sems kyi bdag nyid can rgyun mi 'chad pa can tha dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½lcags nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de skad ces bya'o //ğŸ”½de las khyad par med pa ste /
analyzed: pa dag las sems kyi bdag nyid can rgyun mi 'chad pa can tha dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // lcags nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de skad ces bya'o // de las khyad par med pa ste /
translated: The nature of the mind is not different from the nature of the elements, just as the nature of the particles of gold is not different from the nature of the earth element.ğŸ”½The nature of the elements is not different from the nature of the mind, just as the nature of the earth element is not different from the nature of the particles of gold.ğŸ”½The nature of the mind is not different from the nature of the elements, just as the nature of the particles of gold is not different from the nature of the earth element.ğŸ”½The nature of the elements is not different from the nature of the mind, just as the nature of the earth element is not different from the nature of the particles of gold.ğŸ”½The nature of the mind is not different from the nature of the elements, just as the nature of the particles of gold is not different from the nature of the earth element.

original: thams cad lcags su gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: thams cad lcags su gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: The nature of the elements is not different from the nature of the mind, just as the nature of the earth element is not different from the nature of the particles of gold.ğŸ”½The nature of the mind is not different from the nature of the elements, just as the nature of the particles of gold is not different from the nature of the earth element.

original: khyad par can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba tsam du gyur pa'i rkyen sa la sogs pa gang la yod pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba tsam du gyur pa'i rkyen sa la sogs pa gang la yod pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The conditions, such as earth, etc., which are accepted by others as having the mere seeing of a nature that is not special, are called that.

original: de ni ma yin te rang bzhin la sogs pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa khyad par med pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te rang bzhin la sogs pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa khyad par med pa gzung ngo //
translated: That is not so, because there is no difference in nature, etc. The word â€œetc.â€ includes the non-difference of the cooperating causes.

original: de nyid ni chu yongs su btsags nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni chu yongs su btsags nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: That is shown by â€œHaving strained the water, etc.â€

original: de ltar dar ba la sogs pa la spris ma la sogs pa'i tshul du de'i steng gi cha nyid la de'i rgyu yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar dar ba la sogs pa la spris ma la sogs pa'i tshul du de'i steng gi cha nyid la de'i rgyu yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the cause of that is not in the upper part itself, in the manner of the foam, etc., in milk, etc.

original: 'on kyang thams cad la srog chags kyi rgyu nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad la srog chags kyi rgyu nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: However, the cause of the living being is in everything.

original: gal te ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, â€œHow is that understood?â€

original: steng dang 'og dang bar dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: steng dang 'og dang bar dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The text says â€œabove, below, in the middle,â€ etc.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: chur khyad par med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: chur khyad par med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The response to this is: â€œEven though there is no difference in the water, etc.â€

original: khyad par med na zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin mtshungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med na zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin mtshungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œNo differenceâ€ means that the nature of the water is the same, etc.

original: lhag ma ni chu gang srog chags dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni chu gang srog chags dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: The remainder is as follows: â€œThat water which is possessed of living organisms.â€

original: phyogs la la na srog chags yod pa'i phyir srog chags dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs la la na srog chags yod pa'i phyir srog chags dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In some places, there are living organisms, and so the water is said to be â€œpossessed of living organisms.â€

original: nye bar bkod pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa ni spris ma'i dpe dang 'di lhan cig mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa mtshungs pa ma yin pa ni spris ma'i dpe dang 'di lhan cig mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example of the froth is not similar to the present example, because it is not similar.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ni chang las so //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ni chang las so //
translated: The meaning is different, because the water is different from the alcohol.

original: skyes bu'i chos ni myos pa srog chags kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i chos ni myos pa srog chags kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The property of a person is the nature of a living organism.ğŸ”½The nature of the water is to be without that result, i.e., the result of intoxicating.

original: 'bras bu de med pa'i ngang tshul can ni myos pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de med pa'i ngang tshul can ni myos pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: The nature of the alcohol is to produce that result, i.e., the result of intoxicating.

original: de ltar na 'dir myos pa dang myos pa'i nus pa 'di yin no zhes tha dad pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir myos pa dang myos pa'i nus pa 'di yin no zhes tha dad pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reasoning here is that the intoxicating property and the intoxicating capacity are different.

original: sems nyid la med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems nyid la med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The mind itself is not the cause of the elements.ğŸ”½The elements are not the cause of the elements.ğŸ”½The mind itself is not the effect of the elements.ğŸ”½The elements are not the cause of the mind.ğŸ”½The elements are not the effect of the mind.

original: de ltar sems nyid kyi 'bras @92a * //ğŸ”½bu cung zad kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sems nyid kyi 'bras @92a * // bu cung zad kyang ma yin te /
translated: The mind itself is not the effect of the elements, because the mind itself is not the effect of the elements.

original: sems ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind itself is not the cause of the elements, because the mind itself is not the cause of the elements.

original: tha dad pa med pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de ltar na sems kyi 'bras bu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro // de ltar na sems kyi 'bras bu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The elements are not the cause of the elements, because the elements are not the cause of the elements.ğŸ”½The mind itself is not the effect of the elements, because the mind itself is not the effect of the elements.ğŸ”½The elements are not the cause of the mind, because the elements are not the cause of the mind.ğŸ”½The elements are not the effect of the mind, because the elements are not the effect of the mind.

original: 'byung ba dag gis sems la cung zad kyang byar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag gis sems la cung zad kyang byar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind itself is not the effect of the elements, because the mind itself is not the effect of the elements.

original: tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elements are not the cause of the mind, because the elements are not the cause of the mind.ğŸ”½The elements are not the effect of the mind, because the elements are not the effect of the mind.ğŸ”½The mind itself is not the effect of the elements, because the mind itself is not the effect of the elements.ğŸ”½The elements are not the cause of the mind, because the elements are not the cause of the mind.ğŸ”½The elements are not the effect of the mind, because the elements are not the effect of the mind.ğŸ”½The mind itself is not the effect of the elements, because the mind itself is not the effect of the elements.ğŸ”½The elements are not the cause of the mind, because the elements are not the cause of the mind.ğŸ”½The elements are not the effect of the mind, because the elements are not the effect of the mind.

original: ci ste myos pa dang 'dra bar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi sems nyid kyi sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rang bzhin rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste myos pa dang 'dra bar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi sems nyid kyi sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rang bzhin rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa yod pa'o //
translated: The mind itself is not the effect of the elements, because the mind itself is not the effect of the elements.ğŸ”½The elements are not the cause of the mind, because the elements are not the cause of the mind.ğŸ”½The elements are not the effect of the mind, because the elements are not the effect of the mind.

original: ci ste 'byung ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi nus pa zhes ni mi brjod kyi 'on kyang sems nyid nus pa yin la de yang 'byung ba rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'byung ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi nus pa zhes ni mi brjod kyi 'on kyang sems nyid nus pa yin la de yang 'byung ba rnams kyi yin no //
translated: If you say that the potency is of the elements, etc., you do not say that the potency is of the mind, but rather that the mind itself is the potency, and that it is of the elements.

original: de'i tshe 'byung ba dag la de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'byung ba dag la de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: Then, if you say that the potency is of the elements, etc., the Idealist replies:

original: chos gzhan spong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni ma byas pa nyid las rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chos gzhan spong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni ma byas pa nyid las rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By the exclusion of other dharmas means by the exclusion of non-doing.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is sound means the nature of sound.

original: de ni blo tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni blo tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is apprehended by a different cognition means

original: 'di ltar sems nyid ni rang gi rgyud kyi rang rig pas bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor gzung bar bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems nyid ni rang gi rgyud kyi rang rig pas bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor gzung bar bya ba yin zhing /
translated: thus the mind itself is apprehended as the nature of pleasure, etc., by reflexive awareness in its own continuum.

original: sa la sogs pa nyid ni sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor rgyud gzhan du blos mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa nyid ni sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor rgyud gzhan du blos mngon sum du byed do //
translated: But earth, etc., are apprehended by the mind as the nature of solidity, etc., in another continuum.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba dang sems dag ni tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba dang sems dag ni tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the elements and mind would be completely different.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni blo tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni blo tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin na /
translated: â€œ Thusâ€ means that if they are apprehended by different cognitions, they are different.

original: nus pa dang nus pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa dang nus pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not different due to the conceptualization of potentiality and the possessor of potentiality,

original: de ni tha dad pa med par gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa med par gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are posited as nondifferent.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyogs la'o//
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyogs la'o//
translated: â€œ Thisâ€ refers to the position of nondifference.

original: dgag par bya'o zhes bya bar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgag par bya'o zhes bya bar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ It should be refutedâ€ has been explained.

original: sems nyid la de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya'o zhes sngar bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nyid la de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya'o zhes sngar bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: â€œ It should be refutedâ€ has already been explained above, that is, that it does not exist in mind itself.

original: yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo yid kyi gzung ngo //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo yid kyi gzung ngo //
translated: â€œ If it has the nature of qualities, etc.â€ The word â€œetc.â€ includes the nature of effects, which are apprehended by the mind.

original: mngal la sogs par dang por nyid mtshams sbyor ba na de nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngal la sogs par dang por nyid mtshams sbyor ba na de nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists at the very beginning of conception in the womb, etc.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
translated: Discontinuance, connection, freedom from attachment,

original: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams //ğŸ”½yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
analyzed: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams // yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
translated: degeneration, death, and birth

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: are asserted to be only mental consciousness.

original: gnod pa ni dbang po rnams kyi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ni dbang po rnams kyi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Harm is the change of the faculties.

original: de ltar na mig la sogs par 'gyur ba na yang ji ltar @92b sngar rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mig la sogs par 'gyur ba na yang ji ltar @92b sngar rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye ba nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, even when there is a change in the eye and so on, how is it that the prior conceptual mind does not arise?

original: mig la gnod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi dogs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: mig la gnod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi dogs pa sel bar byed do //
translated: The phrase when there is harm to the eye and so on eliminates the qualms of others.

original: de yang bu la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can gyis dbang po la gnod pa na yang zhes bya ba ni yul gyi sgo nas kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang bu la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can gyis dbang po la gnod pa na yang zhes bya ba ni yul gyi sgo nas kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase when there is harm to the faculties associated with the son and so on means that even from the perspective of the object, there is such a change. This is the meaning.

original: de skad du dbang po 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dngos su yid kyi blo 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de skad du dbang po 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dngos su yid kyi blo 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the change of the mental consciousness is not directly due to the change of the faculties.

original: brgyud pas yid gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: brgyud pas yid gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ltar na /
translated: It is characterized by the torment of the mind through the continuum of the body.ğŸ”½

original: don 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is said that this is the meaning that is intended.

original: de ltar na sngar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid 'gyur ba skye zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na sngar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid 'gyur ba skye zhing /
translated: Thus, the sense consciousness itself arises first as a transformation,

original: phyis brgyud pas rnam par rtog pa nyid gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: phyis brgyud pas rnam par rtog pa nyid gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: and later, through a process, it is conceptualization, which has the characteristic of being tormented, etc.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'gyur bas yid kyi blo lus la brten pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'gyur bas yid kyi blo lus la brten pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the mental cognition that has such a transformation is based on the body,

original: zlog pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlog pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reverse would also follow.

original: nges par rtog pa'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: A determining cognition is a conceptual consciousness.ğŸ”½Having refuted the property of the position,

original: phyogs kyi chos spong bar byas nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos spong bar byas nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: this is an illustration.

original: de ltar na dpe spong ba dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos spong bar byas nas so //
analyzed: de ltar na dpe spong ba dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos spong bar byas nas so //
translated: Thus, having refuted the example and the property of the thesis,

original: gang rna ba 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni rna ba la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rna ba 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni rna ba la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not conform to the change of the ear is not based on the ear.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the visual consciousness.

original: nges par rtog pa'i shes pa yang rna ba 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa'i shes pa yang rna ba 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the conceptualizing consciousness does not conform to the change of the ear, and so on.

original: ji ltar dbang po yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul ca nyid ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus nyid la yid kyi blo yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul ca nyid ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus nyid la yid kyi blo yod pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase â€œthe mode of existence when the sense faculty existsâ€ means that the mental cognition exists in the body that possesses the sense faculty,

original: dbang po med pa can gyi skra dang sen mo la sogs pa la med do //
analyzed: dbang po med pa can gyi skra dang sen mo la sogs pa la med do //
translated: but it does not exist in the hair, nails, and so on that are devoid of sense faculties.

original: de ltar yid yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul can nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar yid yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul can nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase â€œthe mode of existence when the mind existsâ€ means that the sense faculties exist in the body that possesses mental cognition,

original: lus shes pa dang bcas pa nyid la dbang po rnams yod kyi shes pa dang bral ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus shes pa dang bcas pa nyid la dbang po rnams yod kyi shes pa dang bral ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: but they do not exist in the body that is devoid of mental cognition.

original: da ni dbang po yod na yod pa'i dang tshul can nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dbang po yod na yod pa'i dang tshul can nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the mode of existence when the sense faculty exists,ğŸ”½he says,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: tshor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i nad kyi bye brag gang gis lus khyab pa can gyi lus kyi phyi dang nang gi dbang po nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i nad kyi bye brag gang gis lus khyab pa can gyi lus kyi phyi dang nang gi dbang po nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The specific disease called â€œinsensitivityâ€ pervades the body and causes the internal and external sense faculties to deteriorate.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mig la sogs pa'i nyams pa'i rgyu gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mig la sogs pa'i nyams pa'i rgyu gzung ngo //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ includes the causes of deterioration of the eye, etc.

original: gnas pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni rgyun phyi ma'i rgyu snga ma yin no //ğŸ”½dbang po thams cad log pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni shes pa'i @93a * //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni rgyun phyi ma'i rgyu snga ma yin no // dbang po thams cad log pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni shes pa'i @93a * //
translated: The basis of the continuum is the prior cause of the subsequent continuum.

original: lus la ltos nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la ltos nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The statement â€œbecause all the sense faculties are destroyedâ€ and so on is based on the consciousness of the body.

original: tshor ba med pa la sogs pa'i dus na yang dbang po lnga yod na yang yid kyi blo yod pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshor ba med pa la sogs pa'i dus na yang dbang po lnga yod na yang yid kyi blo yod pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Even when there is no sensation, etc., if the five sense faculties exist, the mental consciousness exists.

original: rten la gnod pa'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba ni de 'gyur ba na rnam par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rten la gnod pa'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba ni de 'gyur ba na rnam par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The statement â€œit is the basis of the continuumâ€ means that when it changes, it changes.

original: de ltar na rten nyid grub pa na de ldog pas ldog pa yang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rten nyid grub pa na de ldog pas ldog pa yang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the basis is established, its cessation is also established by the cessation of that.

original: de lta ma yin na ci nye bar len pa dang bral bas shi ba'i lus la blo mi skye ba'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ci nye bar len pa dang bral bas shi ba'i lus la blo mi skye ba'am /
translated: If that were not so, then the mind would not arise in the body of one who has died and is separated from the appropriated aggregates.

original: ci mig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci mig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would doubt whether the mind arises in regard to a dead body, which is devoid of appropriation, or whether it does not arise because the eyes, etc. do not exist.

original: de nyid ni de lta ma yin te log tu zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni de lta ma yin te log tu zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To respond: that is not so, because even when the mind is inverted, it arises in regard to the body.

original: de ni rten yin no zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni dbang po rnams kyi rten yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni rten yin no zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni dbang po rnams kyi rten yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The body is the basis of the mind, because the mind consciousness is the basis of the sense faculties.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dbang po med pa can gyi lus som bdag gam dbang phyug la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dbang po med pa can gyi lus som bdag gam dbang phyug la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the body is the basis of the mind, because the mind arises in regard to the body, which is devoid of sense faculties, such as the self, ÄªÅ›vara, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa la blo skyed pa'i phyir dang rgyu rtag pa nyid ni bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa la blo skyed pa'i phyir dang rgyu rtag pa nyid ni bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind arises in regard to the tips of the hair and nails, etc., and because the permanence of a cause has been refuted.

original: de de ltar na 'byung ba rnams ni blo'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar na 'byung ba rnams ni blo'i rten ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the elements are not the basis of the mind.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa dang dbang po med pa nyid kyi gnas skabs gnyi ga dag kyang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa dang dbang po med pa nyid kyi gnas skabs gnyi ga dag kyang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the two states of having faculties and not having faculties are the self.

original: gang zhig gang gi rten du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa nyid kyi sgo nas skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rten du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa nyid kyi sgo nas skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not the support of something is not its producer in the sense of appropriating it,

original: dper na mig ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the eye is not the producer of auditory consciousness.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas 'byung ba rnams kyang yid kyi blo'i rten du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas 'byung ba rnams kyang yid kyi blo'i rten du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The elements are not the support of mental cognition in the manner explained, is the apprehension of a contradictory pervasion.

original: glo bur ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa can te /
analyzed: glo bur ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa can te /
translated: Nor is it adventitious, that is, causeless.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na /ğŸ”½rtag tu yod pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na / rtag tu yod pa'am /
translated: If it were causeless,

original: med par 'gyur /
analyzed: med par 'gyur /
translated: it would either always exist orğŸ”½never exist.ğŸ”½It is not the case that an effect arises without a cause of appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu med par 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rgyas par 'og nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu med par 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rgyas par 'og nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be extensively established later.

original: de'i phyir blo nyid blo'i nye bar len pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo nyid blo'i nye bar len pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the mind itself is the appropriator of the mind, he says:

original: phyis kyi blo de grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyis kyi blo de grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The later mind is established in dependence on the prior mind.

original: phyis kyi blo 'grub par nus pa'i mtshan nyid bag chags gang la yod pa dang / de'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin blo snga ma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyis kyi blo 'grub par nus pa'i mtshan nyid bag chags gang la yod pa dang / de'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin blo snga ma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The later mind is characterized by the potentiality that is capable of establishing the later mind, and the prior mind is characterized by the nature or essence of that potentiality.

original: sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The syllogism is as follows:

original: sbyor ba dang po ni chos can rgyu yin la /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang po ni chos can rgyu yin la /
translated: The first syllogism has as its reason the fact that the subject is a cause,

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: and the second has as its reason the fact that it is an effect.

original: phyis kyang zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus @93b na'o ;
analyzed: phyis kyang zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus @93b na'o ;
translated: The phrase â€œeven laterâ€ refers to the time of death.

original: / phan tshun rjes su byed pa can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: / phan tshun rjes su byed pa can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The phrase â€œmutually conditioningâ€ and so on means that

original: 'di lta ste dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa ste gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes chos mngon pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa ste gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes chos mngon pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the two, namely, the body with its faculties and consciousness, are said to be â€œmutually conditioningâ€ in the Abhidharma.

original: de bas na dbang po rnams rten nyid yin pa 'gog pa la rjes su dpag pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la gnod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po rnams rten nyid yin pa 'gog pa la rjes su dpag pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la gnod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the inference that was stated to refute the sense faculties as the basis is undermined.

original: lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It contradicts scripture.

original: 'gal ba tsam nyid gnod par bshad kyi de lta ma yin na dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ji ltar na lung gis gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gal ba tsam nyid gnod par bshad kyi de lta ma yin na dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ji ltar na lung gis gnod par 'gyur /
translated: We explain that contradiction alone is undermining, but if it were otherwise, how could scripture undermine an inference that engages its object by the power of things?

original: de bas na tshad ma dang 'gal ba gsung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma dang 'gal ba gsung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it contradicts valid knowledge,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad mar gyur pa ma yin snyam du sems so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad mar gyur pa ma yin snyam du sems so //
translated: one might think that the BhagavÄn is not a valid person.

original: lus la brten pa'i yul dag gis zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul sa rnam par gnas pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya la sogs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i yul dag gis zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul sa rnam par gnas pa'i dri dang ro dang reg bya la sogs pa dag gis so //
translated: â€œBy objects that are based on the bodyâ€ means by objects that are based on the sense faculties, such as the smells, tastes, and textures that are present in the earth.

original: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa dag gis so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa dag gis so //
translated: â€œBy othersâ€ means by those that cause harm.

original: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa can gyi lus kyi las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa can gyi lus kyi las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase â€œbodily action that is accompanied by faculties and consciousnessâ€ should be supplied.

original: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œUnwantedâ€ means that it is not a cause of the same type, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa can du thal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu go rims med pa can las 'bras bu go rims dang ldan pa 'byung na rgyu'i chos kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyidğŸ”½du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa can du thal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu go rims med pa can las 'bras bu go rims dang ldan pa 'byung na rgyu'i chos kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be causeless, because if an effect arose in a certain order from a cause that is not in a certain order, then the effect would not be a transformation of the cause.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na rang dbang nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir lus ma gtogs par gzhan la yang rnam par shes pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na rang dbang nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir lus ma gtogs par gzhan la yang rnam par shes pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were causeless, then it would be independent, and it would follow, absurdly, that consciousness would exist even without a body.

original: gang yang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag la sogs pa dag gis rdul phra rab la sogs pa go rims bzhin du byed pa'i ngang tshul can du 'dod do //
analyzed: gang yang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag la sogs pa dag gis rdul phra rab la sogs pa go rims bzhin du byed pa'i ngang tshul can du 'dod do //
translated: The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas and so on assert that the atoms, etc., are permanent and that they act in a certain order, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du re zhig gzhung de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du re zhig gzhung de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This means: â€œFirst of all, that text is not reasonable,

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it contradicts valid cognition.

original: 'di las kyang de kho na nyid du smra ba'i gzhung 'di ni shin tu dman pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las kyang de kho na nyid du smra ba'i gzhung 'di ni shin tu dman pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And this also shows that the text of the proponents of reality is very inferior.

original: lus las rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni lus las rim pa bzhin du blo skye bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus las rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni lus las rim pa bzhin du blo skye bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œIn the body, in orderâ€ means that the intellect arises in the body in order.

original: lus las zhes bya ba ni gang las 'ongs pa'i lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: lus las zhes bya ba ni gang las 'ongs pa'i lnga pa yin te /
translated: â€œFrom the bodyâ€ is the fifth case, from which.

original: rab tu skye ba brjod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba brjod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is said to arise.

original: skye bar 'dod pa'i tshogs kyi zhes bya ba ni blo'i dbang po'i tshogs kyi'o //ğŸ”½rgyu mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya @94a * //
analyzed: skye bar 'dod pa'i tshogs kyi zhes bya ba ni blo'i dbang po'i tshogs kyi'o // rgyu mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya @94a * //
translated: â€œOf the collection that is desired to ariseâ€ means of the collection of the sense faculties of the intellect.

original: ba ni blo'i dbang po'i tshogs ji tsam pa 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs na rgyu nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: ba ni blo'i dbang po'i tshogs ji tsam pa 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs na rgyu nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: â€œBecause the cause is seenâ€ means that the collection of the sense faculties of the intellect is seen as the cause in the state of life.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba de ni phyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas chad par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba de ni phyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas chad par byed do //
translated: â€œIn every wayâ€ is explained by â€œafterward as wellâ€ and so on.

original: 'di'i bshad pa phyi ma ni 'chi ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa phyi ma ni 'chi ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The latter explanation is â€œafter death.â€

original: sngar rgyu gang yin pa de ni phyis kyang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: sngar rgyu gang yin pa de ni phyis kyang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the certainty that the cause that existed previously is also afterward?

original: de'i phyir nyid mtshams sbyor bar yang nus pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyid mtshams sbyor bar yang nus pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œIt is also capable of linking.â€

original: sngar yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa nyid dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sngar yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa nyid dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is endowed with the very capacity to link,

original: de rgyu nyid yin na gal te de phyir kyang yod pa yin na ci'i phyir rgyur mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de rgyu nyid yin na gal te de phyir kyang yod pa yin na ci'i phyir rgyur mi 'gyur /
translated: if it is a cause, why would it not be a cause afterward, if it exists afterward?

original: gal te nyid mtshams sbyor bar nus pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nyid mtshams sbyor bar nus pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it is capable of linking,

original: phyis kyang ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyis kyang ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, â€œbecause it is not incomplete later.â€

original: phyis kyang blo la sogs pa bdag tu chags pa nyams pa med pa de 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyang blo la sogs pa bdag tu chags pa nyams pa med pa de 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: Later, the mind and so on are not incomplete, just as they were before.

original: phyis kyang ma tshang ba med pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i gzhan la rgyu mtshan cis kyang srid pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang ma tshang ba med pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i gzhan la rgyu mtshan cis kyang srid pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: and later, in order to establish that it is not incomplete, he asks the opponent who maintains a philosophical position, â€œWhy is it impossible that the future collection of mind and so on exists?â€

original: ma 'ongs pa'i blo la sogs pa'i tshogs ni srid pa yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i blo la sogs pa'i tshogs ni srid pa yin la /
translated: The future collection of mind and so on is existence.

original: de nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni 'chi ba'i sems kyi de ma thag tu skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni 'chi ba'i sems kyi de ma thag tu skye ba med pa'o //
translated: That it is not connected is that it does not arise immediately after the mind of death.

original: 'gal ba dmigs ltar bcos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sems sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'gal ba med du zin kyang 'gal ba nyid du brjod pa'i phyir to //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs ltar bcos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sems sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'gal ba med du zin kyang 'gal ba nyid du brjod pa'i phyir to //
translated: The statement â€œIt is like the ascertainment of a contradictionâ€ is because, although it is not contradictory for the mind of death to be connected to another mind, it is described as contradictory.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / sgrub par byed pa 'chi ba'i sems nyid la'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / sgrub par byed pa 'chi ba'i sems nyid la'o //
translated: â€œWith regard to the object to be established and the means of establishmentâ€ means with regard to the object to be established, the connection of another mind, and the means of establishment, the mind of death.

original: sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the mind itself does not link with another mind?

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the case that it does not link with another mind.

original: skyon 'di med da de med do zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon 'di med da de med do zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This fault does not exist, because the method of establishing that it does not exist is itself to be established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bstan te /
translated: The object to be established is taught.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis dngos po nyid sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis dngos po nyid sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of a thing is established by the proof and the negation,

original: yang na phyir rgol ba la ltos nas bsgrub par bya ba'i tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na phyir rgol ba la ltos nas bsgrub par bya ba'i tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
translated: or else, the convention of the object to be established is made in dependence on the opponent.

original: 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Both kinds of contradiction are said to be the characteristic of non-coexistence and the characteristic of mutual exclusion.

original: dgra bcom sems gang yin /
analyzed: dgra bcom sems gang yin /
translated: What is the mind of an arhat?

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sems so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sems so //
translated: That also means the mind of death.

original: mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni 'di skad cig ma phyi ma dang / mtshams @94b sbyor ba med pa de ltar na mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni 'di skad cig ma phyi ma dang / mtshams @94b sbyor ba med pa de ltar na mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
translated: â€œWithout connectionâ€ means that the subsequent moment is not connected to the previous moment. â€œ Without connectionâ€ means that the subsequent moment is not connected to the previous moment.

original: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa //
translated: Those who are attached to self

original: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa //
translated: cannot be led by other sentient beings.

original: bde sdug ngor thob 'dod pas na //
analyzed: bde sdug ngor thob 'dod pas na //
translated: They desire happiness and suffering,

original: dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len //
analyzed: dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len //
translated: and so they take up inferior states.

original: zhes chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis srid pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba chags pas 'phangs pa nyid yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis srid pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba chags pas 'phangs pa nyid yin par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that the projection of rebirth into another existence is due to attachment, in the manner of a continuum.

original: bdag la chags pa 'di yang dgra bcom pa la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bdag la chags pa 'di yang dgra bcom pa la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: This attachment to self does not exist for arhats. Thus, the nonapprehension of a cause is not nonexistent.

original: bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa spangs pa yang snyam sems pa'i tshad ma las grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa spangs pa yang snyam sems pa'i tshad ma las grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isnâ€™t the abandonment of attachment to self and so on established by the valid cognition of inference?

original: de bas na tshad ma cis grub na zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na ;
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma cis grub na zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na ;
translated: So why do you ask, â€œBy what valid cognition is it established?â€

original: 'di snyam du gzhan gyis de khas blangs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gzhan gyis de khas blangs pa ma yin la /
translated: One should think: The other does not accept that.

original: khas len na ni bdag tu chags pa spangs pa can dag 'chi ba'i 'og tu nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khas len na ni bdag tu chags pa spangs pa can dag 'chi ba'i 'og tu nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: If he accepts it, it is established that those who have abandoned attachment to a self do not link up with a new existence after death.

original: de bas na gzhan gyis khas ma blangs pa khas blangs nas brjod pa yin par dgongs so //ğŸ”½tshad mas ma grub don can gyi //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyis khas ma blangs pa khas blangs nas brjod pa yin par dgongs so // tshad mas ma grub don can gyi //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that the other refers to one who does not accept that.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The words the object of which is not established by a valid cognition and so on are stated.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi yang ngo //
translated: The words the other refer to the mind of one who is not an arhat.

original: de med na yod pa de ni 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de med na yod pa de ni 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: If it does not exist, then its existence is pervaded by the fact that it is not a result.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: And that which is incompatible with that is its result.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, there is the perception of the incompatibility of the pervader.

original: gang de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bral ba'o //
translated: The words that which is that refer to the absence of a cause.

original: thams cad la khyad par med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad la khyad par med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The words without distinction in all cases refer to the following.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dang lam po che'i skyes bu'i 'chi ba'i sems khyad par med par gyu dang bral ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dang lam po che'i skyes bu'i 'chi ba'i sems khyad par med par gyu dang bral ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The mind of death of an arhat and the mind of death of a person on the highway are established as being the same, i.e., devoid of discursive thought.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa de dag go //ğŸ”½dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la ltos pa'i yid kyi blo 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa de dag go // dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la ltos pa'i yid kyi blo 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'am /
translated: This reason is unestablished, i.e., the mind of death of an arhat is not devoid of discursive thought, because it is an effect and because it is not separated from its cause.

original: de dang bral bas rgyu dang bral ba de nyid ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de dang bral bas rgyu dang bral ba de nyid ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The mind of death of an arhat is not established as an effect of the out-breath and in-breath, or as not separated from them, because it is like the mind.ğŸ”½The mind of death of an arhat is not like the mind of death of a person on the highway, because it is an effect and because it is not separated from its cause.

original: de blo bzhin zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de blo bzhin zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the mind means like a sense consciousness.

original: 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Change means transformation.

original: nyams pa ni zhig pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ni zhig pa'o //
translated: Loss means destruction.

original: 'gyur ba dang nyams pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang nyams pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Change and loss are a compound.

original: kun las kyang ni ma yin te //
analyzed: kun las kyang ni ma yin te //
translated: not from all.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i tshigs kun las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i tshigs kun las so //
translated: The word â€œallâ€ refers to all the sense faculties.

original: skyo ba med pa'i rgyu ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa'i rgyu ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of non-discouragement will be explained later.

original: shes skyed nus pa tha dad @95a * //
analyzed: shes skyed nus pa tha dad @95a * //
translated: Because of the difference in the capacity to produce consciousness,ğŸ”½the word â€œalsoâ€ should be supplied after â€œbecause of the difference in the capacity to produce consciousness.â€

original: phyir ; / zhes bya ba de dang thag nye ba nyid du kyang gi sgra blta bar bya ste /ğŸ”½rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ; / zhes bya ba de dang thag nye ba nyid du kyang gi sgra blta bar bya ste / rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the word â€œalsoâ€ should be applied in the appropriate place.

original: des na 'di ni gtan tshigs gzhan sdud pa'i don yin te kyang gi sgras ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gtan tshigs gzhan sdud pa'i don yin te kyang gi sgras ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the inclusion of another reason. The word â€œalsoâ€ refers to what is stated.

original: 'byung ba med pa las myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa las myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a sprout, etc. from that which does not exist as a cause.

original: dper na 'byung ba phan tshun lhan cig byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams gcig nyams na /
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba phan tshun lhan cig byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams gcig nyams na /
translated: For example, the primary elements are mutually accepted as co-existent causes.

original: yod pa ma yin pa dang mig la sogs pa gang yang rung ba nyams na shes pa med pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa dang mig la sogs pa gang yang rung ba nyams na shes pa med pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: When one of them is absent, the others do not exist. When any one of the eyes, etc. is absent, consciousness does not exist. It is like that.

original: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of the difference in the capacity to produce consciousness,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mig gi dbang po gzugs la dmigs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid du rigs kyi sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mig gi dbang po gzugs la dmigs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid du rigs kyi sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The eye faculty is capable of producing a consciousness that has form as its object, but it is not capable of producing a consciousness that has sound as its object.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa yang rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed par nus par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa yang rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed par nus par rigs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the ear faculty is capable of producing a consciousness that has sound as its object, but it is not capable of producing a consciousness that has form as its object.

original: nus pa'i khyad par ni so sor nges pa 'di nyid kyis dbang po rnams du ma nyid du rtogs pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa don thams cad kyi yul can du rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par ni so sor nges pa 'di nyid kyis dbang po rnams du ma nyid du rtogs pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa don thams cad kyi yul can du rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: This very restriction of the capacity of the faculties is what leads to the understanding that there are many faculties and to the understanding that mental consciousness is associated with conceptualization and has all objects.

original: de dbang po las dngos su skye ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de dbang po las dngos su skye ba yin na ni /
translated: If it were directly produced from the faculties,

original: yul thams cad la gsal bar snang ba can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul thams cad la gsal bar snang ba can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it would have the appearance of all objects.

original: de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po gcig gi sgo nas skye ba gcig po de nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po gcig gi sgo nas skye ba gcig po de nyid kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, even though mental consciousness arises through a single faculty,

original: bya ba thams cad rdzogs pa yin pa de ltar na dbang po gzhan rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad rdzogs pa yin pa de ltar na dbang po gzhan rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: all activities would be completed, and the other faculties would be meaningless.

original: de nyid ni de skad du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni de skad du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: This is what is being shown by the passage beginning with â€œIf it is claimed, etc.â€

original: dbang po'i tshogs ma lus pa las skye bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i rten dbang po gcig gi sgo nas skye ba nyid med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs ma lus pa las skye bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i rten dbang po gcig gi sgo nas skye ba nyid med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that, for one who maintains that consciousness arises from the entire collection of faculties, there is no arising by means of a single faculty as a basis?

original: rten dbang po gcig gis skyed pas yul thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ci'i phyir rjod ce na /
analyzed: rten dbang po gcig gis skyed pas yul thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ci'i phyir rjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said that â€œall objects are cognized by a single faculty as a basisâ€?

original: 'di snyam du kun las skye ba yang khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du kun las skye ba yang khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: The idea is that one should accept that consciousness arises from everything,

original: de lta ma yin na dbang po gcig ma yin na skye par mi 'gyur na mthong ngo zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbang po gcig ma yin na skye par mi 'gyur na mthong ngo zhes dgongs so //
translated: otherwise, if it did not arise from everything, it would not arise from a single faculty, but it is seen to do so.

original: gzhan rnams ni med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other faculties do not exist means that such things as visual consciousness do not exist.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa de yang gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po'i sgo nas skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa de yang gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po'i sgo nas skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: And that conceptual mental consciousness arises from the eye faculty when it has as its object a visible form.

original: gzugs kyi yul can dang / rna ba'i dbang po'i sgo nas skye ba ni sgra'i yul @95b can dang / de bzhin du dbang po gzhan gyi stobs kyis skye ba na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi yul can dang / rna ba'i dbang po'i sgo nas skye ba ni sgra'i yul @95b can dang / de bzhin du dbang po gzhan gyi stobs kyis skye ba na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: When it arises from the ear faculty, it has as its object a sound. And so on for the other faculties.

original: de bas na dbang po gzhan med pa'i skyon yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po gzhan med pa'i skyon yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Thus, he thinks that the error of the absence of other faculties does not occur.

original: de'i blo dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i blo dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: de'i blo dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i blo dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: Like the cognition of the faculty means like the cognition of the faculty.

original: de bas na gsal bar snang ba yin pa'i phyir rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na gsal bar snang ba yin pa'i phyir rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus, he thinks that the error of the absence of conceptualization does not occur.

original: ma chod pa'i yul dang lhan cig rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ma chod pa'i yul dang lhan cig rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'o //
translated: The object is not obstructed, and it is present in a place that is suitable.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma tshang ba med pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma tshang ba med pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase and so on includes the absence of deficiency and so on.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase â€œwithout relying on the mental consciousnessâ€ means that the mental consciousness is not the dominant condition for the arising of the mental factors.

original: dbang po dang yul ma chod pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul ma chod pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa yin no //
translated: The phrase â€œwithout regard to the mental consciousnessâ€ means that it is not dependent on the sense faculty and the object not being obstructed, etc.

original: ma chod pa la sogs pa yong na yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chod pa la sogs pa yong na yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises even when the object is obstructed, etc.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid la sems dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de la yang de dang 'gal ba'i sems pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid la sems dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de la yang de dang 'gal ba'i sems pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The fact that the mental faculty is the basis of the mental consciousness is pervaded by the fact that it is associated with mind. And that is contradicted by the fact that it is associated with mental consciousness. Thus, there is the perception of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: sems dang sems med pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bos 'gal bar bzlog pa na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems med pa'i nye bar len pa'i ngo bos 'gal bar bzlog pa na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: When the mental faculty is refuted as having the nature of being associated with mind or not being associated with mind, it is contradicted by valid knowledge.

original: de bas na ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no doubt about the negation.

original: de 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown later.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi zhes bya ba la ming ni sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi zhes bya ba la ming ni sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
translated: Name-and-form means name and form. Name is mind and mental factors.

original: gzugs ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
translated: Form is the body together with the sense faculties.

original: nges pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams phan tshun ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams phan tshun ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term â€œindeterminateâ€ is used because it is possible for the faculties to be incomplete.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du lhan cig gnas pa tsam ni gtan tshigs ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du lhan cig gnas pa tsam ni gtan tshigs ma yin gyi /
translated: This means that mere co-existence is not a logical reason.

original: 'on kyang nges pa yin te de mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa yin te de mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is certain that the reason is not unestablished because it is not present in a dissimilar instance.

original: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes brjod do //ğŸ”½de ni gzhan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni lhan cig gnas pa nges pa dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes brjod do // de ni gzhan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni lhan cig gnas pa nges pa dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not indeterminate.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni lus dang dbang po dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni lus dang dbang po dag la yang ngo //
translated: The term â€œalsoâ€ in the statement, â€œThis is also the case for othersâ€ refers to the body and the faculties.

original: 'di las gzugs dang bral ba las gzugs med pa de gzugs med pa'i khams zhes gang rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las gzugs dang bral ba las gzugs med pa de gzugs med pa'i khams zhes gang rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: The formless realm is well known as the realm where form is absent because it is free from attachment to form.

original: der gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Beings are born there who are free from attachment to form.

original: de bas na gzugs 'phen par byed pa'i las med pa'i phyir lus dang dbang po med par yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs 'phen par byed pa'i las med pa'i phyir lus dang dbang po med par yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no karma that projects form, mental consciousness exists even without a body and sense faculties.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe gzhan de lta bur gyur pa'i khams ded la ma grub po zhes zer na /ğŸ”½de'i phyir dpe gzhan ni de ltar na 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sog @96a * //
