analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe gzhan de lta bur gyur pa'i khams ded la ma grub po zhes zer na / de'i phyir dpe gzhan ni de ltar na 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sog @96a * //
translated: If someone says that the other elements are not established in that way,

original: pa smos te /
analyzed: pa smos te /
translated: then the example is stated in the verse: â€œIn this case, it is also like that.â€

original: gtan tshigs ni ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang lhan cig gnas pa'i zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang lhan cig gnas pa'i zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di'o //
translated: The reason is unestablished. This is what is meant by â€œabiding together with certainty.â€

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'di ltar dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dngos su 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyu nyid du bzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'di ltar dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dngos su 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyu nyid du bzung ba yin gyi /
translated: The reason is unestablished. In this way, the body with sense faculties is taken as the direct cause of change through transformation,

original: rnam pa ji ltar yang rung ba ni ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar yang rung ba ni ma yin na /
translated: but not in any way at all.

original: dbang po 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dngos su yid kyi blo 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: dbang po 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dngos su yid kyi blo 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that the mental faculty does not actually change through the change of the sense faculty.

original: de nyid ni 'di ltar kho bo cag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'di ltar kho bo cag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is the reason why the root text says, â€œbecause we do not maintain that the mental faculty is a sense faculty.â€

original: ci ste rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid gzung bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid gzung bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that the mental faculty is a sense faculty because it is the cause of a change in some way,

original: de'i phyir phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: then the root text says, â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€

original: so gtang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan ni so gtang bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi rten can gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: so gtang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan ni so gtang bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi rten can gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities that arise from the use of a toothpick are the form, etc., that are based on the substance that is being cleaned by the toothpick.

original: me las zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: me las zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth example is the one that is stated in the root text as â€œfire.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½gang zhig yod nyid phan 'dogs byed //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni / gang zhig yod nyid phan 'dogs byed //
translated: The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'dis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'dis so //
translated: The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€ğŸ”½The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€

original: de ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rgyu la sngar 'byung ba can gyi 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: de ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rgyu la sngar 'byung ba can gyi 'bras bu'am /
translated: The root text states that the mental faculty is not a sense faculty â€œbecause it is not the cause of a change in the object.â€

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba can na /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba can na /
translated: The root text states that the

original: gang phyis 'byung ba can de la rgyu'i skad cig mas chod pa skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par 'byung ba can na /
analyzed: gang phyis 'byung ba can de la rgyu'i skad cig mas chod pa skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par 'byung ba can na /
translated: That which arises later is either obstructed by the moment of the cause, and arises in the third moment, etc.,

original: yang na rgyu'i skad cig mas chod pa skad cig ma gnyis par yod pa nyid du thag nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i skad cig mas chod pa skad cig ma gnyis par yod pa nyid du thag nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: or it is obstructed by the moment of the cause, and exists in the second moment, having the characteristic of being proximate.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhir gyur na //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhir gyur na //
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: de la re zhig dang po dag ni bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis bstsal ba gsungs te /ğŸ”½rgyu las sngar grub pa'am /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po dag ni bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis bstsal ba gsungs te / rgyu las sngar grub pa'am /
translated: The first two alternatives are refuted by the author of the treatise himself:ğŸ”½An effect does not exist prior to its cause,

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dang tshul can ni 'bras bu ma yin no zhes gang smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dang tshul can ni 'bras bu ma yin no zhes gang smos pa yin no //
translated: nor does it exist simultaneously with its cause.

original: rnam pa rtog pa bar ma la yang 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa rtog pa bar ma la yang 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The third alternative is also refuted: the effect would be without a cause,

original: skad cig ma gsum par 'byung ba can nyid yin na zhig pa las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum par 'byung ba can nyid yin na zhig pa las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it existed in the third moment, it would follow that it arises from destruction.

original: de bas na 'di la rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the fourth alternative is possible here.

original: de lta ni gang kho nas skad cig ma dang po la rgyu yod pa nyid yin la gnyis pa la 'bras bu yin pa de nyid kyis rgyu ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni gang kho nas skad cig ma dang po la rgyu yod pa nyid yin la gnyis pa la 'bras bu yin pa de nyid kyis rgyu ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye ba yin te /
translated: Thus, that which is the cause in the first moment is the cause of that which is the effect in the second moment, because the cause does not disintegrate.

original: skad cig ma dang po la rgyu ma zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po la rgyu ma zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For, the cause does not disintegrate in the first moment.

original: de ltar na rgyu yod pa sngon du song ba can ni 'bras bu'i yod pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu yod pa sngon du song ba can ni 'bras bu'i yod pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the existence of the effect comes about through the prior existence of the cause,

original: dper na zhig nas med pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la rnam par 'jog pa med pa na yang med pa sngon du song ba can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zhig nas med pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la rnam par 'jog pa med pa na yang med pa sngon du song ba can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the existence of the second moment of a pot is not due to the prior existence of the nonexistence of the pot that has been destroyed.

original: @96b de nyid ni 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: @96b de nyid ni 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: But what is that?

original: rgyu yod pa nyid nye ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa nyid nye ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
translated: He shows that it is the existence of the cause that is near, etc.

original: dus snga ma can dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yod pa nyid ni 'bras bu nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus snga ma can dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yod pa nyid ni 'bras bu nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The existence of the effect does not have the nature of being prior or simultaneous.

original: grub pa ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu las sngar 'byung ba can ni sngar yod pa nyid du grub pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba can yang rgyu dang dus mnyam du grub pa yin te /
analyzed: grub pa ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu las sngar 'byung ba can ni sngar yod pa nyid du grub pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba can yang rgyu dang dus mnyam du grub pa yin te /
translated: That which arises prior to a cause is established as existing prior to it, and that which arises simultaneously with a cause is established as existing at the same time as the cause.

original: grub pa la cung zhig kyang byar yod pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyun dag ni zhes bya ba la nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni tha dad pa med pa'i rgyun no //
analyzed: grub pa la cung zhig kyang byar yod pa ma yin no // tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyun dag ni zhes bya ba la nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni tha dad pa med pa'i rgyun no //
translated: But that which is already established has nothing to be done.ğŸ”½The continuum of the appropriating cause is not different.

original: lhan cig byed pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyun no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyun no //
translated: The continuum of the cooperating cause is different.

original: rgyud gzhan phan gdags par bya zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ma yin par gyur pa'i rgyus phan gdags par bya ba yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan phan gdags par bya zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ma yin par gyur pa'i rgyus phan gdags par bya ba yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The continuum of the other-benefiting cause is to be benefited.ğŸ”½The seventh case is the reason.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bdun pa gang yin pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa brjod pa zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bdun pa gang yin pa 'di yin no //
translated: The seventh case is the reason.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdun pa la rgyu mtshan gyi bdun par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdun pa la rgyu mtshan gyi bdun par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The seventh case, which has the character of existence, is taught to be the reason for the fifth case, which has the character of the cause.

original: de las skyes pa'i shes pa'i rgyu'i lnga pas zhes bya ba ni 'di skye bas 'di skye'o zhes bstan pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i shes pa'i rgyu'i lnga pas zhes bya ba ni 'di skye bas 'di skye'o zhes bstan pa 'di la'o //
translated: From that, the fifth case, which has the character of the cause, of the consciousness that is born from it.

original: de las zhes bya ba'i sgra rgyur brjod pa las lnga pa gang yin pa de rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba'i sgra rgyur brjod pa las lnga pa gang yin pa de rgyu yin la /
translated: The word â€œfromâ€ expresses the cause. The fifth case that is from that is the cause.

original: de las rgyu snga na yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las rgyu snga na yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: From that, the prior existence of the cause is taught.

original: phul du byung ba ci zhig bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phul du byung ba ci zhig bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: What is taught as the most excellent?

original: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything at all.

original: lhan cig byung ba can nyid la 'di yod na zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa nges par rigs la gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byung ba can nyid la 'di yod na zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa nges par rigs la gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of co-occurrence, it is reasonable to posit the seventh case, which has the character of the reason, as â€œwhen this exists.â€ But it cannot be posited.

original: cig car skye ba yin na gcig rgyu mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: cig car skye ba yin na gcig rgyu mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: If they are simultaneously arisen, there is no difference that can be posited as the reason for one being the cause of the other.

original: / de bas na 'di yid na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la yang cig car gnyi ga 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de bas na 'di yid na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la yang cig car gnyi ga 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in the context of the syllogism â€œthis arises when that arises,â€ the meaning of â€œboth arise simultaneouslyâ€ would be accepted.

original: de nyid ni de bas na 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de bas na 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is precisely what is referred to by the phrase â€œtherefore, it is said . . .â€

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na lhan cig 'byung ba nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na lhan cig 'byung ba nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: If this were the case, then the nature of cause and effect would be simultaneous arising.

original: nges pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: nges pa med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: The assertion of the nature of cause and effect would be without any certainty.ğŸ”½For example, it would be like the mind and mental factors.

original: dper na sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bstan par bya ba de'i phyir /ğŸ”½gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bstan par bya ba de'i phyir / gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,ğŸ”½â€œThat which is the cause of one thing . . . â€

original: gang kho nas gcig nyid rgyu yin pa de nyid kyis 'bras bu ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang kho nas gcig nyid rgyu yin pa de nyid kyis 'bras bu ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That which is the cause of one thing is not its effect.

original: rgyu mtshan tha dad pas @97a * //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan tha dad pas @97a * //
translated: Because the reason is different.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni rgyu gcig gis rnam par gzhag pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni rgyu gcig gis rnam par gzhag pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for a single cause to establish both the cause and effect.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i nges pa de dang 'dra ba dag ni zhes bya ba ni snga phyir 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can dag ni'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i nges pa de dang 'dra ba dag ni zhes bya ba ni snga phyir 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can dag ni'o //
translated: â€œThe ascertainment of concomitanceâ€ is the characteristic of occurring in sequence.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la rnam par sdang ba la'o //ğŸ”½gal te 'dis mngal la sogs par sngar lus 'ba' zhig dmigs la /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la rnam par sdang ba la'o // gal te 'dis mngal la sogs par sngar lus 'ba' zhig dmigs la /
translated: â€œIn this caseâ€ refers to the one who is hostile to the world beyond.

original: phyis de'i nus pa las skye ba'i blo dmigs pa de'i tshe 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba nges par 'gyur na /
analyzed: phyis de'i nus pa las skye ba'i blo dmigs pa de'i tshe 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba nges par 'gyur na /
translated: If the body alone is observed in the womb and so on, and later the cognition that arises from its potential is observed, then concomitance would be ascertained.

original: rnam pa 'di srid ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di srid ma yin te /
translated: But this is not possible.

original: thams cad du bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist at all times.

original: rang nyid kyi lus ldog pa ni shi ba las 'gyur zhing de la yang 'di rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang gi ldog pa mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi lus ldog pa ni shi ba las 'gyur zhing de la yang 'di rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gang gi ldog pa mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: The cessation of oneâ€™s own body occurs at death, and in that case it does not exist at all. In that case, how could the cessation of that be observed?

original: ci'i phyir lus de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni shi ba'i lus la'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni shi ba'i lus la'o //
translated: Why is it not the body? It is the other body, the dead body.

original: dus 'dir zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni shi ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: dus 'dir zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni shi ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: At this time? It is the other time, the time of the dead body.

original: lus rten ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dngos po gtso bor gyur pas rten ma yin pa'i phyir zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lus rten ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dngos po gtso bor gyur pas rten ma yin pa'i phyir zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Because it is not the support of the body? The meaning of the expression should be understood as follows: because it is not the support of the body, since the body is the principal thing.

original: blo tsam nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni blo'i khyad par 'dod pa nyid ni smra ba la sogs pa la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo tsam nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni blo'i khyad par 'dod pa nyid ni smra ba la sogs pa la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of mere cognition? The difference in cognition is the cause of desire, speech, etc.

original: gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la /
translated: In the syllogism, â€œWhatever is the effect of something does not occur when that is absent, like the sprout, etc., from its seed, etc.â€

original: ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de ni de na 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de ni de na 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not established. Whatever is the effect of something does not occur when that is absent.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa med pa'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa med pa'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout, etc., does not occur when a seed, etc., is absent.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dbugs dbyung rngub dang / dbang po dang blo'i 'bras bu yin no zhes pa'i sbyor ba bshad pa gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dbugs dbyung rngub dang / dbang po dang blo'i 'bras bu yin no zhes pa'i sbyor ba bshad pa gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is the result of the breath, the sense faculty, and the mind.ğŸ”½The statement, â€œWhatever is the cause of something . . . ,â€ and so on, shows the result.ğŸ”½The statement, â€œWhatever is the cause of something . . . ,â€ and so on, shows the result.

analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan gang zhig ces bya ba ni 'bras bu ston pa'o // gang la gang gi rgyu yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o // de ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The statement, â€œWhatever is the cause of something . . . ,â€ and so on, shows the result.ğŸ”½The statement, â€œWhatever is the cause of something . . . ,â€ and so on, shows the result.

analyzed: yod pa na yod pa'am gnas pa na ldog pa med pa zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ldog pa la rgyu ldog pas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ldog pa la rgyu ldog pas khyab pa'o //
translated: The second type of proof is called â€œthe observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.â€ This means that the cessation of the effect is pervaded by the cessation of the cause.

original: de dang 'gal @97b ba ni rgyu ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal @97b ba ni rgyu ma log pa'o //
translated: The contradiction with that is the non-cessation of the cause.

original: gtan tshigs snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: The phrase â€œthe previous reasonâ€ and so on anticipates an objection by another party.

original: gtan tshigs snga ma ni gang zhig gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma ni gang zhig gang gi tshe /
translated: The previous reason is the one that states:

original: rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œWhen a cause is a collection, then at that time it exists.â€

original: 'di ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is a proof of what is already established.

original: gal te ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask how this is so,

original: gson pa'i lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gson pa'i lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: the response is â€œthe living body . . .â€

original: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa dag gsal bar byed pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa dag gsal bar byed pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase â€œfor this very reasonâ€ means that the reason is the fact that exhalation and inhalation are not the activity of something that exists.

original: gnyis pa yang zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second â€œalsoâ€ means that whatever is a cause of a collection is also existent at the time of the collection.

original: dbugs dbyung rngub kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba de la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung rngub kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba de la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The result of inhalation and exhalation is not ascertained by the presence or absence of inhalation and exhalation.

original: bdag nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'thad pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'thad pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyi 'thad pas so //
translated: â€œBy the reason of oneâ€™s own desireâ€ means by the reason of the desire of the LokÄyatas.

original: de ltar na de yod na yod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de yod na yod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because it follows that it exists when that exists.

original: 'dis dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni sems kyi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa yin na 'thad pa 'dis kyang sems nyid rgyu nyid yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni sems kyi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa yin na 'thad pa 'dis kyang sems nyid rgyu nyid yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that inhalation and exhalation are accepted as the cause of mind. By this reason, it is understood that mind itself is the cause.

original: de nyid dri ba sngon du song bas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dri ba sngon du song bas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that very point, he asks a question:

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos so //
translated: Why is that?

original: sbud pa ni mgar ba dag gi pags pa'i kha sbyar ro //ğŸ”½gang de bum pa skyel ba dang len par byed pa 'di nyid sems kyi dbang po 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sbud pa ni mgar ba dag gi pags pa'i kha sbyar ro // gang de bum pa skyel ba dang len par byed pa 'di nyid sems kyi dbang po 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: The bellows are the two skins joined together by a smith.

original: bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: The action of the bellows is the action of the mind, not the nature of the pot.

original: de ni nye bar len pa snga ma snga ma la rag lus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nye bar len pa snga ma snga ma la rag lus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For the pot is dependent on the previous action of the bellows.

original: bskyel ba dang len par byed pa de nyid kyang 'bad rtsol bar byed pa de ltar na gang las ma nges pa nyid yin //ğŸ”½bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni sems kyi dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: bskyel ba dang len par byed pa de nyid kyang 'bad rtsol bar byed pa de ltar na gang las ma nges pa nyid yin // bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni sems kyi dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: And the action of the bellows is not the nature of the pot, because it is not the case that whenever there is the action of the bellows, there is the pot.ğŸ”½The nature of the pot is not the action of the mind, because it is not the case that whenever there is the action of the mind, there is the pot.

original: de la sems sngon du song ba can med na yang gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sems sngon du song ba can med na yang gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And the action of the mind is not the nature of the pot, because it is not the case that whenever there is the nature of the pot, there is the action of the mind.ğŸ”½Thus, the nature of the pot is not the action of the mind.ğŸ”½And the nature of the pot is not the nature of the mind, because it is not the case that whenever there is the nature of the mind, there is the pot.ğŸ”½Thus, the nature of the pot is not the nature of the mind.

original: don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i bya ba mi 'dod pa skad cig mar smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa'i bum pa'i yul gzhan du 'byung ba nyid 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i bya ba mi 'dod pa skad cig mar smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa'i bum pa'i yul gzhan du 'byung ba nyid 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But donâ€™t you Buddhists who advocate momentariness say that the going and coming of a pot to and from another place is not an action that is a different object?

original: de yang 'bad rtsol las 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de yang 'bad rtsol las 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: And if that is due to effort,

original: ji ltar na bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'bad rtsol las ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'bad rtsol las ma yin /
translated: how is it that the nature of the pot is not due to effort?

original: gang gis na rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen las zhes brjod @98a * //
analyzed: gang gis na rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen las zhes brjod @98a * //
translated: Why is it said that its nature is due to its own substantial cause?

original: ce na ; bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba can ni 'bad rtsol las 'gyur ba de nyid ni bden te /
analyzed: ce na ; bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba can ni 'bad rtsol las 'gyur ba de nyid ni bden te /
translated: It is true that the nature of the pot, which occurs in the states of going and so on, is due to effort.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa bum pa rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa bum pa rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But going and coming and so on are not different from the nature of the pot.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen las zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni bum pa'i rgyu la ltos pas yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen las zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni bum pa'i rgyu la ltos pas yin no //
translated: The statement that its nature is due to its own substantial cause is because it depends on the cause of the pot.

original: bum pa'i rgyun thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'grub par byed pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i rgyun thams cad 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'grub par byed pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: The continuum of the pot is not produced by the exertion that establishes the going and coming,

original: de las sngar yang bum pa'i dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las sngar yang bum pa'i dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pot is observed prior to that.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang sems nyid las dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang sems nyid las dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The in-breath and out-breath are also observed in the mind itself.

original: de ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: He says, â€œThat is, in the case of the in-breath and out-breath, etc.â€

original: 'dod pa med pa na zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gis kun nas slong ba 'dod pa med pa na 'ga' zhig gi tshe ldog pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa na zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gis kun nas slong ba 'dod pa med pa na 'ga' zhig gi tshe ldog pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: â€œWithout desireâ€ means that when there is no desire to be motivated by the in-breath and out-breath, sometimes they do not cease,

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe bzlog pa med pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe bzlog pa med pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because sometimes they do not cease. This is the meaning of â€œit does not exist.â€

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bor zhes bya bar smos so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bor zhes bya bar smos so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For that very reason, he says, â€œin its own nature.â€

original: gang zhig sems kyi dbang gis rang gi ngo bor 'jug par dang ldog pa de ni zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig sems kyi dbang gis rang gi ngo bor 'jug par dang ldog pa de ni zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the compound â€œsvabhÄva-pravá¹›tti-nivá¹›tti-vaÅ›Ätâ€ is to be analyzed as â€œsvabhÄvasya pravá¹›tti-nivá¹›tti-vaÅ›Ät.â€

original: yod par rab tu grags pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni yod par 'jug pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: yod par rab tu grags pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni yod par 'jug pa can gyi'o //
translated: â€œPrajÃ±Äyateâ€ means â€œpravartate.â€

original: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid thob pa ni 'jug pa yin te de byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid thob pa ni 'jug pa yin te de byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œPravarttayatiâ€ means â€œto cause to obtain the nature of manifestation, which is the state of being established in the nature of potentiality.â€

original: sngar 'jug pa khas len na zhes bya ba ni gal te yod par rab tu grags pa can gyis gsal bar byed pa yin pa de'i tshe mngal la sogs pa dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa las sngar sems nyid kyi 'jug pa khas len pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar 'jug pa khas len na zhes bya ba ni gal te yod par rab tu grags pa can gyis gsal bar byed pa yin pa de'i tshe mngal la sogs pa dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa las sngar sems nyid kyi 'jug pa khas len pa yin te /
translated: â€œIf you admit that there is prior manifestationâ€ means that if you admit that manifestation is due to what is well known as existent, then you must admit that the mind is manifested prior to the manifestation of the breath in the womb, etc.

original: dper na sgron ma thag nye ba las sngar bum pa'i 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgron ma thag nye ba las sngar bum pa'i 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the manifestation of the pot is prior to the manifestation of the lamp.

original: de bas na yod pa nyid du khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na yod pa nyid du khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it follows, absurdly, that you must accept that the breath exists prior to the manifestation of the breath.

original: yod pa nyid ni ji skad du bshad pa'i 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de ltar na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med par yang sems nyid yod par khas len pa dang ; shi ba'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gsal bar byed pa dag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ji skad du bshad pa'i 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de ltar na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med par yang sems nyid yod par khas len pa dang ; shi ba'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gsal bar byed pa dag med pa'i phyir /
translated: because existence is just the nature of engagement as it has been explained.

original: sems med pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sems med pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is clear that the assertion that mind exists even without inhalation and exhalation, and that the body of a dead person is mindless because inhalation and exhalation are absent, is untenable.

original: yang na 'jug par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis par 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'jug par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis par 'chad pa yin te /
translated: Or, the phrase â€œbecause it engagesâ€ is explained as a second alternative.

original: de la gal te de dag gis sems zhes bya ba @98b la sogs pas skyon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te de dag gis sems zhes bya ba @98b la sogs pas skyon bstan pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the error is indicated by the words â€œIf they say that mind exists, etc.â€

original: 'grib pa ni phyir ba'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa ni phyir ba'o //
translated: â€œDiminutionâ€ is the reverse of â€œincrease.â€

original: de dag thal 'gyur mtshungs na yang //
analyzed: de dag thal 'gyur mtshungs na yang //
translated: Even though the reductio is the same in both cases,

original: zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gsal bar byed bdag med pa'i phyir sems nyid med do zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dang / shi ba'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang ci'i phyir med pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gsal bar byed bdag med pa'i phyir sems nyid med do zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dang / shi ba'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang ci'i phyir med pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the same as the objection and examination: â€œSince there is no self, there is no mind,â€ and â€œWhy is it that there is no in-breath and out-breath in a dead body?â€

original: ji ltar shi ba'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar shi ba'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that very point with, â€œJust as in the case of a dead body . . . â€

original: rjes su 'chad par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu ni sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'chad par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu ni sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'o //
translated: The cause of the subsequent explanation is the former and former moments of mind.

original: 'phen par byed pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel ba ni 'phen par byed pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel ba ni 'phen par byed pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on â€œimpellingâ€ is â€œimpelling . . . â€

original: de skad du 'phen par byed pa'i las nyid kyi de lta bu'i sems kyi rgyun mi nus pa'i khyad par dgos pas gang dus de srid du lus de dang lhan cig sems gnas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du 'phen par byed pa'i las nyid kyi de lta bu'i sems kyi rgyun mi nus pa'i khyad par dgos pas gang dus de srid du lus de dang lhan cig sems gnas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the special power of the projecting karma is the cause of the mind-continuum, and that the mind remains with the body for a certain period of time.

original: gal te sdong bu la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: gal te sdong bu la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: If it is like a stump, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na sdong bu la sogs pa sgron ma la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de dang 'dra bar lus kyang sems kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper na sdong bu la sogs pa sgron ma la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de dang 'dra bar lus kyang sems kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase, â€œIf it is like a stump, etc.,â€ is that just as a stump, etc., is the cause of a flame, etc., the body is the cause of the mind.

original: gal te sdong bu la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i yon tan ci zhig ston ce na /
analyzed: gal te sdong bu la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i yon tan ci zhig ston ce na /
translated: If it is like a stump, etc., what quality is demonstrated?

original: gang gi tshe sdong bu la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdong bu la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When a stump, etc., is the cause of a flame, etc.,

original: shi ba'i dus na lus rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa dag gis nus pa med par byas pa des na /
analyzed: shi ba'i dus na lus rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa dag gis nus pa med par byas pa des na /
translated: at the time of death, the body is deprived of its power by wind, bile, etc.,ğŸ”½and the mind is not able to remain in the body.

original: gang zhig gang rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub pa yin par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi tsha rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub pa yin par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi tsha rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'gyur te /
translated: â€œThe reason is not establishedâ€ means that the reason is not established in the example.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi myu gu 'byung ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la ma grub pa'o //ğŸ”½shi ba'i lus la nye ba mnyam gyur tshe //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi myu gu 'byung ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la ma grub pa'o // shi ba'i lus la nye ba mnyam gyur tshe //
translated: The reason is not established in the example because the reason is not established in the thesis statement, â€œWhatever is a collection of causes of something is that at that time.â€

original: zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa'i nyes pa gang gis srog chags shi ba na de rang nyid ldog par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa'i nyes pa gang gis srog chags shi ba na de rang nyid ldog par 'gyur zhing /
translated: â€œWhen the body is near death, the faults are the sameâ€ means that when a living being dies due to a fault such as a fever, that fault itself is eliminated.

original: nyes pa ldog pa yang mnyam par 'gyur ba yin no //ğŸ”½nyes pa 'khrugs pa'i ngo bo can gyi nad med pa na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes pa ldog pa yang mnyam par 'gyur ba yin no // nyes pa 'khrugs pa'i ngo bo can gyi nad med pa na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œWhen the faults are eliminated, the body is the same.â€

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams 'khrugs pa nyid kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams 'khrugs pa nyid kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: â€œWhen the body is free from disease, the faults are the sameâ€ means that the faults such as wind are the same in nature when they are disturbed.

original: rang bzhin ga la yod pa zhes bya bar tshigs rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ga la yod pa zhes bya bar tshigs rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Where is there any nature?

original: de nye ba tsam la rag lus pas 'jug pa can nyid la gags byed pa med na yod pas khyab @99a * //
analyzed: de nye ba tsam la rag lus pas 'jug pa can nyid la gags byed pa med na yod pas khyab @99a * //
translated: The mere presence of the object is the cause of the cognition, and when there is no obstruction to the cognition, it is present.

original: pa yin te /
analyzed: pa yin te /
translated: The pervasion is this:

original: de dang 'gal ba ni med pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni med pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The absence of the object is the contradiction of the presence of the cognition, and the perception of the contradiction of the pervader is the perception of the absence of the pervaded.

original: sems de ldog pa ni med ces bya ba ni yang 'ong ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems de ldog pa ni med ces bya ba ni yang 'ong ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition does not cease means that it does not return.

original: yang 'ong ba ni ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: yang 'ong ba ni ldog pa yin te /
translated: Return is cessation.

original: dper na grong du song nas log / ces bya ba lta bu'o //ğŸ”½'das ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na grong du song nas log / ces bya ba lta bu'o // 'das ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, it is like saying, â€œHaving gone to the village, I returned.â€

original: me nye ba tsam la rag lus pas 'jug pa can gyi shing sol bar gyur pa na yang me med pa na yang phyir shin tu 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me nye ba tsam la rag lus pas 'jug pa can gyi shing sol bar gyur pa na yang me med pa na yang phyir shin tu 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The immediately preceding reason is uncertain, because when the wood becomes charcoal, the mere presence of the fire is the cause of the cognition, and even when there is no fire, it does not change at all, and the reason applies to the dissimilar class.

original: 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs na yang rims la sogs pa'i gso ba byed par mi 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs na yang rims la sogs pa'i gso ba byed par mi 'gyur na'o //
translated: and even when alive, he would not be cured of a disease such as smallpox.

original: cung zad tshig pa ni chung ba'o //
analyzed: cung zad tshig pa ni chung ba'o //
translated: â€œA little burnedâ€ means â€œslightly burned.â€

original: de skad du phyir log pa srid pa can yod na gang zhig gang med na yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar na khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba rtsom pa nyid la gso bya ma yin pa'i 'gyur ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad du phyir log pa srid pa can yod na gang zhig gang med na yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar na khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba rtsom pa nyid la gso bya ma yin pa'i 'gyur ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: Thus, if the reversal of the reason is possible, then the reason, which is qualified by the reversal, is not present in the dissimilar example, since it is not present in the dissimilar example.ğŸ”½Moreover, the statement â€œthe one who is to be cured is pervaded by the state of being subject to changeâ€ is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: de dang 'gal ba gso bar bya ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba gso bar bya ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The state of being subject to change is the opposite of the state of being not subject to change.

original: rang dang 'brel pa'i dus ni rang yod pa nyid kyi dus so //
analyzed: rang dang 'brel pa'i dus ni rang yod pa nyid kyi dus so //
translated: The time of the relation is the time of the existence of the reason.

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: shi ba'i nyes pa mnyam 'gyur tshe //
analyzed: shi ba'i nyes pa mnyam 'gyur tshe //
translated: then when the fault of death occurs,

original: phyir yang skye ba dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phyir yang skye ba dag tu 'gyur //
translated: there will be rebirth again.

original: zhes bya ba'i nyes pa'i 'di gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i nyes pa'i 'di gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the fault that is present.

original: gzhan du gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mi nyid du de kho na nyid bzhir gyur pa de las dus gzhan du srog chags gzhan nyid du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mi nyid du de kho na nyid bzhir gyur pa de las dus gzhan du srog chags gzhan nyid du gyur pa na'o //
translated: When there is a transformation, when that very person becomes another, at another time, when he becomes another living being.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan skad cig ma ma yin pa smra ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan skad cig ma ma yin pa smra ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference, because there is no difference between the other, who is not a momentary entity, and the elements.

original: 'byung ba rnams gzhan du gyur pa la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams gzhan du gyur pa la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no /
translated: Even when the elements are transformed, there is no difference.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa /
translated: Book 44

original: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin tsam las yang 'byung ba'i ngang tshul sems gang la yod pa de ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin tsam las yang 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin tsam las yang 'byung ba'i ngang tshul sems gang la yod pa de ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin tsam las yang 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: That mind which has the nature of mere elements and also has the nature of arising from mere elements is one that has the nature of arising from mere elements.

original: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni shing ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni shing ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that very time means at the time of the body of the potter. This is the meaning.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gyur pa gzhan la yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //ğŸ”½de ni gyur pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la @99b sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gyur pa gzhan la yang 'gyur ba ma yin no // de ni gyur pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la @99b sogs pa smos te /
translated: Nor is it in some cases. This means that it is not in other transformations either.ğŸ”½As for the untenability of transformation itself, he says, â€œIt is not tenable that the nature of the elements transforms into something else,â€ and so on.

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las ma 'phos par gyur pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las ma 'phos par gyur pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is not tenable that the nature of the elements does not move from its own nature and yet transforms into something else.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin las 'phos pa med pa yang gyur par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin las 'phos pa med pa yang gyur par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also not tenable that the nature of the elements does not move from its own nature and yet transforms into something else.

original: nyes pa ni 'ba' zhig rims la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba'i rgyu khas len pa na /
analyzed: nyes pa ni 'ba' zhig rims la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba'i rgyu khas len pa na /
translated: The fault is that if you accept that the cause of the transformation of fever and so on is the elements,

original: gang gi tshe nyes pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po bsten pa byas pa de'i tshe yod na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyes pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po bsten pa byas pa de'i tshe yod na /
translated: then when you rely on a remedy that is compatible with that fault,

original: gso bya med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gso bya med pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that there is nothing to be cured.

original: 'di ltar las mi mthun pa gzhan mi 'dod pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar las mi mthun pa gzhan mi 'dod pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: This is because when you do not desire another incompatible action,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni s'a lu la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni s'a lu la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: And external things also means rice, etc.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pas rgyu char mi 'bab pa la sogs pa mtshungs pa dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pas rgyu char mi 'bab pa la sogs pa mtshungs pa dag la yang ngo //
translated: And in the case of similar things, such as the non-falling of rain due to fear, etc.

original: de'i sos zin pa bcad pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i sos bzung ba bcad pa las zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sos zin pa bcad pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i sos bzung ba bcad pa las zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: And from the cutting of what has been seized by it means from the cutting of what has been seized by it.

original: ji srid sos zin pa son pa de srid du lus la dug gis khyab par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji srid sos zin pa son pa de srid du lus la dug gis khyab par 'gyur la /
translated: As long as what has been seized by it is present, the poison spreads throughout the body.

original: shi ba na bzung ba'i phyogs nyid du dug phyir log nas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: shi ba na bzung ba'i phyogs nyid du dug phyir log nas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
translated: When one dies, the poison returns to the very place where it was seized and remains there. This is the rule.

original: de nyid ni lus la khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni lus la khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains just that with â€œIt spreads throughout the body, etc.â€

original: de ltar na gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin par bzung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin par bzung ba yang ngo //
translated: Thus, also means also in the case of untimely seizure.

original: sos bzung ba bcad pa'am gnyen po la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las kyang dus su bzung ba de ci slar yang 'tsho ma'i 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sos bzung ba bcad pa'am gnyen po la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las kyang dus su bzung ba de ci slar yang 'tsho ma'i 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if it is grasped at the proper time, it is not grasped again, because it is cut off or because of the application of a remedy.

original: bzung ba gcig nyid ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe zad pa can no //ğŸ”½dus gzhan du 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzung ba gcig nyid ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe zad pa can no // dus gzhan du 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œThe same graspingâ€ means that when it is grasped at the proper time, it is grasped at the proper time.ğŸ”½â€œBecause of living at another timeâ€ means that when the body is grasped at the proper time, it is grasped at the proper time.

original: gang gi tshe dus su bzung ba'i lus skams pa la sogs par gyur pa thob pa na srog chags kyi khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dus su bzung ba'i lus skams pa la sogs par gyur pa thob pa na srog chags kyi khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is grasped at the proper time, it is grasped at the proper time.

original: gal te 'tsho ba ni 'gyur ba la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba la dus ma yin par bzung ba ni 'byung bar gyur pa'i khyad par brten pa yin na /

analyzed: de nyid ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
