original: gang la 'gyur ba skye ba'i nus pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'gyur ba skye ba'i nus pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthat which has the potential to generate changeâ€ is a bahuvrÄ«hi compound.

original: de ni 'di'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de 'gyur ba med pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu gang la yod pa zhes 'dir yang 'bru mang po bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de 'gyur ba med pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu gang la yod pa zhes 'dir yang 'bru mang po bya'o //
translated: The root text states, â€œIt is not the cause of that,â€ meaning that it is not the cause of the change of that. The phrase â€œthat which has the potential to generate changeâ€ is also a bahuvrÄ«hi compound.

original: de rgyu can zhes bya ba ni gang la lus de'i rgyu yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //ğŸ”½de nyid ni lus kyi rgyu can zhes bya bar 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de rgyu can zhes bya ba ni gang la lus de'i rgyu yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //ğŸ”½de nyid ni lus kyi rgyu can zhes bya bar 'chad par byed do //
translated: The phrase â€œthat which is caused by thatâ€ is a bahuvrÄ«hi compound that means â€œthat which has the body as its cause.â€ğŸ”½The root text explains that the phrase â€œcaused by the bodyâ€ is a bahuvrÄ«hi compound.

original: de rgyu can gyi 'bras bu skyed @101b pa ni zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: de rgyu can gyi 'bras bu skyed @101b pa ni zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i drug pa'o //
translated: The result that is produced by that is the sixth case of common locus.

original: lus kyi rgyu can gyi 'bras bu skye ba gang yin pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu can gyi 'bras bu skye ba gang yin pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result that is produced by the body?

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i ming can gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i ming can gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, â€œthat which is called the embryo and so on.â€

original: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / mkhrang 'gyur dang / rka lag 'gyus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs la nur nur po la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / mkhrang 'gyur dang / rka lag 'gyus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs la nur nur po la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to //
translated: The condition of the body, which is called the embryo and so on, is taught by the words embryo and so on.

original: 'bras bu skyed pa ni zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa ni zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the words â€œthat which is produced as a resultâ€ is

original: lus kyi gnas skabs phyi ma'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu skyed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas skabs phyi ma'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu skyed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œthat which produces a result that has the characteristics of a later condition of the body.â€ğŸ”½Without that,

original: de med par zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa med par ro //
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa med par ro //
translated: without mental consciousness.

original: 'bras bu gcig la so sor nges pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig la so sor nges pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The text shows that they are coexistent because they are determined to be the same result.

original: me dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: me dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase â€œfire and the melting of the copperâ€ is an example.

original: dper na zangs ma zhu ba nyid du 'byung ba la me lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na zangs ma zhu ba nyid du 'byung ba la me lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, fire is the cooperating cause of the melting of copper.

original: de dang lhan cig gnas pa yin gyi nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin pa de bzhin du lus dang sems dag kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig gnas pa yin gyi nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin pa de bzhin du lus dang sems dag kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase â€œin the same way, the body and mindâ€ is that the body and mind are like fire and the copper, respectively.

original: lus dang sems dag la yang de skad du zhes bya ba ni lhan cig gnas par nges pa med do //
analyzed: lus dang sems dag la yang de skad du zhes bya ba ni lhan cig gnas par nges pa med do //
translated: The phrase â€œthe same is true of the body and mindâ€ means that there is no certainty that they exist in the same place.

original: sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni lus med par gzugs med pa'i khams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni lus med par gzugs med pa'i khams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase â€œthis has already been explainedâ€ means that this has already been explained in the statement, â€œMental consciousness exists in the formless realm without a body.â€

original: yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang spyi dang de dag dang por byas pa ga la yod pa zhes bya ba zlas dbye ba snying po can gyi 'bru mang po po'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang spyi dang de dag dang por byas pa ga la yod pa zhes bya ba zlas dbye ba snying po can gyi 'bru mang po po'o //
translated: The phrase â€œquality, universal, etc.â€ is a compound word with an implied â€œnaâ€ particle, meaning â€œwhere is there a quality, universal, etc. that is first produced?â€

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni las gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni las gzung ngo //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ includes action.

original: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
analyzed: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
translated: Because existence and nonexistence have no support.

original: zhes bya ba ni byed pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ka byed pa po'i drug pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byed pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ka byed pa po'i drug pa yin te /
translated: This is a genitive tatpurusa compound, with the suffix -tva added to the end.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag ni gzhan gyi rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag ni gzhan gyi rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because existence and nonexistence have no other support.

original: de ni yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with the words â€œthat which exists . . . â€ and so on.

original: rten nyid la brten pa phul du phyin pa byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: rten nyid la brten pa phul du phyin pa byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: The support itself is the most important thing, because it is the basis of the action.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang mi byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang mi byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is pervaded by the fact that it does not perform the contradictory action. Thus, there is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: med pa'i rten ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni dngos po bsgrub pa'i gzhir mngon par 'dod pa rten du 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: med pa'i rten ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni dngos po bsgrub pa'i gzhir mngon par 'dod pa rten du 'dod pa yin na /
translated: It is not a non-existent basis.

original: ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba'i med pa yang rten du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba'i med pa yang rten du 'gyur te /
translated: If another is asserted as a basis for the establishment of an entity, then even a non-existent thing, like the horn of a rabbit, would be a basis.

original: gal te 'o na ji ltar na rgyu tha snyad du byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ji ltar na rgyu tha snyad du byed ce na /
translated: If one says, â€œWell then, how is a cause conventionally designated?â€

original: de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½skyed par byed @102a * //
analyzed: de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te / skyed par byed @102a * //
translated: It is said, â€œThat also arises from its own cause.â€

original: pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Because it is a producer, it is a cause of that.

original: rten gyi dngos pos ni ma yin te rten med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rten gyi dngos pos ni ma yin te rten med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But it is not a basis, because there is no basis. This is the meaning.

original: rten gzhan rten du gyur pa la brten pa yod pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba ni med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rten gzhan rten du gyur pa la brten pa yod pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba ni med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The existence of a dependent thing is pervaded by the existence of another basis that is a basis. The opposite of that is non-existence. Thus, there is the observation of an opposite of the pervader.

original: yod pa'i rten yang sbyor ba dang po la zlog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yod pa'i rten yang sbyor ba dang po la zlog pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t the existence of a basis also refuted in the first syllogism?

original: de ji ltar na rten nyid la yod pa nyid kyis khyab par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na rten nyid la yod pa nyid kyis khyab par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be that the existence of something in a basis is pervaded by the existence of the basis itself?

original: bden te 'on kyang gzhan rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i sgo nas /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang gzhan rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i sgo nas /
translated: It is true, but still, because of the other, the relation of basis and based,ğŸ”½the existence of the basis and that which is based are simultaneous.

original: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi dngos po lhan cig par gyur pa dag 'dod pa'i phyir de'i bsam pas de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi dngos po lhan cig par gyur pa dag 'dod pa'i phyir de'i bsam pas de skad du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said in that sense.

original: gal te ma yin rten yod pa //
analyzed: gal te ma yin rten yod pa //
translated: If it is not so, the existence of the basis

original: gnas pa'i rgyu ni yin zhe na //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu ni yin zhe na //
translated: is the cause of its endurance.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: This is the anticipation of an objection from another.

original: de'i rten du mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rten du mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains it with â€œbecause it is asserted as the basis of that.â€

original: snga ma ma grub pa yin zhing zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang la cung zad kyang mi byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ma grub pa yin zhing zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang la cung zad kyang mi byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: â€œThe former is not establishedâ€ refers to the reason that was explained with â€œthat which does not do anything at all.â€

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni gang med pa de rten med pa'i sgo nas 'ga' zhig rten du gyur pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba ni'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni gang med pa de rten med pa'i sgo nas 'ga' zhig rten du gyur pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba ni'o //
translated: â€œAnotherâ€ means that which does not exist, and it is not the case that it is the basis of something, because it has no basis.

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni med pa'i rten khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni med pa'i rten khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œBecause it is not acceptedâ€ means that the basis of non-existence is not accepted.

original: rten ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
analyzed: rten ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
translated: â€œIt is not a basisâ€ and so on is the statement of the conclusion.

original: gnas pa po bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gnas pa po'i rang bzhin nyid gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa po bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gnas pa po'i rang bzhin nyid gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œThe nature of the one who enduresâ€ means the nature of the one who endures is endurance.

original: tha dad na yang zhes bya ba ni mdo yin la /
analyzed: tha dad na yang zhes bya ba ni mdo yin la /
translated: â€œEven if they are differentâ€ is the sÅ«tra.

original: de'i bshad pa ni gnas pa po las gnas pa don tha dad pa'i ngo bos yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni gnas pa po las gnas pa don tha dad pa'i ngo bos yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is â€œIf endurance is different in meaning from the one who endures.â€

original: don gzhan du gyur pa la don gzhan du byas pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa la don gzhan du byas pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: There is no such thing as â€œthat which has become different in meaning becomes different in meaning.â€

original: de'i 'brel pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni rten mngon par 'dod pas brten pa la gnas tha dad pas byas pa gang yin pa de ni brten pa dang 'brel pa can yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni rten mngon par 'dod pas brten pa la gnas tha dad pas byas pa gang yin pa de ni brten pa dang 'brel pa can yin no //
translated: â€œThat which is related to itâ€ is that which is made different by the support, since the supported is manifestly desired.

original: de la brten pa dang 'brel pa can gyi gnas byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa dang 'brel pa can gyi gnas byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is related to the support.

original: rten du mngon par 'dod pa'i de phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten du mngon par 'dod pa'i de phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to understand that which is manifestly desired as a support to be a benefactor.

original: gnas par byed pa dang 'dra bar gnas pa can gyi gnas pa'i rten nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa dang 'dra bar gnas pa can gyi gnas pa'i rten nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because, like the support, the support of the supported is not established.

original: dper na gnas par byed pa'i gnas par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'i rten du grub pa ma yin @102b te /
analyzed: dper na gnas par byed pa'i gnas par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'i rten du grub pa ma yin @102b te /
translated: For example, the support of that which is to be supported by the support is not established,

original: phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not benefit.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa can gyi gnas pa'i rten nyid grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa can gyi gnas pa'i rten nyid grub pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the support of the supported is not established.

original: gnas pa can gyi gnas par bya ba des kyang gnas pa cung zad kyang byas pa med de /
analyzed: gnas pa can gyi gnas par bya ba des kyang gnas pa cung zad kyang byas pa med de /
translated: Because that which is to be supported by the supported does not perform any supporting at all.

original: de ni gnas par byed pa nyid las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas par byed pa nyid las skyes pa yin no //
translated: It is produced from the very act of enduring.

original: skyes pa la yang gnas par bya bas ci zhig byas na gang gis na rten du 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes pa la yang gnas par bya bas ci zhig byas na gang gis na rten du 'gyur /
translated: And what is the use of enduring what has already arisen, so that it becomes a basis?

original: de bas na de dang 'brel pa can gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dang 'brel pa can gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is related to it is not enduring.

original: ci ste gnas pa can gyis gnas pa cung zhig kyang byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang gnas pa nyid kyis 'di gnas par bya ba yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa can gyis gnas pa cung zhig kyang byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang gnas pa nyid kyis 'di gnas par bya ba yin pa de bas na /
translated: But if you say that the endurer does not cause the endurance of anything at all, but rather that endurance itself causes the endurance of that,

original: de'i 'brel pa can gnas par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa can gnas par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: and therefore that which is related to it is endurance,

original: gal te gnas par byas pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gnas pa po rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gnas par byas pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gnas pa po rtag pa yin te /
translated: then if it is said that â€œit endures because it is made to endure,â€ etc., the endurer is permanent,

original: 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: because it is not destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa po sems nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa po sems nyid yin la /
translated: The endurer is the mind itself,

original: de 'byung ba rnams kyis gnas par bya ba yin na de ni rtag tu nye ba nyid yin te 'byung ba rnams rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'byung ba rnams kyis gnas par bya ba yin na de ni rtag tu nye ba nyid yin te 'byung ba rnams rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and if it is made to endure by the elements, then it is always present, because the elements are permanent.

original: gal te de gnas par byed pa yin pa de bas na sems gnas pa por mngon par 'dod par 'jig pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de gnas par byed pa yin pa de bas na sems gnas pa por mngon par 'dod par 'jig pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the cause of endurance, then the mind would be the endurer, and it would not be destroyed.

original: de ni gnas par bya ba 'byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gnas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni gnas par bya ba 'byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gnas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu says, â€œThe cause of endurance is the arising of the elements that are the basis of endurance.â€ The meaning of â€œcause of enduranceâ€ is the meaning of â€œbasis of endurance.â€

original: gnas par byed pa nyid ni gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa nyid ni gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Endurance is dependent on the cause of endurance.

original: bye brag pa yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ni tshig gi don yon tan gyi gnas par byed pa 'dod do //ğŸ”½dang po tshig pas sngo bsangs skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag pa yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ni tshig gi don yon tan gyi gnas par byed pa 'dod do // dang po tshig pas sngo bsangs skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The Vaise~ika also asserts that the substance of a pot, etc., is the cause of the endurance of the qualities that are its effects.

original: gal te de'i bum pa gnas par byed pa yin na de las ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i bum pa gnas par byed pa yin na de las ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the pot is the cause of the endurance of its own qualities, then the pot would not be destroyed when its qualities are destroyed.

original: de bzhin du so btang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan phyi ma phyi ma'i nus pa 'joms par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du so btang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan phyi ma phyi ma'i nus pa 'joms par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the qualities that arise from the melting of butter would destroy the potency of the later qualities that arise from the melting of butter.

original: de ltar na 'di'i gnas pa nyid du rtog par byed pa don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di'i gnas pa nyid du rtog par byed pa don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is meaningful to conceive of this as â€œenduring.â€

original: 'joms par byed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'joms par byed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to destroy it,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu thag nye ba can dngos po 'jig par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu thag nye ba can dngos po 'jig par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that things are destroyed by the proximity of the cause of destruction.

original: de las 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ It has the property of being destroyedâ€ means

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig ba'i chos can te /
translated: that it has the property of being destroyed by the cause of destruction.

original: gzhan gyi khas blangs nas 'di skad du bstan to //ğŸ”½de lta bur gyur pa de 'jig pa'i chos nyid sgrub par byed pa 'jig pa'i rgyu med na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi khas blangs nas 'di skad du bstan to // de lta bur gyur pa de 'jig pa'i chos nyid sgrub par byed pa 'jig pa'i rgyu med na /
translated: This is taught by way of the opponentâ€™s view.ğŸ”½If that which has such a nature, which has the property of being destroyed,

original: bdag nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur na de ltar gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya ste cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur na de ltar gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya ste cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: does not itself cease without a cause of destruction, then what use is there in positing a cause of endurance? It is completely useless.

original: ci de las zhes bya ba ni gnas par bya ba'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: ci de las zhes bya ba ni gnas par bya ba'i rgyu las so //
translated: â€œ What is the point of that?â€ means â€œWhat is the point of a cause of endurance?â€

original: @103a * // dus de srid du zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: @103a * // dus de srid du zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: â€œ For that longâ€ means â€œuntil the cause of destruction arises.â€

original: 'jig pa dngos chos nyid ces bya ba ni ci de las zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos chos nyid ces bya ba ni ci de las zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthe reality of destructionâ€ should be connected with the previous phrase, â€œfrom that.â€

original: ci gnas pa'i rgyu de las 'jig rgyu dang phrad kyi bar du gnas pa yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'jig pa'i dngos po'i chos nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci gnas pa'i rgyu de las 'jig rgyu dang phrad kyi bar du gnas pa yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'jig pa'i dngos po'i chos nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that an entity endures as long as it does not come in contact with the cause of its destruction, then it would follow, absurdly, that it would obtain the reality of destruction.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this in the following passage:

original: 'di la gnod pa med can zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i rgyus gnod par bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa med can zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i rgyus gnod par bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: â€œIt is not subject to harmâ€ means that it is not subject to harm by the cause of endurance.

original: rnam pa gzhan byed pa na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan byed ba na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan byed pa na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan byed ba na'o //
translated: â€œWhen it takes on another aspectâ€ means when it takes on an aspect that is different from its nature of destruction.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i chos can no //
translated: â€œAnotherâ€ means that which is not subject to destruction.

original: de de ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa snga ma'i'o //
analyzed: de de ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa snga ma'i'o //
translated: â€œHow could it be that?â€ means â€œhow could it be that it is subject to destruction?â€

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can ni rnam pa gzhan nyid du gnas par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can ni rnam pa gzhan nyid du gnas par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that what has the nature of destruction does not remain in another form,

original: rang bzhin las gzhan nyid ma yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //ğŸ”½yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin las gzhan nyid ma yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna says, â€œEven if it is not different from its nature,â€ and so on.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthat which has the property of arising in different placesâ€ means

original: rang gi nye bar len pa'i yul las yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can rnams ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa'i yul las yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can rnams ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that which has the property of arising in a place that is different from its own appropriated place.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni chu la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyi 'gro ba'i chos can snod la sogs pa'i yul dang 'brel pas 'byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa nyid du gyur pas na snod la sogs pas rten gyi tha snyad thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni chu la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyi 'gro ba'i chos can snod la sogs pa'i yul dang 'brel pas 'byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa nyid du gyur pas na snod la sogs pas rten gyi tha snyad thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba
translated: The point of this is that water and so on, which have the property of naturally flowing, become the cooperative conditions for arising in dependence on a place such as a container. Therefore, such things as a container are said to obtain the designation of a support.

original: 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di yin no //
translated: This is the point.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni khas len pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni khas len pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œMoreoverâ€ indicates that he is stating his acceptance.

original: gzhan yon tan la sogs pa dag la 'gro bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan yon tan la sogs pa dag la 'gro bar mi 'dod de /
translated: He does not assert that such things as water flow in other things such as qualities.

original: lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are not corporeal.

original: tha mi dad par grub pa dag ni dbyer med par grub pa'o //ğŸ”½rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can 'phrod pa 'du ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad par grub pa dag ni dbyer med par grub pa'o // rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can 'phrod pa 'du ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those that are established as not different are established as inseparable.ğŸ”½The characteristic of the relation of support and supported is conjunction.

original: rten dang brten pa'i bdag nyid can kho na 'phrod pa'i 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i bdag nyid can kho na 'phrod pa'i 'du ba yin no //

original: de ltar na 'di ni 'dir blo'i rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni 'dir blo'i rgyur 'dod do //

original: gzhan las byung ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i yang 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu pa dag la sogs pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan las byung ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i yang 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu pa dag la sogs pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: The cause of pleasure and pain, etc., which arise from another, is conjunction, etc.

analyzed: ba lang gi gong bu nyid yin gyi rta la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs rnam par gzhag pa nyid yin no //
translated: The cow is the cause of the cow, but not the horse, etc. This is the establishment of the species.

original: chos can 'di las chos 'di gnas pa zhes bya ba ni snam bu la dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos can 'di las chos 'di gnas pa zhes bya ba ni snam bu la dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This property resides in this subject, e.g., white resides in cloth, etc.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri la sogs pa ste /
translated: Form derived from the elements is form, sound, smell, taste, and so on.

original: 'byung ba rnams la @103b brten nas gnas pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams la @103b brten nas gnas pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with the statement, â€œIt exists in dependence on the elements.â€

original: 'di yang rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang rang gi sde pa bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is also the belief of the VaibhÄá¹£ikas, our own schools.

original: bshad pa'i don bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa'i don bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the explanation is summarized in the following verse:

original: 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur //

analyzed: gal te de 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di la yang dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa med pa nyid yin zhing /

analyzed: de 'jig pa'i rgyu 'ba' zhig gis 'jig par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: They would perish due to a cause of destruction alone,ğŸ”½or they would perish due to their own intrinsic reality. These are the two alternatives.

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can te rtog pa gnyis su 'gyur grang na de la dang po'i rnam par rtog pa ni /

original: gal te gzhan las dngos 'jig na //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te gzhan las dngos 'jig na //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /

analyzed: dngos po de gzhan med par 'jig na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: â€œEven if that thing were to perish without another.

original: de gzhan med par 'jig na zhes bya ba de 'chad par byed pa ni 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de gzhan med par 'jig na zhes bya ba de 'chad par byed pa ni 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€ He explains â€œwithout anotherâ€ with â€œwithout a cause of destruction.

original: rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€ Because it has the nature of self-destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu tha nye ba can med par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu tha nye ba can med par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œ It would perish without a cause of destruction being presentâ€ is supplied.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus med yin //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus med yin //
translated: â€œThe causes of endurance would be ineffective.

original: zhes bya ba de 'chad par byed pa ni de gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½gzhan dag ni rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'am zhes bya ba'i sgra gzhung du byed mod kyi de 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'chad par byed pa ni de gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gzhan dag ni rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'am zhes bya ba'i sgra gzhung du byed mod kyi de 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: â€ He explains â€œthe causes of enduranceâ€ with â€œin order for it to endure.ğŸ”½â€ Others take the word â€œorâ€ as part of the text, but it is not connected.

original: 'am gyi sgra med par yang don lhag pa 'ga' zhig mi thob pa med do //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra med par yang don lhag pa 'ga' zhig mi thob pa med do //
translated: Even without the word â€œor,â€ there is no incompleteness of meaning.

original: de thams cad gnas lhag par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de thams cad gnas lhag par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: All of these are called â€œabiding in excessâ€ and will be explained below.

original: skye ba can yang yin la kun yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'o ;
analyzed: skye ba can yang yin la kun yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'o ;
translated: â€œ That which is both arising and allâ€ is a common locus.

original: / gang dag gi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: / gang dag gi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: â€œ Of whichâ€ refers to form, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rten yin na zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rten yin na zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œ If impermanence is the basisâ€ refers to a pot, etc.

analyzed: de'i yang gzhan dang de'i yang gzhan yin pa zhes bya ba ni re zhig bum pa'i yan lag can gyi tha ma'i gyo mo rten yin zhing / de dag gi yang rang nyid kyi rtsom pa yin la de dag gi yang rang nyid rtsom pa po gzhan yin pa de ltar na yan lag can rdul gnyis kyi bar du'o //
translated: â€œ And that of thatâ€ refers to the fact that the final potsherds, which are parts of a pot, are the basis of that pot.

original: de'i yang rdul phra rab rtag pa'i bar du rten yin no //
analyzed: de'i yang rdul phra rab rtag pa'i bar du rten yin no //
translated: And the parts of those potsherds are the basis of those potsherds, and the parts of those are the basis of those, and so on until the two atoms, which are the basis of the parts of those.ğŸ”½And the two atoms are the basis of the partless particles.

original: de bas na re zhig rdul gnyis pa ni rtag tu gnas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de bas na re zhig rdul gnyis pa ni rtag tu gnas pa yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the two atoms are permanent and abide forever.

original: de'i stobs kyis des brtsams pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can @104a * //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis des brtsams pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can @104a * //
translated: By the power of that, the whole, such as a vase, is produced.ğŸ”½

original: gyis mthar thug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gyis mthar thug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and by the power of that, the whole, such as the pot, is produced, up to the final stage.

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig gang yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig gang yin pa //
translated: What is the thing that is destroyed?

original: zhes bya ba la don 'di nyid sngar bshad pa ma yin nam /ğŸ”½bden te ci gzhan las 'jig pa yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la don 'di nyid sngar bshad pa ma yin nam / bden te ci gzhan las 'jig pa yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t this very meaning explained above?ğŸ”½It is true, but it is explained in this way: â€œIs it destroyed by another?

original: ci ma yin zhes bya bas de ltar bshad pa yin la /ğŸ”½da ni ci bdag nyid 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci ma yin zhes bya bas de ltar bshad pa yin la / da ni ci bdag nyid 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: Or is it not?â€ğŸ”½Now, it is stated in this form: â€œIs it by nature subject to destruction?

original: ci ma ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: ci ma ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: Or is it not?â€ This is the difference.

original: lus kyi phul byung 'grib pa zhes bya ba la lus smos pa ni lus kyi yon tan ser po nyid la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi phul byung 'grib pa zhes bya ba la lus smos pa ni lus kyi yon tan ser po nyid la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: â€œThe decline of the excellence of the bodyâ€ â€” the mention of the body is a metaphor for the qualities of the body, such as its yellowness, etc.

original: de nyid kyi bshad pas ni lus kyi yon tan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bshad pas ni lus kyi yon tan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that very [verse] is â€œthe qualities of the body.â€

original: de'i yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œBy the increase and decrease of those qualitiesâ€ means

original: yid kyi yon tan thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pas 'phel ba dang 'grib ba dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi yon tan thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pas 'phel ba dang 'grib ba dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The qualities of the mind are increased and decreased by hearing, reflection, and meditation, etc.

original: byams pa ni bde ba dang phrad par gyur cig ces bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa ni bde ba dang phrad par gyur cig ces bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Loving kindness is the desire for sentient beings to be happy, thinking, â€œMay they come to have happiness.â€

original: snying rje ni lus can 'di sdug bsngal las thar bar gyur cig ces sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni lus can 'di sdug bsngal las thar bar gyur cig ces sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire for sentient beings to be free from suffering, thinking, â€œMay they be free from suffering.â€

original: lus kyi byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la ltos pa med pa yang yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la ltos pa med pa yang yin la /
translated: It is not dependent on the increase and decrease due to the special activity of the body.

original: gang blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gang blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is also dependent on the increase and decrease due to the special activity of the mind. This is the summary of the distinctions.

original: de nyid sgo yin pa des shes rab la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba dang / 'grib pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid sgo yin pa des shes rab la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba dang / 'grib pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That very door is the experience of the excellence and decrease of wisdom, etc.

original: chos gang yin pa 'di ni mar me'i 'od la sogs /
analyzed: chos gang yin pa 'di ni mar me'i 'od la sogs /
translated: This dharma is like the light of a lamp, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni grib ma dang myu gu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni grib ma dang myu gu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words â€œand so onâ€ include shadows, sprouts, and so on.

original: de la ltos pa med pa'i don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgron me'i byed pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med pa'i don gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgron me'i byed pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œwithout regard to the objectâ€ and so on refers to the fact that the lampâ€™s function is not dependent on the object.

original: don ni myu gu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don ni myu gu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The object is the sprout and so on.

original: de'i byed pa'i rjes su 'brang pa can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i byed pa'i rjes su 'brang pa can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lamp does not follow the objectâ€™s function. This is the meaning.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang zhig byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis phul du byung ba dang / 'grib pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang zhig byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis phul du byung ba dang / 'grib pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase â€œthe applicationâ€ and so on means that the application is the experience of the increase and decrease that are due to the difference in the agent.

original: nyams su myong ba khyad par ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba khyad par ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of experience?

original: ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase â€œwithout regard to the objectâ€ and so on.

original: gang zhig byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa zhes bya ba 'di la gang gi sgrar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa zhes bya ba 'di la gang gi sgrar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word â€œthatâ€ in the phrase â€œthat is due to the difference in the agentâ€ refers to the increase and decrease.

original: 'bras bu'i phul du byung ba dang 'grib ba zhes de la ltos pa med pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib @104b pa don ga la yod pa de ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phul du byung ba dang 'grib ba zhes de la ltos pa med pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib @104b pa don ga la yod pa de ni /
translated: How can there be increase and decrease due to the distinction of being independent of results?

original: ltos pa med pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa can no //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa can no //
translated: It is due to the distinction of being independent of activity.

original: de la ltos pa med par 'gyur na gang gi byed pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa dang gang gi byed pa ltos pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med par 'gyur na gang gi byed pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa dang gang gi byed pa ltos pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: If it were independent, then what is the meaning of the compound? It is that which is dependent on the activity of another and that which is independent of the activity of another.

original: de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni gang la phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni gang la phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: That which has it as its cause of appropriation is that which has the cause of increase and decrease.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound should be analyzed as â€œthat which has the cause of appropriation.â€

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig yin no //
translated: This is one thing to be proven.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa ni gang ltos pa med pa ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba yin
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa ni gang ltos pa med pa ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba yin
translated: It is not the case that it is the effect of a cause other than that,ğŸ”½means that it is not the case that it is the effect of a cause other than the cause of increase and decrease.

original: te de ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: te de ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that it is the effect of a cause that is not related to increase and decrease.

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second probandum.ğŸ”½The sprout that is not related to the cause of increase and decrease,

original: ltos pa med pa'i myu gu zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa'i rgyu sgron ma'i byed pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i myu gu zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa'i rgyu sgron ma'i byed pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that it is not related to the activity of the lamp, which is the cause of increase and decrease.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: In relation to the first probandum, it is a natural reason.

original: dngos su de'i byed pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su de'i byed pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is directly related to the mere experience of increase and decrease by the activity of that, and it is related to increase and decrease.

original: nye bar len pa can nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa can nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: and it is established as having appropriation.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to the second probandum, the observation of the pervasion by contradiction is as follows.

original: de nye bar len pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nye bar len pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has appropriation,

original: de nye bar len pa can nyid ma yin pa ni 'gal ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de nye bar len pa can nyid ma yin pa ni 'gal ba yin zhing /
translated: it is contradictory for it not to have appropriation.

original: khyab pa yin te de'i byed pa la ltos pa med par phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: khyab pa yin te de'i byed pa la ltos pa med par phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: And it is pervaded by it, because the experience of excellence and decline is dependent on its activity.

original: sems la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In terms of its being that which benefits the mind,

original: lus khyad par du byas pas khyad par can gyi lus la brten pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus khyad par du byas pas khyad par can gyi lus la brten pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: it is that which generates consciousness that is based on a special body, because it is distinguished by the body.

original: de yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa khyad par du byed cing de las kyang shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa khyad par du byed cing de las kyang shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is distinguished by mental consciousness, and from that, wisdom and so on are distinguished.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ltos pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa 'di'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ltos pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa 'di'o //
translated: The reason is inconclusive, because it is a reason that depends on the first thesis.

original: de ltar na lus 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i sgo nas kyang 'dod chags 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na lus 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i sgo nas kyang 'dod chags 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, if attachment increases and decreases due to the increase and decrease of the body,

original: sangs rgyas pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lus nye bar len par mi 'dod do //ğŸ”½ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las 'dod chags @105a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lus nye bar len par mi 'dod do // ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las 'dod chags @105a * //
translated: the Buddhist does not accept that attachment, etc. are appropriated in the body.

original: 'phel zhing gdung ba las zhe sdang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phel zhing gdung ba las zhe sdang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As is appropriate means that attachment increases from nourishment and anger increases from heat.

original: so sor brtags pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nye bar len pa 'gog par byed pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nye bar len pa 'gog par byed pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Discernment is a special wisdom that stops the appropriation of attachment, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dad pa'i stobs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dad pa'i stobs gzung ngo //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ includes the power of faith.

original: gang gi tshe rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na zhes bya ba tha snyad du byed pa zhes pa ni rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag la nyal ba kun tu rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes tha snyad du byed do zhes byağŸ”½ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na zhes bya ba tha snyad du byed pa zhes pa ni rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag la nyal ba kun tu rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes tha snyad du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it is said, â€œWhen there is expansion, etc., one conventionally says that there is attachment, etc.,â€ the meaning is that when there is expansion, etc., one conventionally says that the latent impressions of attachment, etc., are expanded.

original: sems nyid kyi rjes su phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba de dag ni yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: sems nyid kyi rjes su phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba de dag ni yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The terms â€œmental satisfactionâ€ and â€œmental dissatisfactionâ€ refer to the benefit and harm that follow upon the mind.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o ;
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o ;
translated: â€œPleasureâ€ and â€œpainâ€ are bodily.

original: / bde bas lus la phan btags pa la yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis lus gdungs pa ni yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / bde bas lus la phan btags pa la yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis lus gdungs pa ni yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mental satisfaction arises from the benefit that pleasure brings to the body, and mental dissatisfaction arises from the harm that pain brings to the body.

original: de bas na bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas de dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas de dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they arise on the basis of pleasure and pain.

original: reg bya'i khyad par rtog par byed pa pos reg bya'i rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba ni gang gi reg bya'i khyad par 'dzin par byed pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg bya'i khyad par rtog par byed pa pos reg bya'i rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba ni gang gi reg bya'i khyad par 'dzin par byed pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase â€œby the one who conceives the specific type of tangible objectâ€ means â€œby the form of body consciousness that apprehends the specific type of tangible object.â€

original: yid gzhungs pa'i byed pa'i rdzas gang gis yid gzhungs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa'i byed pa'i rdzas gang gis yid gzhungs par byed pa'o //
translated: The substance that causes the mind to be sharp is the one that causes the mind to be sharp.

original: bcud kyis len dang yid gzhungs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: bcud kyis len dang yid gzhungs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase â€œelixir and the cause of sharpnessâ€ is a dvandva compound.

original: yul lam zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i khyad par las so /
analyzed: yul lam zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i khyad par las so /
translated: The phrase â€œin regard to an objectâ€ means â€œin regard to a specific type of tangible object.â€

original: dbang po las zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rten las de gzhi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po las zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rten las de gzhi mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œin regard to a sense facultyâ€ means â€œin regard to the support of a sense faculty.â€

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa dag las de'i rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa dag las de'i rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the eye, etc., are benefited or harmed by the benefit or harm that is done to them, in the same way, their consciousnesses are benefited or harmed.

original: de'i shes pa la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod par byed pa'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i shes pa la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod par byed pa'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i shes pa la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: And by way of benefiting and harming its consciousness means by way of benefiting and harming the sense consciousness.

original: dngos su de 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su de 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not indefinite because it is not engaged in the discordant class.

original: dbang po yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin par gzung ste /
analyzed: dbang po yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin par gzung ste /
translated: The sense faculty is also taken as the basis of its consciousness.

original: dbang po gang yin pa de yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du gzung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po gang yin pa de yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du gzung ngo //
translated: And that which is a sense faculty is also taken as the cause of its consciousness.

original: nang don khyad par las skyes pa'i rang gi rten dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba de nyid ni rten des kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nang don khyad par las skyes pa'i rang gi rten dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba de nyid ni rten des kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Arisen from its own basis, the sense faculty, which is generated from a special internal object is that itself, which is stated as â€œby that basis.â€

original: rten ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: rten ni dbang po'o //
translated: The basis is the sense faculty.

original: des ni nang gi don gyis so //
analyzed: des ni nang gi don gyis so //
translated: It is by that internal object.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni yid 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid du 'byung ba yang ma yin @105b te ;
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni yid 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid du 'byung ba yang ma yin @105b te ;
translated: It is not necessarily arisen as the cause of a change in the mind.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dus pa la sogs pa yod na yang yid 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dus pa la sogs pa yod na yang yid 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when there is a collection of the eyes, etc., there is no change in the mind.

original: stag ni gcan gzhan no //
analyzed: stag ni gcan gzhan no //
translated: â€œTigerâ€ is another animal.

original: stag nyid dang khrag ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: stag nyid dang khrag ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: â€œTigerâ€ and â€œbloodâ€ are in apposition.

original: mthong ba dang ni thos pa las //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni thos pa las //
translated: â€œFrom seeing and hearingâ€

original: zhes bya ba ni stag thos pa dang / khrag mthong ba las zhes go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stag thos pa dang / khrag mthong ba las zhes go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: means that the tiger is heard and the blood is seen, respectively.

original: de bzhin du tha dad par stag thos pa'i rgyu las zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tha dad par stag thos pa'i rgyu las zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
translated: In the same way, it is explained by â€œfrom the cause of hearing the tiger separately.â€

original: blo ni de'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos su don de'i 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo ni de'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos su don de'i 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: â€œBecause the mind does not follow itâ€ means that it does not directly follow the change of that object.

original: phyi rol gyi don nye bar len pa'i ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don nye bar len pa'i ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œIt is not the appropriator of the external objectâ€ should be supplied.

original: ji ltar rjes su byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How does it not follow?

original: de'i phyir nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it says â€œdefinitely,â€ etc.

original: don gyi 'gyur ba de lta bur gyur pa 'dus pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de /
analyzed: don gyi 'gyur ba de lta bur gyur pa 'dus pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de /
translated: That which has the characteristic of being an assembly, etc. of such a transformation of meaning,

original: nges par rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: is not necessarily subsequent.

original: blo de ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: blo de ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that cognition is not subsequent.

original: ji ltar blo snga ma snga ma la zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: ji ltar blo snga ma snga ma la zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The example of the dissimilar case is: â€œjust as the previous cognition.â€

original: dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu lus ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu lus ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that the body is not actually a co-operating cause.

original: dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin du zin kyang de nyid rgyu nyid yin pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin du zin kyang de nyid rgyu nyid yin pa ni /
translated: Even though it is not actually a co-operating cause, it is still a cause.

original: nges pa der 'dus byas pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni lus 'dus byas pa'i yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa der 'dus byas pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni lus 'dus byas pa'i yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œthe body of the producedâ€ is â€œthe body of the produced.â€

original: dngos su lan cig byed pa'i 'gyur ba yang nges par 'bras bu'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos su lan cig byed pa'i 'gyur ba yang nges par 'bras bu'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the transformation occurs only once, it is still necessarily subsequent to the effect.

original: de nyid ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In this regard, the example is stated by â€œfor example,â€ etc.

original: yul gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of â€œsubsequent to the objectâ€ is

original: yul ni dngos su dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa yin la /ğŸ”½de yang dbang po'i shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yul ni dngos su dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa yin la / de yang dbang po'i shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The object is the direct cooperating condition of the sense consciousness.ğŸ”½Moreover, it is the object that is the direct cooperating condition of the sense consciousness because it is the object that is the direct cause of the arising of the sense consciousness.

original: de gsal ba nyid rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsal ba nyid rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object that is the direct cause of the arising of the sense consciousness because it is the object that is the direct cause of the arising of the sense consciousness.

original: gal te 'o na nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par gang yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, â€œWhat is the difference between the appropriated and the cooperating conditions?â€

original: de ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be explained later.

original: dngos su nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa ni 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: dngos su nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa ni 'gal ba yin la /
translated: It is contradictory that it is not the direct cause of the appropriation.

original: des ni de'i rjes su mi 'jug pa la khyab pa de ltar na 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni de'i rjes su mi 'jug pa la khyab pa de ltar na 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the pervasion is that if it is not the direct cause of the appropriation, it does not follow it. In that way, there is the observation of a pervasion by contradiction.

original: dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa de la ltos nas kyang 'gal ba khyab pas dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa de la ltos nas kyang 'gal ba khyab pas dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Also, in dependence on the second probandum, â€œIt is not the direct cooperating cause,â€ there is the observation of a pervasion by contradiction.

original: de ldog na ni nges par ldog pa la de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid dang / de'i dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas khyab pa yin la /ğŸ”½de dang 'gal ba ni de'i nye @106a * //
analyzed: de ldog na ni nges par ldog pa la de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid dang / de'i dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas khyab pa yin la / de dang 'gal ba ni de'i nye @106a * //
translated: If it is stopped, then it is necessarily stopped, because it is the substantial cause of that, and it is the direct co-operating cause of that.

original: bar len pa nyid ma yin pa dang / de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bar len pa nyid ma yin pa dang / de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The contradiction of that is not being its substantial cause, and not being its co-operating condition. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: dus gcig gi tshe sems la nges par ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe sems la nges par ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi tshe'o //
translated: â€œAt the time of one mind, not definitely apprehendedâ€ means at the time of the states of sleep, fainting, and so on.

original: 'dus byas pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: â€œThe produced is manifested in accordance with conditionsâ€ means

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa ni gang zhig gang sad par byed pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa ni gang zhig gang sad par byed pa'i rkyen te /
translated: â€œin accordance with conditionsâ€ means that which is produced by whatever conditions.

original: dus gzhan la sdod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan la sdod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the abiding at another time, and so on.

original: 'dus byas pa mngon par gsal ba ni 'bras bu skye ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i mngon par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa mngon par gsal ba ni 'bras bu skye ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i mngon par gsal ba'o //
translated: The manifest of the conditioned is the manifest that is in conformity with the arising of the effect.

original: 'dus byas pa de nyid las zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i dus su bsgos shing bar du sad pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa de nyid las zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i dus su bsgos shing bar du sad pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From that very conditioned, means from the special predispositions that are infused at the time of hearing and so on and are activated in the interim.ğŸ”½The manifest of the qualities is the cause of the nondifferentiation of the beings who are born with wisdom, memory, and so on.

original: yon tan mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang yid gzungs pa la sogs pa skye bo tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus dang blo'i yon tan gcig nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: yon tan mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang yid gzungs pa la sogs pa skye bo tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus dang blo'i yon tan gcig nyid yin pas so //
translated: The reason is that the qualities of the body and mind are one.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid la de 'dus byas par gyur pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid la de 'dus byas par gyur pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The existence of that very nature is pervaded by the conditioned state.

original: 'dir de med pa da ltar khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir de med pa da ltar khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Here, the nonexistence of that is pervaded by the nonexistence of the pervader.

original: thos pa la sogs pa lus kyi 'dus byas pa yod pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa lus kyi 'dus byas pa yod pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If hearing and so on are the conditioned state of the body, then the reason is not established.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says, â€œNor is it the case that it is not established.â€

original: snang ba nyid las zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yon tan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid las so //
analyzed: snang ba nyid las zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yon tan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid las so //
translated: â€œFrom the appearance itselfâ€ means from the mere appearance that is the characteristic of the apprehension of the bodyâ€™s qualities.

original: gal te thos pa la sogs pa'i 'dus byas pas lus kyi yon tan byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te thos pa la sogs pa'i 'dus byas pas lus kyi yon tan byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If the bodyâ€™s qualities were produced by the production of hearing, etc.,

original: de yang dmigs par 'gyur na thos pa la sogs pas 'dus byas ba byed pa'i tshe dang mngon par gsal ba'i dus na yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de yang dmigs par 'gyur na thos pa la sogs pas 'dus byas ba byed pa'i tshe dang mngon par gsal ba'i dus na yang mi dmigs te /
translated: and if they were apprehended, then when hearing, etc., are produced, and at the time of their manifestation, they would not be apprehended.

original: gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang lus la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang lus la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the body in both situations.

original: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni bag med pa rtsom pa can no //
analyzed: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni bag med pa rtsom pa can no //
translated: â€œNegligentâ€ means one who is engaged in negligence.

original: mi gtsang ba dang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnas su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnas su zhes bya ba la /
translated: â€œIn places that are impure, with ravines, etc.â€

original: mi gtsang ba'i gnas dang g-yang sa'i gnas ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i gnas dang g-yang sa'i gnas ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: â€œImpure placesâ€ and â€œplaces with ravinesâ€ are compounds.

original: de bas na dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len na yang 'di bde ba dang sdug bsngal thob pa dang dor bar 'dod pa med pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len na yang 'di bde ba dang sdug bsngal thob pa dang dor bar 'dod pa med pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even if one accepts the inferior state, if one does not desire to obtain or reject pleasure and pain, then it would be indeterminate.

original: de bdag nyid 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: de bdag nyid 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: He answers that with â€œIf one desires that nature, etc.â€

original: @106b de ltar na gang mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba can gyi dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len pa zhes bya ba khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: @106b de ltar na gang mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba can gyi dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len pa zhes bya ba khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med do //
translated: Thus, the inferior state that is preceded by attachment is called â€œacceptance.â€ The reason, along with its qualification, does not apply to the discordant side.

original: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa 'phangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa 'phangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If one says that because of being projected by God, etc.,

original: srog chags sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: srog chags sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: the living being is to be led by another living being,

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, â€œNor is it unestablished.â€

original: mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba can gyi srog chags mngal gyi gnas len pa zhes bya ba the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba can gyi srog chags mngal gyi gnas len pa zhes bya ba the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not doubtful that the embryo is a living being that has already been attached to the womb?

original: gnas skabs 'di ni rang bzhin gyis bskal pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di ni rang bzhin gyis bskal pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This state is naturally isolated.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ni the tshom za ba'i ma grub par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½'di ltar dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa gang yin pa de ni re zhig 'byung ba rnams nye bar len pa nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ni the tshom za ba'i ma grub par 'gyur ro // 'di ltar dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa gang yin pa de ni re zhig 'byung ba rnams nye bar len pa nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, this reason is inconclusive.

original: 'byung ba tsam gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin par dgongs so //
translated: Thus, it is intended that the appropriation of a lowly state is not characterized by the mere elements, because the appropriation of the elements themselves has already been refuted and because the elements are stopped.

original: nye bar len pa med par dngos po rnams skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med par dngos po rnams skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston par 'gyur ro //

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because ÄªÅ›vara and so on have already been refuted.

original: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it causeless,

analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs nges pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no certainty as to place, time, and occasion.

analyzed: yul dman par gnyid log pa ltung ba bzhin du yang 'gro ba ma yin te /

translated: The mind that precedes the appropriation of a self is not a mind that is attached to a lower place, which is projected by a mistaken mind. Thus, it is not the case that it is not established because of doubt.
