original: de'i rgyu can te zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi blo'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can te zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi blo'i rgyu can no //
translated: â€œHaving that as its causeâ€ means having a distorted awareness as its cause.

original: yang de nyid ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang de nyid ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, it is said, â€œthat very thing is suffering and happiness, etc.â€

original: yul gyis yul can bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba dang thob pa'i mtshan nyid can yin zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yul gyis yul can bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba dang thob pa'i mtshan nyid can yin zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Because the object is taught by means of the subject, it should be understood that it is characterized by the attainment of happiness and the avoidance of suffering.

original: dor ba dang thob pa'i rang bzhin ni sred pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dor ba dang thob pa'i rang bzhin ni sred pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the attainment and avoidance is not craving.

original: sred pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba thob pa dang dor ba'i sred pa'i sgo nas bdag tu chags pa yang 'phangs pa yin te /
analyzed: sred pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba thob pa dang dor ba'i sred pa'i sgo nas bdag tu chags pa yang 'phangs pa yin te /
translated: â€œThrough cravingâ€ means that attachment to self is also projected through the craving for the attainment and avoidance of happiness and suffering.

original: de med par yul la sred pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par yul la sred pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without that, there is no craving for objects.

original: ston par byed pa ni sbyor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ston par byed pa ni sbyor bar byed pa ste /
translated: â€œCausingâ€ means causing engagement.

original: las dang ma rig pa dang srid pa yang srid 'byung ba can ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin no zhes lung las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang ma rig pa dang srid pa yang srid 'byung ba can ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin no zhes lung las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And action, ignorance, and craving, which are the origin of further existence, are the truth of origin, as stated in the scriptures.

original: phyin ci log pa'i blo smos pas ni ma rig pa bstan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i blo smos pas ni ma rig pa bstan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The mention of a perverted cognition does not itself indicate ignorance.

original: ma 'ongs par zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs par zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar ro //
translated: â€œIn the futureâ€ means in future birth.

original: ci ste gzhan dag gis kyang ma mthong ba de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don de nyid ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dag gis kyang ma mthong ba de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don de nyid ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If others do not see it, then the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: gzhan dag gis ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: â€œOthers do not see itâ€ means that others are not able to ascertain it.

original: 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œIt would be seen by someoneâ€

original: rnal 'byor ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba la sogs pas so //
translated: means by a yogin, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i srid pa'i tshad mas 'og nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i srid pa'i tshad mas 'og nas bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The existence of a yogin will be established later by a valid cognition.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad las rjes su dpag pa yang bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad las rjes su dpag pa yang bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Inference from the convention of existence has also been explained.

original: sems ni rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'ong ba la rjes su dpag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems ni rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'ong ba la rjes su dpag pa bshad zin to //
translated: Inference from the convention of existence has been explained by the statement that the mind is dependent on a homogeneous prior appropriation.

original: ci 'dra'i 'phen byed yod 'gyur na //
analyzed: ci 'dra'i 'phen byed yod 'gyur na //
translated: What sort of impelling would there be?

original: phyis kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyis kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: And later on, it would be just like that.

original: 'phen byed du 'gyur te rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas 'gro ba la rjes su dpag par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'phen byed du 'gyur te rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas 'gro ba la rjes su dpag par bshad zin to //
translated: It would be impelling, because the cause is not incomplete.ğŸ”½For example, like its own nature.

original: dper na rang gi ngo bo nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni g-yo bar gyur ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin la g-yo bas @107b khyab pa yin la 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na rang gi ngo bo nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni g-yo bar gyur ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin la g-yo bas @107b khyab pa yin la 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of that which is pervaded by movement in that which is the nature of movement is the non-observation of the pervaded.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to others as well.

original: thal ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub cing //
analyzed: thal ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub cing //
translated: The consequence is not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa de la rkang pa la sogs pa yang lag pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa de la rkang pa la sogs pa yang lag pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang
translated: As for what was explained by That which is not different from what... and so on, in that case, the feet and so on also have the nature of being non-different from the self. What is the reason?

original: yin pa de ni ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: yin pa de ni ma grub pa yin te /
translated: That is not established,

original: rkang pa la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the feet, etc. are not mutually different.

original: gang zhig gang g-yo ba ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa zlog pa ste grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang g-yo ba ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa zlog pa ste grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The refutation of â€œthat which movesâ€ and â€œthat which does not move,â€ etc. is an establishment of what is already established,

original: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the hands, feet, etc. are different.

original: tha dad par grub pa ni yul tha dad pa can nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad par grub pa ni yul tha dad pa can nyid do //
translated: That which is established as different has a different object.

original: tha dad pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni so so nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni so so nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would have a different object means it would be established as individual.

original: gang zhig gang las ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa can zhes bya ba la nam mkha' ni ldan pa can no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang las ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa can zhes bya ba la nam mkha' ni ldan pa can no //
translated: That which has a different object from that which possesses it means that space possesses it.

original: de'i yul ni ldan pa can gyi yul te /
analyzed: de'i yul ni ldan pa can gyi yul te /
translated: Its object is the object of that which possesses it.

original: gang ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase â€œthat which has a different object of that which possesses itâ€ is to be analyzed.

original: nam mkha'i yul tha dad pa can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yul tha dad pa can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that space would not have a different object.

original: ma bsgribs pa yang bsgribs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi rang bzhin gcig pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa yang bsgribs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi rang bzhin gcig pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the unobscured is obscured, because the nature of the parts is the same.

original: ji ltar sngar de mthong ba zhes pa ni ji ltar yan lag ma bsgribs pa mthong ba de ltar phyogs gcig gi bsgribs su zin kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar de mthong ba zhes pa ni ji ltar yan lag ma bsgribs pa mthong ba de ltar phyogs gcig gi bsgribs su zin kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as one sees it before, just as one sees the unobscured parts, in the same way one sees the obscured parts, even though they are obscured in part.

original: phyogs gcig gi bsgribs su zin kyang khyod kyi gzung gi yan lag can ma bsgribs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gi bsgribs su zin kyang khyod kyi gzung gi yan lag can ma bsgribs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even though they are obscured in part, you grasp the whole, because the whole is unobscured.

original: yan lag can gang la yan lag 'dzin pa'i thabs mthong ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gang la yan lag 'dzin pa'i thabs mthong ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the whole in which the parts are seen by the method of grasping.

original: de bsgribs pa na zhes bya ba ni yan lag bsgribs pa na'o //
analyzed: de bsgribs pa na zhes bya ba ni yan lag bsgribs pa na'o //
translated: When it is obscured, when the parts are obscured.

original: yan lag can thams cad mthong ba dang srid pas na zhes bya ba la gal te yan lag thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'ga' zhig gi tshe yan lag can thams cad yongs su bcad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag can thams cad mthong ba dang srid pas na zhes bya ba la gal te yan lag thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'ga' zhig gi tshe yan lag can thams cad yongs su bcad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because the whole is seen, because the whole exists. If the parts were seen, then sometimes the whole would not be completely divided.

original: dbus dang tha ma'i cha cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus dang tha ma'i cha cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the middle and the end are simultaneously apprehended.

original: yan lag can mthong ba yang khas len pa de bas na /
analyzed: yan lag can mthong ba yang khas len pa de bas na /
translated: And since the existence of the possessor of the parts is also accepted,

original: yan lag can thams cad ma mthong ba can de nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag can thams cad ma mthong ba can de nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: then the very same thing should be accepted as the non-perception of all the parts.

original: de ltar na phyogs gcig bsgribs pas kyang ma lus pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gal te rdul gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal byed la @108a * //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs gcig bsgribs pas kyang ma lus pa mthong bar 'gyur ro // gal te rdul gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal byed la @108a * //
translated: Thus, even when one part is obscured, the whole is seen.ğŸ”½If the second atom, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: is the response to the opponentâ€™s objection that the atom is not the object of the sense faculties.

original: sngar dbang po las 'das pa yin na zhes bya ba ni ma tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //ğŸ”½sngar bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngar dbang po las 'das pa yin na zhes bya ba ni ma tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o // sngar bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
translated: â€œIf it is beyond the sensesâ€ refers to the situation when the atom is not aggregated.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i gnas skabs khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i gnas skabs khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œBecause there is no difference from beforeâ€ means that there is no difference in the situation when the atom is beyond the senses.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs gcig yin no //ğŸ”½skad cig ma nyid ma yin par sgro btags nas 'di skad du phra phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs gcig yin no // skad cig ma nyid ma yin par sgro btags nas 'di skad du phra phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is the first reason.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa yin no //
translated: â€œBecause of its subtletyâ€ is the second reason.

original: rdul phra mo gang yin pa de dang de dag ji ltar sngar rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa de ltar tshogs su zin kyang rdul phran nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdul phra mo gang yin pa de dang de dag ji ltar sngar rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa de ltar tshogs su zin kyang rdul phran nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Just as each of the subtle particles is of the nature of a subtle particle, so also is the collection of them.

original: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin no //
translated: For this very reason, they are beyond the senses.ğŸ”½The sutra says, â€œThey are not perceived.â€

original: mi rtogs zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //ğŸ”½'di'i bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½mi nus shing sngar gyi ngo bo las 'phos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ba can mi nus pa ni sngar gyi ngo bo las 'pho ba med pa gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi rtogs zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no // 'di'i bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // mi nus shing sngar gyi ngo bo las 'phos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ba can mi nus pa ni sngar gyi ngo bo las 'pho ba med pa gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The explanation of this is: â€œNo one can perceive them.â€

original: rdul phra rab ni skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir sngar nus pa med pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang phrad pa las gnas skabs de ni snang ba skye ba gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir sngar nus pa med pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang phrad pa las gnas skabs de ni snang ba skye ba gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: Because the atom is momentary, the appearance of the other, the arising of the appearance, is due to the conjunction of the condition of the other, which previously was not capable.

original: des ni gtan tshigs dang po ma grub pa bshad do //ğŸ”½nus pa skye ba gzhan nyid yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi ma yang ngo //
analyzed: des ni gtan tshigs dang po ma grub pa bshad do // nus pa skye ba gzhan nyid yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi ma yang ngo //
translated: This explains the first reason as not established.

original: rdul phra rab dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba las sogs pas gtan tshigs gnyis pa ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba las sogs pas gtan tshigs gnyis pa ma grub par bstan to //
translated: The second reason is not established, as is shown by the words, â€œbecause the atom is beyond the senses,â€ etc.

original: sgrib byed ni mthong ba'i thabs la bsgribs g-yogs gzhan gyis bar du bcad pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgrib byed ni mthong ba'i thabs la bsgribs g-yogs gzhan gyis bar du bcad pa nyid do //
translated: Obstruction is the covering over of the means of seeing, the cutting off by another.

original: thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gags byed pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gags byed pa'o //
translated: Resistance is the obstruction of the arising of another in oneâ€™s own place.

original: de ltar byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsgribs pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsgribs pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: â€œTo act in that wayâ€ means to obstruct, etc.

original: de ltar na gser dang dngul chu'i rdul phra rab rnams dang / rdul phran chu phan tshun chod pa'i phyir re zhig sngar brtsams pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas 'jig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na gser dang dngul chu'i rdul phra rab rnams dang / rdul phran chu phan tshun chod pa'i phyir re zhig sngar brtsams pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas 'jig par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, since the atoms of gold and quicksilver are mutually obstructed, the substance of the whole, which was previously produced, is destroyed.

original: gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa yan lag can gzhan rtsom par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa yan lag can gzhan rtsom par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And the other whole, such as gold and quicksilver, is not produced.

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnams ni rtsom pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnams ni rtsom pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those of different kinds are not producers.

original: de nyid ni de las rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @108b smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni de las rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @108b smos so //
translated: This is what is stated by the words, â€œbecause they are of different kindsâ€ and so on.

original: phan tshun 'dres par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rnam par 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rnam par 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œMutually mixedâ€ means mutually combined.

original: de ltar na ldan pa skyed na yang zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du phyis kyang nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ldan pa skyed na yang zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du phyis kyang nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even if the combination is produced, it is later without efficacy, as before.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i ji ltar na byed pa po yin zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i ji ltar na byed pa po yin zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Therefore, how can consciousness be an agent? The rest is as before.

original: phrad de tshogs pa rnams ni rgyu nyid yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: phrad de tshogs pa rnams ni rgyu nyid yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the collection of the assembled causes is the cause,

original: phrad pa de nyid kyang 'thad pa ma yin pa de ltar na byed pa por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phrad pa de nyid kyang 'thad pa ma yin pa de ltar na byed pa por mi 'gyur te /
translated: then that assembly itself is untenable.

original: byed pa por yang 'dod pa de bas na ldan pa skyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ldan pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa por yang 'dod pa de bas na ldan pa skyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ldan pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: If you assert that the collection is the agent, then that which is produced by the collection is the effect.ğŸ”½How is it that a drink is said to possess taste, form, and so on?

original: ji ltar na ro gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa zhes bya ba ni re zhig btung ba zhim po dang ; gzugs bzang po dang dri zhim po can zhes pa tha snyad du byed pa las btung ba ro dang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa bye brag pa la sogs pa'i gzhung la med cing /
analyzed: ji ltar na ro gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa zhes bya ba ni re zhig btung ba zhim po dang ; gzugs bzang po dang dri zhim po can zhes pa tha snyad du byed pa las btung ba ro dang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa bye brag pa la sogs pa'i gzhung la med cing /
translated: In the treatises of the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas and so on, there is no statement that a drink possesses taste, form, and so on.

original: bu ram la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa 'dres pa las kyang sngar gyi yan lag can zhig pa na rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyang 'bras bu'i rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bu ram la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa 'dres pa las kyang sngar gyi yan lag can zhig pa na rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyang 'bras bu'i rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, from the mixing of different types of sugar cane, and so on, the previous part dissolves and different types do not produce the substance of the effect.

original: btung ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag can yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sge'u gsher dang bu ram la sogs pa phrad pa nyid btung ba yin la ldan pa yang tshig gi don yon tan yin no //
analyzed: btung ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag can yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sge'u gsher dang bu ram la sogs pa phrad pa nyid btung ba yin la ldan pa yang tshig gi don yon tan yin no //
translated: The component called â€œdrinkâ€ does not exist, but rather the contact of sugarcane juice, molasses, and so on is drink, and the property of drink is the meaning of the word.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: So too, form and so on are the same.

original: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa 'dod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa 'dod pa de ltar na /
translated: You assert that properties do not have properties.

original: btung ba'i ro dang gzugs la sogs pa'i ldan pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btung ba'i ro dang gzugs la sogs pa'i ldan pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the property of drink would not be the taste of drink and so on.

original: btung ba gzugs la sogs pa dang mi ldan par bstan nas da ni btung ba la gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams gzhan gyi gzhung gis mi 'dzin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btung ba gzugs la sogs pa dang mi ldan par bstan nas da ni btung ba la gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams gzhan gyi gzhung gis mi 'dzin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having shown that drink is not endowed with form and so on, now, in order to demonstrate that the apprehension of form and so on in drink is not established by the opponentâ€™s scriptures, he says:

original: rdul phran rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: rdul phran rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: The form and so on of atoms and so on.

original: de ltar na re zhig gzugs la sogs pa de dag btung ba dang ldan pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gzugs la sogs pa de dag btung ba dang ldan pa can ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, those forms and so on are not endowed with drink.

original: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the qualities do not exist in the qualities.

original: bu ram la sogs pa dag gi yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bu ram la sogs pa dag gi yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that sugar, etc.,

original: de dag gi ldan pa zhig pas 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ldan pa zhig pas 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are destroyed by the destruction of their conjunction.

original: de la rigs mi mthun pa dang 'dres pa'i rdul phra rab gzugs la sogs pa yod pa gang yin pa de dag lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rigs mi mthun pa dang 'dres pa'i rdul phra rab gzugs la sogs pa yod pa gang yin pa de dag lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that regard, those subtle atoms of form, etc., which are of a dissimilar type and are mixed, remain.

original: rdul phra rab de dag gis 'bras bu rtsom pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag gis 'bras bu rtsom pa yang ma yin /
translated: And those subtle atoms do not commence an effect.

original: gang la rgyur gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pas brtsams pa'i 'bras bu'i @109a * //
analyzed: gang la rgyur gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pas brtsams pa'i 'bras bu'i @109a * //
translated: The effect, the form, etc., which is commenced by the cause-category of form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: is produced.

original: de nyid ni rigs mi 'dra bas chod pa'i phyir 'bras bu rtsom pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni rigs mi 'dra bas chod pa'i phyir 'bras bu rtsom pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That very [effect] is called not commencing an effect because it is obstructed by a dissimilar type.

original: 'on kyang rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nas bzung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul phra rab tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nas bzung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is grasped from the state of form, etc., which belongs to the subtle atom.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyang dbang po las 'das pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyang dbang po las 'das pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is also beyond the senses.

original: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it does not apprehend form and so on,

original: de'i rten shin tu lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i rten shin tu lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: because its basis is extremely hidden.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: Book 45

original: blo yi tha dad yod bla ste //
analyzed: blo yi tha dad yod bla ste //
translated: There is a difference in cognition.

original: dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i shes pa'i tha dad pa yod du chug na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i shes pa'i tha dad pa yod du chug na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if there is a difference in cognition of the actual and the imputed, this is the meaning of if.

original: sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i chos gcig gang la yod pa de la ni dngos dang nye bar btags pa de'i chos can no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i chos gcig gang la yod pa de la ni dngos dang nye bar btags pa de'i chos can no //
translated: The syllogism and so on. That which has the actual and the imputed is the basis of the actual and the imputed.

original: shes pa gang la dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de ni de'i rgyu mtshan can no //
analyzed: shes pa gang la dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de ni de'i rgyu mtshan can no //
translated: That cognition which has the reason of the actual and the imputed is the one with that reason.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can yang de yin la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can yang de yin la /
translated: It is one with that reason,

original: shes pa mtshungs pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa mtshungs pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: and it is also a similar cognition. This is how the words are connected.

original: de'i yul ni de dag ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni de dag ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Its object is not those.

original: shes pa mtshungs pa'i yul nyid la dngos po ma yin pa dang nye bar btags pa ma yin pa de'i chos can yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal na yang dngos dang nye bar btags pa de'i chos can yin pa de ltar na khyab
analyzed: shes pa mtshungs pa'i yul nyid la dngos po ma yin pa dang nye bar btags pa ma yin pa de'i chos can yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal na yang dngos dang nye bar btags pa de'i chos can yin pa de ltar na khyab
translated: The object of a cognition is necessarily either a real entity or a nominal entity.

original: par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The contradictory of that is the observation of a contradictory of the pervasion.

original: de ni bdag nyid yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngar ba ni grangs dang ldan pa la yon tan nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngar ba ni grangs dang ldan pa la yon tan nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is, because sweetness is accepted as a quality that is possessed by a number of things.

original: gang la 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang la 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid de /
translated: That which possesses the quality of sweetness

original: dngar ba ni bya re re la dngar bar gyur ba'i ring po nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngar ba ni bya re re la dngar bar gyur ba'i ring po nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: is not a long thing that is sweet in each part.

original: brjod pa dag las zhes bya ba ni grangs la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i sgra las so //
analyzed: brjod pa dag las zhes bya ba ni grangs la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i sgra las so //
translated: From the expressions means from the words that express number and so on.

original: tha dad pa med pa'am zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba dang po'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'am zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba dang po'o //
translated: Without distinction means that the probandum is the first in terms of the nature of the proof.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas ni mo gsham gyi bu dpe yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas ni mo gsham gyi bu dpe yin no //
translated: In relation to the second probandum, the son of a barren woman is the example.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ltos nas ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ltos nas ni /
translated: In relation to the first probandum,

original: gzugs de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: it is the very nature of form.

original: rnam grangs su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni thams cad gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni thams cad gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIn terms of a synonymâ€ means that all are the subjects of the objects of form and so on.

original: shes pa la sogs pa smos pas ni sgra gzung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa smos pas ni sgra gzung ngo //
translated: By mentioning consciousness and so on, sound is included.

original: sgra gang zhes bya ba ni dang po'i @109b tshig gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sgra gang zhes bya ba ni dang po'i @109b tshig gnyis pa'o //
translated: â€œAny soundâ€ is the second word of the first line.

original: dngos po tha dad rjes su 'brang ba'i zhes bya ba la tha dad pa ni gzhan sel ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad rjes su 'brang ba'i zhes bya ba la tha dad pa ni gzhan sel ba'o //
translated: â€œFollowing different thingsâ€ means that difference is the exclusion of other.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni sdud pa zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni sdud pa zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is â€œcomprehensionâ€ and so on.

original: sdud pa ni dngos po dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sdud pa ni dngos po dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: â€œComprehensionâ€ is the connection of one thing to another thing.

original: de las ldog pa ni ma 'brel ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de las ldog pa ni ma 'brel ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: â€œThe opposite of thatâ€ is the state of nonconnection.

original: de tsam gyi yul can ni shes pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyi yul can ni shes pa gcig yin no //
translated: The subject of that much is a single consciousness.

original: yang dag par ldan pa'i dngos po las ldog pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i dngos po la brten nas ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par ldan pa'i dngos po las ldog pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i dngos po la brten nas ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: The conception of possession is based on the fact that a thing that is not possessed is continuously produced.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the other things.

original: des ni zhes bya ba'i ldog pa rjod par byed pas so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba'i ldog pa rjod par byed pas so //
translated: The word â€œthusâ€ indicates the reversal of the above.

original: de ltar kun tu rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni gcig la sogs par rtog pa'i'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun tu rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni gcig la sogs par rtog pa'i'o //
translated: The conception of â€œthusâ€ refers to the conception of one and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: â€œIn thatâ€ refers to form and so on.

original: yon tan du bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi ming can no //
analyzed: yon tan du bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi ming can no //
translated: â€œCounting as a qualityâ€ means having the name of a quality.

original: rang nyid kyis ni rdzas ni khyad par can ma yin pa la grangs la sogs pa gang gis khyad par du byas pa de ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ni rdzas ni khyad par can ma yin pa la grangs la sogs pa gang gis khyad par du byas pa de ni khyad par yin no //
translated: A substance itself is not a particular, but that which is distinguished by number and so on is a particular.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i khyad par yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i khyad par yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: If there is a separate particular, it is called that.

original: de ni gang la tha dad pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni gang la tha dad pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is explained by â€œthat in which there is a separate dharmaâ€ and so on.

original: de kho na nyid du nges pas 'jug pa shes pa gang la yod pa de la ltos pa med pas 'jug pa can no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du nges pas 'jug pa shes pa gang la yod pa de la ltos pa med pas 'jug pa can no //
translated: That which has the engagement of cognition through ascertainment of reality is the one that engages without reliance.

original: de 'dra ba'i nye bar btags pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa gang yin pa de 'dra ba nye bar btags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i nye bar btags pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa gang yin pa de 'dra ba nye bar btags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not like that which is imputed, means that it is not like the engagement of the conventions of number, etc. which is imputed.

original: yon tan rnams la yang shes pa gcig la sogs pa ltos pa med pas 'jug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yang shes pa gcig la sogs pa ltos pa med pas 'jug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the qualities also have engagement without reliance on one cognition, etc.

original: de nyid ni gzugs gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzugs gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That itself is stated by â€œone form,â€ etc.

original: grangs la sogs pa tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa tha dad pa ste /
translated: The difference of number, etc.

original: bzlog pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'di la yod pas na grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad pa'i chos dang ldan pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'di la yod pas na grangs la sogs pa'i tha dad pa'i chos dang ldan pa can gyi'o //
translated: This has the quality of the opposite, therefore it has the quality of the difference of number, etc.

original: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni reg bya dang / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni reg bya dang / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ste /
translated: Sound, etc. means the tangible, form, taste, etc.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i ni bum pa la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i ni bum pa la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: The Buddhist [says that the pot, etc.] are of the nature of form, etc.

original: don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gcig go //
analyzed: don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gcig go //
translated: The first reason is that [the pot, etc.] have the same object.

original: don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second reason is that [the pot, etc.] do not have a different object.

original: de dag ni rnam grangs yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go //ğŸ”½don tha dad pa'i yul can @110a * //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam grangs yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go // don tha dad pa'i yul can @110a * //
translated: The first proof is that [the pot, etc.] are synonyms.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second proof is that [the pot, etc.] do not have a different object.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba dang po la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems te /
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba dang po la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems te /
translated: We think that [the pot, etc.] are reasons based on identity in relation to the first probandum,

original: rnam grangs su rnam par gzhag pa'i ni don gcig pa'i yul can nyid tsam gyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs su rnam par gzhag pa'i ni don gcig pa'i yul can nyid tsam gyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because [the pot, etc.] are established as synonyms, and because they have the same object.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa'i yul can du rnam par gzhag pa la don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa'i yul can du rnam par gzhag pa la don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: This is a case of a reason that is based on a different object, and the pervasion is based on a different object.

original: de 'di med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ltar bcos pa nyid du 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'di med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ltar bcos pa nyid du 'thad pa yin te /
translated: This is a case of a non-observation of the pervader that is similar to the real thing.

original: dgag pa'i sgo nas sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgo nas sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a case of a reason that is based on a negation.

original: don gcig pa'i yul can yin zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa de ni bsgrub pa'i sgo nas yin de la ji ltar khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: don gcig pa'i yul can yin zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa de ni bsgrub pa'i sgo nas yin de la ji ltar khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: The reason that is based on the same object is a case of a reason that is based on an affirmation. How can it be a non-observation of the pervader?

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par rigs te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par rigs te /
translated: It should be a case of the observation of an incompatible object.

original: don gcig pa'i yul can dang don tha dad pa'i yul can dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gcig pa'i yul can dang don tha dad pa'i yul can dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because a reason that is based on the same object and a reason that is based on a different object are incompatible.

original: ji ltar srid pa bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no error, because it is taught in accordance with what is possible.

original: thal ba dang bzlog pa'i thal ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thal ba dang bzlog pa'i thal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called â€œconsequenceâ€ and â€œreverse consequenceâ€ are as follows.

original: yul gcig pa can nyid yin na yang yul can gcig la sogs pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir thal ba la ma nges pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gcig pa can nyid yin na yang yul can gcig la sogs pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir thal ba la ma nges pa'i ma yin no //
translated: Even if they have the same object, the words one, etc., are not synonymous, so the reductio is not established.

original: rnam grangs nyid ma yin na yang tha dad pa med pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs nyid ma yin na yang tha dad pa med pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if they are synonymous, the reductio is not established, because they have the same object.

original: bzlog pa'i thal ba la ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i thal ba la ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: The reductio is not established.

original: tha dad ces bya ba'i mdo yin no //
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba'i mdo yin no //
translated: The sutra says, â€œdifferent.â€

original: 'di'i bshad pa nyid tha dad pa'i yul can nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa nyid tha dad pa'i yul can nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary explains, â€œhaving different objects.â€

original: mdo mdzad pa ni tha dad pa ni yul tha dad pa can du bzhed do zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½gang dag don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba bshad pa gang yin pa de la ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mdo mdzad pa ni tha dad pa ni yul tha dad pa can du bzhed do zhes bya ba'i don to // gang dag don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba bshad pa gang yin pa de la ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: The author of the sutra maintains that different means having different objects.

original: gcig la sogs pa'i sgra rnams ni don gcig pa'i yul can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'i sgra rnams ni don gcig pa'i yul can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reductio that is explained by the words, â€œIf they have the same object,â€ etc., is not established, because the words one, etc., do not have the same object.

original: de bas na sgra rnams nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sgra de dag ni tha dad pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba'i bzlog pa'i thal ba gang yin pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sgra rnams nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sgra de dag ni tha dad pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba'i bzlog pa'i thal ba gang yin pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because the words themselves are not non-actions, the reductio that the words have a different object is an affirmation of what is already established.

original: ldog pa'i tha dad pas gcig la sogs pa'i sgra rnams don tha dad pa'i yul can nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tha dad pas gcig la sogs pa'i sgra rnams don tha dad pa'i yul can nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established that the words one, etc. have different objects by way of the exclusion of the other.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kyang las nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ldog pa khas blangs pa @110b yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kyang las nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ldog pa khas blangs pa @110b yin no //
translated: By way of exclusion means that the exclusion of non-action, etc. is accepted by the other.

original: de bas na ldog pa'i sgo nas de dag rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa'i sgo nas de dag rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be posited by way of exclusion.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni las ma yin pa la sogs pa nye bar dgod pas so //ğŸ”½ma grub pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni grub pa la sogs pas sgrub pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni las ma yin pa la sogs pa nye bar dgod pas so // ma grub pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni grub pa la sogs pas sgrub pa gzung ngo //
translated: By this means means by positing non-action, etc.ğŸ”½By the word etc. in nonestablished, etc. are included established, etc.

original: ma grub par yang thal ba bzlog na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma grub par yang thal ba bzlog na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the reductio is reversed in the case of nonestablished, etc. it is an affirmation of what is already established.

original: ji ltar na nye bar dgod pa 'dis kyang ma grub pa la sogs pa'i gzung btsugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nye bar dgod pa 'dis kyang ma grub pa la sogs pa'i gzung btsugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that this formulation also establishes the non-establishment of difference?

original: ldog pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i don can nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ldog pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i don can nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, â€œbecause of the difference in the exclusion,â€ because of the difference in the object.

original: ji ltar las ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras ldog pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i don can yin pa de ltar gcig la sogs pa'i sgra yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar las ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras ldog pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i don can yin pa de ltar gcig la sogs pa'i sgra yang yin no //
translated: Just as the words non-action, etc., have a different object because of the difference in the exclusion, so also do the words one, etc.

original: de bzhin du las ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgra don gcig pa'i yul can yin na yang rnam grangs ma yin par 'dod ching /
analyzed: de bzhin du las ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgra don gcig pa'i yul can yin na yang rnam grangs ma yin par 'dod ching /
translated: In the same way, even when the words non-action, etc., have the same object, they are not synonyms.

original: rnam grangs yin na yang don tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //ğŸ”½chos gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs yin na yang don tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no // chos gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And even when they are synonyms, they have different objects. Thus, they are not ascertained.

original: chos can de la rnam par gnas pa'i chos rnams spong bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos can de la rnam par gnas pa'i chos rnams spong bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œThey eliminate other propertiesâ€ means that they eliminate the properties that are present in that subject.

original: de ltar na bum pa'i ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i sgras bum pa la yod pa'i sra ba nyid la sogs pa spangs nas rdzas gzhan dang bar ma chod pa tsam ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na bum pa'i ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i sgras bum pa la yod pa'i sra ba nyid la sogs pa spangs nas rdzas gzhan dang bar ma chod pa tsam ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, the so-called possession of a pot is indicated by the word possession, excluding the solidity, etc. that exist in the pot, and merely showing the immediate absence of a different substance.

original: don gcig brjod kyang don dam par zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du'o //
analyzed: don gcig brjod kyang don dam par zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du'o //
translated: Although the same meaning is expressed, the word ultimately means in reality.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga dag gis zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga dag gis zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba dag gis so //
translated: Both aspects means by excluding and not excluding other distinctions.

original: sgra 'di la zhes bya ba ni chos can rjod par byed pa dag la'o //
analyzed: sgra 'di la zhes bya ba ni chos can rjod par byed pa dag la'o //
translated: This word refers to those that express the subject.

original: tshogs pa rjod par byed pa dag ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa rjod par byed pa dag ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Those that express the collection are words like pot, etc.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin par nus pa nyid la /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin par nus pa nyid la /
translated: That is, the collection of form, etc. is capable of apprehending water, etc.

original: tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir du brdar byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir du brdar byas pa yin gyi /
translated: It is a convention made for the sake of ease of expression.

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a substance that is a whole,

original: de ni sngar bkag zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar bkag zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that has already been refuted earlier.

original: so sor nges pa ni dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: so sor nges pa ni dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The specific is, for example, the so-called visual consciousness, etc.

original: gzugs ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa byed par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa byed par nus pa yin la /
translated: Form is capable of producing the visual consciousness as its effect.

original: dri ni sna'i rnam par shes pa byed par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: dri ni sna'i rnam par shes pa byed par nus pa yin no //
translated: Odor is capable of producing the olfactory consciousness as its effect.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis yang rang gi rnam par shes pa la ltos nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis yang rang gi rnam par shes pa la ltos nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the others should be stated in terms of their own consciousnesses.

original: spangs nas zhes bya ba la brjod pa med par ro //
analyzed: spangs nas zhes bya ba la brjod pa med par ro //
translated: The word excluding means without.

original: de @111a * //ğŸ”½'bras mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de @111a * // 'bras mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That is to say,

original: bum pa'i dbyibs can gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi 'bras bu mtshungs pa gang yin de'i rgyu min pa ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i dbyibs can gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi 'bras bu mtshungs pa gang yin de'i rgyu min pa ste /
translated: The word similar in the statement similar effect means that the form, etc.

original: shing la sogs pa'i dbyibs can gyi gzugs la sogs pa de rnams gcod pa gang yin pa de la 'jug par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i dbyibs can gyi gzugs la sogs pa de rnams gcod pa gang yin pa de la 'jug par 'gyur ro//
translated: That cutting is the operation of those forms, etc. which have the shape of a tree, etc.

original: de nyid ni rdzas du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdzas du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That very [operation] is explained by many substances and so on.

original: rdzas du ma yod na yang ste gzugs dang dri la sogs pa'i rdzas yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: rdzas du ma yod na yang ste gzugs dang dri la sogs pa'i rdzas yod na yang ngo //
translated: Even though there are many substances, i.e., even though there are substances such as form, smell, etc.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra tshogs pa rjod par byed pa yin pa de bas na du ma'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir tshig gcig par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra tshogs pa rjod par byed pa yin pa de bas na du ma'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir tshig gcig par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the word â€œvase,â€ etc., expresses a collection, then it is not a single word because it has many objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œform, etc.,â€ etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the excellence of the nature of form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi nus pa yang du ma nyid ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi nus pa yang du ma nyid ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: the potency which has the nature of form, etc., is not many.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig byed pa can yin no zhes kha cig brjod do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig byed pa can yin no zhes kha cig brjod do //
translated: Thus, it is by nature a single effect.

original: bum pa'i sgras 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi so sor nges pa'i don spang ba gang yin pa de brjod pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de dag ni don spong ba brjod pa can te /

translated: Those who express the exclusion of the object, which is the exclusion of the ascertained object characterized by the result of the eye consciousness, etc., by the word pot, are those who express the exclusion of the object.

translated: The word â€œgenusâ€ and the word â€œcollectionâ€ are the expressers.ğŸ”½In the passage beginning with â€œThe word â€˜genusâ€™ . . . ,â€

original: rigs kyi sgra ni rang gi khyad par mi spang ba yin la /

original: tshogs pa'i sgra ni spang ba yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i sgra ni spang ba yin no //
translated: The word â€œcollectionâ€ does exclude .

analyzed: bum pa'i sgra yang bum pa'i khyad par la stos nas rigs rjod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir rigs dang tshogs pa rjod byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: gzugs @111b la sogs pa'i tshogs pa can la ltos nas yin gyi /

translated: The term â€œcollectionâ€ is used to refer to a pot in dependence upon a particular collection of form, etc. that exists in the state of gold, etc. and exists in the aspect of a pot,

analyzed: thams cad la bum pa ma yin par rnam par bcad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught that everything is excluded from being a pot.ğŸ”½Since the particular collection is not excluded,

analyzed: de tshogs pa'i khyad par rnams mi spong bas zhes bya ba la rigs rjod par byed pa'i bum pa'i sgra des tshogs pa'i khyad par rnams mi spong bas /
translated: the term â€œpot,â€ which expresses a class, does not exclude the particular collection.

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par rjod par byed pa gser las byas pa la sogs pa'i sgra de dag dang lhan cig gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par rjod par byed pa gser las byas pa la sogs pa'i sgra de dag dang lhan cig gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The words that express the particular of the collection, such as â€œmade of gold,â€ etc., are co-referential with those words.

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra thams cad tshogs pa'i khyad par la ltos nas rigs kyi sgrar 'gyur ram /
translated: Are all words that have the word â€œcollectionâ€ in them words for a class, in dependence on the particular of the collection?ğŸ”½Or are there exceptions?

analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na tshogs pa'i sgra ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The word â€œcollectionâ€ is of two types.

analyzed: rang gi tshogs pa can la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang dri dang ro la sogs pa la ltos nas so //

analyzed: des ni de spong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: That does not exclude it means that it does not exclude form, etc.

original: rdul phra rab gcig pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa nyid 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa nyid 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the word â€œform,â€ etc., is also used for a single atom, it is not contradictory for it to be used for a substance that is not the nature of a collection.

original: 'ga' zhig ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Some means words such as â€œpot.â€

original: yul gyi khyad par la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshogs pa can la ltos nas tshogs pa'i sgra'i ngo bo ni tshogs pa'i tha dad pa la ltos nas tshogs pa'i sgra dang tshogs pa'i tha dad la ltos nas rigs kyi sgra yin no //

translated: The phrase in relation to the particular object means that the word collection is in relation to its own members, the word collection is in relation to the difference of collection, and the word type is in relation to the difference of collection.

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo ni rigs dang tshogs pa rjod par byed pa'i sgo nas so //ğŸ”½gzugs la sogs pa'i de dag gi so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad par ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu la sogs pa de dag so sor nges pa'i ngo bo can gyi bum pa'i gnas su grub pa ci 'dra ba 'bras bu chu 'dzin
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo ni rigs dang tshogs pa rjod par byed pa'i sgo nas so // gzugs la sogs pa'i de dag gi so sor nges pa'i nus pa'i khyad par ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu la sogs pa de dag so sor nges pa'i ngo bo can gyi bum pa'i gnas su grub pa ci 'dra ba 'bras bu chu 'dzin
translated: The word both indicates that the word type and the word collection are used to express both the type and the collection.ğŸ”½The particular power of each of those, such as form, is the cause of the effect, such as visual consciousness. The particular nature of each of those is like the establishment of a pot in a place that holds water, etc., as the effect.

original: pa la sogs pa de 'dra ba la bum pa'i @112a * //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'dis ston par byed do //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa de 'dra ba la bum pa'i @112a * //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'dis ston par byed do //
translated: The word like indicates that the particular nature of the cause is like the particular nature of the effect.ğŸ”½The word pot indicates that the particular nature of the cause is like the particular nature of the effect.

original: ji srid du gzugs la sogs pa chu la 'dzin par nus par ston pa de srid du bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji srid du gzugs la sogs pa chu la 'dzin par nus par ston pa de srid du bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes brjod do //

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa'i phyir //

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: The pot, etc., are the cause of the cognition of the pot, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu so sor nges pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
