translated: That which is the nature of form, etc., and is the cause of the individual determination of the effect, such as visual consciousness, etc., is so called.

original: dri du ma'i bdag nyid can las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dri du ma'i bdag nyid can las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the nature of many smells,

original: tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pa tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pa tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: from the nature of different smells, such as sandalwood, saffron, etc.

original: de dag las gcig med na 'byung ba las du ma'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /ğŸ”½de dang 'gal ba ni ma lus pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin par khas len pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de dag las gcig med na 'byung ba las du ma'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la / de dang 'gal ba ni ma lus pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin par khas len pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If one of them is absent, the effect is not multiple, because it is not produced from the elements.ğŸ”½The contradiction of that is the acceptance of the effect as a whole.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: de ni ma yin te mang po dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te mang po dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That is not so, because many are also referred to by the term â€œit,â€ etc.

original: rim gyis mig gi rnam par shas pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis mig gi rnam par shas pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in the case of the eye consciousness, etc., it is accepted that they do not exist sequentially.

original: de bas na rim gyis ma yin par de zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba can gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na rim gyis ma yin par de zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba can gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, â€œitâ€ refers to the consciousness that arises later, not sequentially.

original: 'byung ba rnams la phyis dang 'dra bar sngar yang bye brag med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams la phyis dang 'dra bar sngar yang bye brag med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the elements are not different from those that existed previously, they are not different from those that will exist later.

original: 'gyur ba ni 'dod na 'byung ba khyad par med pa can dag rim byed bzhin du 'byung ba can gyi lhan cig byed pa gnas skabs gzhan la ltos nas rim gyis rnam par shes par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni 'dod na 'byung ba khyad par med pa can dag rim byed bzhin du 'byung ba can gyi lhan cig byed pa gnas skabs gzhan la ltos nas rim gyis rnam par shes par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the elements, which are not different, are the homogeneous cause of the consciousness that arises later, like the potter who makes the pot, then the elements would be the homogeneous cause of the consciousness that arises later, in dependence on a different state of the elements.

original: de'i phyir de ltar go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba can gyi gnas skabs gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½rim gyis ma yin par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba can gyi gnas skabs gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½rim gyis ma yin par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, it says, â€œIn the same way, the other states that exist sequentially are also not the homogeneous cause of the consciousness that arises later, not sequentially.â€

original: gnas skabs gzhan yang 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan yang 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are effects that arise from other conditions.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang /
translated: Also, inhalation and exhalation

original: du ma nyid du mtshungs nyid phyir //
analyzed: du ma nyid du mtshungs nyid phyir //
translated: are similar in being multiple.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang /
translated: Also, inhalation and exhalation

original: rlung gi rdul phra rab du ma'i bdag nyid can yin no //ğŸ”½cha 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jug pa dang 'byung bar rim gyis yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung gi rdul phra rab du ma'i bdag nyid can yin no // cha 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jug pa dang 'byung bar rim gyis yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: are the nature of many subtle particles of wind.

original: gcig la rim gyis 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la rim gyis 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they apprehend parts and so on. This is because it is not logical that a single consciousness can gradually apprehend what is engaged and what is disengaged.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyogs bsgribs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyogs bsgribs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term â€œand so onâ€ includes such things as the obscuration of directions.

original: gal te du ma rgyu min zhes //
analyzed: gal te du ma rgyu min zhes //
translated: If it is said, â€œMany are not causes,â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa gcig la nus pa yod pa yin gyi @112b zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba la lan btab zin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa gcig la nus pa yod pa yin gyi @112b zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba la lan btab zin pa ma yin nam /
translated: and so on, is it not the case that the existence of the potential in a single consciousness has already been refuted?

original: bden te sngar ni 'grel ba byed pa yin la da ni mdo mdzad pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: bden te sngar ni 'grel ba byed pa yin la da ni mdo mdzad pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: True, but previously it was the commentator who was speaking, and now it is the author of the sutra who is speaking. This is the difference.

original: gnas skabs phyi ma'i khyad par gags byed nus pa med pa can gang yin pa de ni 'dir dpe nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs phyi ma'i khyad par gags byed nus pa med pa can gang yin pa de ni 'dir dpe nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The absence of the ability to obstruct the difference in the subsequent state is what is clearly intended here as the example.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba la go rims can gyi rgyu nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba la go rims can gyi rgyu nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The occurrence in sequence is pervaded by being the cause in sequence.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang rim ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang rim ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the opposite of that is being the non-sequential cause. Thus, the pervasion is by the contradictory of the pervader.

original: gyur ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: gyur ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye'o //
translated: The difference in the subsequent state and mental consciousness, etc. are in apposition.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes eye consciousness, etc.

original: phyis skyed par byed par khyad par med par zhes bya ba ni phyis skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de las khyad par med pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyis skyed par byed par khyad par med par zhes bya ba ni phyis skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de las khyad par med pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œThere is no difference in the later productionâ€ means that there is no difference in the nature of the later production.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid la de yod na 'byung bas khyab pa yin la ;
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid la de yod na 'byung bas khyab pa yin la ;
translated: The pervasion is that if it exists, it arises as its effect.

original: de med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then there is non-observation of the pervasion.

original: ji ltar gcig gi rgyu mtshan blo yin pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa sngon la 'byung ba can gcig gi rgyu mtshan ni gcig gi rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig gi rgyu mtshan blo yin pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa sngon la 'byung ba can gcig gi rgyu mtshan ni gcig gi rgyu mtshan no //
translated: â€œJust as the cognition of one is the reasonâ€ means that the reason for one that arises prior to the action is the reason for one.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œBecause of the fault that has been explainedâ€ means

original: cig car rnam par shes pa mang pos 'byung ba'i skyon gyis te /
analyzed: cig car rnam par shes pa mang pos 'byung ba'i skyon gyis te /
translated: because of the fault that many cognitions would arise simultaneously.

original: dbugs 'byung ba gcig nyid yin par rtogs na skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba gcig nyid yin par rtogs na skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is understood that there is only one exhalation, this fault would occur.

original: gal te 'byung ba mang skad cig / mang po nyid kyi rgyu skad cig ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba mang skad cig / mang po nyid kyi rgyu skad cig ma nyid yin no //
translated: If there are many elements, there is momentariness, because of the cause of multiplicity.

original: des ni dbugs 'byung ba bdag nyid gcig la gnod pa yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des ni dbugs 'byung ba bdag nyid gcig la gnod pa yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not mean that there is a single self that is harmed by the arising of the breath,

original: 'on kyang rim bzhin 'byung ba yin no zhes ji skad du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rim bzhin 'byung ba yin no zhes ji skad du bshad pa yin no //
translated: but rather that they arise in sequence.

original: skad cig ma nyid yin na yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba mang po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin na yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba mang po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they are momentary, sometimes many breaths arise.ğŸ”½Thus, many consciousnesses arise simultaneously.

original: de ltar na cig car rnam par shes pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na cig car rnam par shes pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: To explain this, he says:

original: rang rigs min pa'i dus can dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang rigs min pa'i dus can dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: â€œNot having the time of its own class.â€

original: rang gi rigs kyi dus las gzhan pa ni rang rigs min pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dus las gzhan pa ni rang rigs min pa'o //
translated: That which has a time other than the time of its own class is not of its own class.

original: gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has this is so-called.

original: de ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with â€œWhen that exists,â€ and so on.

original: rigs mthun pa gzhan yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig la rag las pa'i dbugs 'byung ba snga ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa gzhan yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig la rag las pa'i dbugs 'byung ba snga ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: â€œAnother of its class does not existâ€ means that the previous breath that is dependent on a single continuum does not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½khas len na yang 'jig rten pha @113a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol khas mi len pa'i phyir ro // khas len na yang 'jig rten pha @113a * //
translated: because they do not accept any other world.

original: rol grub pa yin pa de ltar na brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: rol grub pa yin pa de ltar na brtsad pa med do //
translated: If they do accept it, then the other world is established, and so there is no dispute.

original: pha ma la rag las pa'i dbugs 'byung ba yang de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: pha ma la rag las pa'i dbugs 'byung ba yang de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The exhalation of breath that depends on the parents is not the material cause of that breath,

original: rgyud gzhan la rag las pa ni rgyud gzhan dang 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la rag las pa ni rgyud gzhan dang 'brel pa'i nye bar len pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that that which depends on another continuum is the material cause of that other continuum.

original: de lta ma yin na dbugs 'byung ba de ni de las gzhan pa pha ma la rag las pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i pha ma'i rgyud la rag las pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbugs 'byung ba de ni de las gzhan pa pha ma la rag las pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i pha ma'i rgyud la rag las pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then that exhalation of breath would depend on the continuum of the parents, like the exhalation of breath that depends on the parents other than that breath,

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be the same material cause.

original: 'di ni 'og nas dpyod par 'gyur bas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas dpyod par 'gyur bas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Since this will be analyzed later, let us set it aside for now.

original: tha dad yul can phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar skad cig ma gcig la tha dad par gnas par dbugs 'byung ba mtshon par byed kyi gcig yul tha dad pa la gnas par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad yul can phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar skad cig ma gcig la tha dad par gnas par dbugs 'byung ba mtshon par byed kyi gcig yul tha dad pa la gnas par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they have different objects. In this way, the arising of breath is indicated as existing separately in one moment, but it is not reasonable that one exists with different objects.

original: de bas na yul sna tshogs pa can gyi dbugs 'byung ba dag ni skad cig ma gcig la yang ldan pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na yul sna tshogs pa can gyi dbugs 'byung ba dag ni skad cig ma gcig la yang ldan pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the arising of breath with various objects is also possessed in one moment.

original: de ni yul tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //ğŸ”½gcig ma tshang na yang rnam par shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshe ji srid du dbugs 'byung ba rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de srid du thams cad kyi tshe yin pa de ltar na nges pa de la skyon 'di yin
analyzed: de ni yul tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gcig ma tshang na yang rnam par shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshe ji srid du dbugs 'byung ba rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de srid du thams cad kyi tshe yin pa de ltar na nges pa de la skyon 'di yin
translated: That is said to be with different objects, etc.

original: par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Even if one is missing, consciousness does not arise. This means that as long as the arising of breath is the cause of consciousness at one time, it is so at all times. In that case, this fault is seen in that certainty.

original: dper na kho bos bstan pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can dang / yul gyi rnam par can nyid la sogs par tha dad par bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na kho bos bstan pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can dang / yul gyi rnam par can nyid la sogs par tha dad par bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has been taught that it is different in terms of having the nature of experience, having the aspect of an object, and so on.

original: rang gi phyogs la yang nye bar sbyor ba rnams gcig nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la yang nye bar sbyor ba rnams gcig nyid ma yin no //
translated: Even in your own system, the applications are not the same.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different from a single consciousness.

original: tha dad pa ni rnam par shes pa la cung zad kyang byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni rnam par shes pa la cung zad kyang byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were different, they would not perform any function for consciousness at all.

original: de bas na nye bar sbyor ba de tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na nye bar sbyor ba de tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, those applications would not be different.

original: brjod pa 'di las 'bras bu gsal ba dngos por gyur pa gcig mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di las 'bras bu gsal ba dngos por gyur pa gcig mngon du byas nas /
translated: We reply: If a single manifest effect that is an existent is not actualized,

original: phan tshun ldog pa'i lus can rnams kyi khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa ma yin na /
analyzed: phan tshun ldog pa'i lus can rnams kyi khyad par gyis rnam par gzhag pa ma yin na /
translated: and if it is not established by the difference of the bodies that mutually exclude each other,

original: gang gis na tha dad pa dang tha dad med pa'i dpyod pa 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na tha dad pa dang tha dad med pa'i dpyod pa 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: then by what means would the analysis of difference and nondifference be engaged?

original: 'on kyang nye bar sbyor ba tha dad pa ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi don ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar sbyor ba tha dad pa ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi don ni /
translated: However, the meaning of the treatise passage that is being taught is this.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu du ma las 'byung bar gyur ba rgyu des byas pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu du ma las 'byung bar gyur ba rgyu des byas pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa can yin no //
translated: The effect is the nature that arises from many causes, and it is the nature that is produced by those causes.

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyu can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu las ldog pa'i lus can du 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de ltar na gal te mig tsam la rag las pa ni de'i rnam par shes par gyur @113b ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyu can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu las ldog pa'i lus can du 'gyur ro // de ltar na gal te mig tsam la rag las pa ni de'i rnam par shes par gyur @113b ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it is the possessor of an effect that is not the cause of that.ğŸ”½Thus, if the eye alone is the support of the eye consciousness,

original: gzugs tsam la rag las pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzugs tsam la rag las pa de'i tshe /
translated: or if form alone is the support of the eye consciousness,

original: ji ltar mig gi skad cig ma gnyis la mig tsam gyis rten nye bar len pa can nam /
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi skad cig ma gnyis la mig tsam gyis rten nye bar len pa can nam /
translated: then just as the second moment of the eye is not the appropriator of the eye alone,

original: gzugs kyi skad cig ma gzugs tsam gyis nye bar len pa can gyi rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de ltar rnam par shes pa de yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skad cig ma gzugs tsam gyis nye bar len pa can gyi rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de ltar rnam par shes pa de yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: or just as the moment of form is not the appropriator of form alone, so the eye consciousness would not be the appropriator of the eye consciousness alone.

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is the appropriator of the eye consciousness.

original: de bas na 'dir yid la byed pa yang nye bar sbyor ba yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir yid la byed pa yang nye bar sbyor ba yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that mental attention is also applied to this.

original: gang gi phyir mig las nges pa'i yul can nyid dang / yul las gsal ba'i rnam pa can dang / rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yid la byed pa tsam la rag las pa las rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ldog pa'i rang bzhin can skye ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig las nges pa'i yul can nyid dang / yul las gsal ba'i rnam pa can dang / rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yid la byed pa tsam la rag las pa las rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ldog pa'i rang bzhin can skye ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because the eye consciousness is ascertained to have an object, and the object is ascertained to have a form, and the conceptual mental consciousness arises from the mere mental attention that is dependent on the object, it is ascertained that the nature of the eye consciousness is to arise from the combination of the eye and form.

original: mig dang gzugs dag gi nye bar sbyor bas kyang bskyed pa yin par rtogs par bya ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dag gi nye bar sbyor bas kyang bskyed pa yin par rtogs par bya ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: In the same way, it is ascertained that the eye consciousness is generated by the application of the eye and form.

original: de dang de las ldog pa gang yin pa 'di dang 'di nyid kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de dang de las ldog pa gang yin pa 'di dang 'di nyid kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference between the application of this and that is that this is the cessation of that and that is the cessation of this.

original: gal te ldog pa rnams dngos po nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na 'bras bu nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa rnams dngos po nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na 'bras bu nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If cessation is a non-thing, how can it be a result?

original: ldog par rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba 'bras bu yin zhes su zhig smra /
analyzed: ldog par rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba 'bras bu yin zhes su zhig smra /
translated: Who would say that the effect is that which is to be grasped by the consciousness that conceives of the reversal?

original: 'on kyang rgyu du ma las skyes pa de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de ldog par brtags pa de tsam gyi rten du skyes pa yin pa de ltar na de nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu du ma las skyes pa de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de ldog par brtags pa de tsam gyi rten du skyes pa yin pa de ltar na de nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: However, that which is a thing having a nature that arises from many causes is the basis for the mere conception of the reversal that arises in that way. In that case, that is the effect.

original: 'di la brjod bya mang du yod mod kyi re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di la brjod bya mang du yod mod kyi re zhig gzhag go //
translated: There is a great deal to be said about this, but for now, I will leave it.

original: des sngar gyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed na ni mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sngar gyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed na ni mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the phrase â€œwithout following the previous consciousness,â€ if it did follow, it would not be clear.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba'i phyi ma rnam par shes pa sngon du gsal ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba'i phyi ma rnam par shes pa sngon du gsal ba ni /
translated: Thus, the later consciousness, which is not clear, is preceded by the clear consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gsal ba 'bras bu yin pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsal ba 'bras bu yin pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Since the clear consciousness is the effect, it is not ascertained.

original: de la phyis 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa nus pa dang bral ba de las phyis kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: de la phyis 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa nus pa dang bral ba de las phyis kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: â€œSubsequently arisingâ€ means the subsequent consciousness that arises from the consciousness that is devoid of potentiality.

original: phyis kyi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun pas de bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyis kyi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun pas de bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œIn accordance withâ€ means that it is similar to the subsequent consciousness.

original: snga ma'i rjes su mthun pas yang phyis kyi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i rjes su mthun pas yang phyis kyi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: â€œIn accordance with the priorâ€ means that it is in accordance with the subsequent consciousness.

original: de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œThat is its cause and effectâ€ means that

original: gang zhig rjes su mthun pa dang / rjes su mi mthun pa rjes su byed pa de ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig rjes su mthun pa dang / rjes su mi mthun pa rjes su byed pa de ni rgyu yin la /
translated: that which is similar to the prior and dissimilar to the subsequent is the cause.

original: gang gis rjes su byas pa de ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rjes su byas pa de ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That which is similar to the subsequent is the effect.

original: dpe zlog pas @114a * //
analyzed: dpe zlog pas @114a * //
translated: The example is stated in reverse order:

original: sbyar ba yin te sa bon la sogs pa dang bral ba na skye bar mi 'gyur zhing ma bral bas skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyar ba yin te sa bon la sogs pa dang bral ba na skye bar mi 'gyur zhing ma bral bas skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: if it were devoid of seeds, etc., it would not arise, but if it is not devoid of them, it does arise.

original: sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like the effect of a seed, etc.

original: 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba la dngos dang rgyu la ni rtogs par bya ba'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba la dngos dang rgyu la ni rtogs par bya ba'i dpe yin te /
translated: The example of what is to be understood is in regard to the actual and the cause of the effect that is to be accomplished.ğŸ”½It is like the effect of a seed, etc.

original: sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o zhes brjod pas don gyis sa bon la sogs pa rgyu nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa lta bu'o zhes brjod pas don gyis sa bon la sogs pa rgyu nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by stating that, the seed, etc. are explained as the cause.

original: skyed par mi byed pa yang de yin la tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin yang yin pa de las khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i snying po can gyi lnga pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: skyed par mi byed pa yang de yin la tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin yang yin pa de las khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i snying po can gyi lnga pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: That which does not generate is that, and that which is the nature of the final state is that from which there is no distinction. This is the combination of the fifth case with the essence of a common locus.

original: gal te lus ni sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te lus ni sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin pa'o //
translated: If the body is of the mind, etc. is the anticipation of the doubt of the opponent.

original: gal te de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: gal te de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: If that, etc. is the reply.

original: 'dir sems lus gzhan gyi yan lag gi ngo bo dang / lus tha ma lus phyi ma'i rgyu yin no zhes gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir sems lus gzhan gyi yan lag gi ngo bo dang / lus tha ma lus phyi ma'i rgyu yin no zhes gnyis su bshad do //
translated: Here, it is explained that the mind is the nature of the limbs of another body, and the final body is the cause of the subsequent body.

original: de bas na yang rnam pa gnyi ga la yang dgag pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na yang rnam pa gnyi ga la yang dgag pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the objection is raised in both cases:

original: de'i yan lag dang rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yan lag dang rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase â€œtheir cause and conditionâ€ is a dvandva compound.

original: de nyid so sor sems gnas pa'i rgyu las 'di'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid so sor sems gnas pa'i rgyu las 'di'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains just that in the phrase â€œthe object of thatâ€ and so on.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: The phrase â€œits characteristicâ€ refers to the characteristic of non-apprehension.

original: / de ltar na re zhig yod pa 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i lus gzhan yod pa 'gal ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: / de ltar na re zhig yod pa 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i lus gzhan yod pa 'gal ba med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the existence of the intermediate state, that is, there is no contradiction in the existence of another body at the end.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: sgrub par byed pa yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is a proof of the intermediate state,

original: 'di las tha ma'i skye mched lnga rgyu 'ba' zhig nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di las tha ma'i skye mched lnga rgyu 'ba' zhig nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œThe five bases of the end of the intermediate state are only the causeâ€ and so on.

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba med pa 'di 'ba' zhig las so //
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba med pa 'di 'ba' zhig las so //
translated: The phrase â€œin thisâ€ refers to this non-contradiction.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa med pas na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i skye mched lnga gcig nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa med pas na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i skye mched lnga gcig nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Since there is no difference in their nature, they are the same.

original: dpe la chos can ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpe la chos can ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The subject is not established in the example.

original: skye mched skad cig ma snga ma ni dpe'i chos can yin zhing /
analyzed: skye mched skad cig ma snga ma ni dpe'i chos can yin zhing /
translated: The prior moment of the sense base is the subject in the example.

original: skye mched lnga yang gcig nyid yin na phyogs su byas pa las tha dad pa'i sgo nas chos can gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye mched lnga yang gcig nyid yin na phyogs su byas pa las tha dad pa'i sgo nas chos can gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the five sense bases are the same, then there is no other subject that is different from the position.

original: gcig la snga ma dang phyi ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la snga ma dang phyi ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no prior or subsequent in the one.ğŸ”½By the explanations in other treatises.

original: gnas gzhan du bshad pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi le'u dang po dang / @114b tshad ma rnam par nges pa la sogs pa las bshad pa dag gis so //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du bshad pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi le'u dang po dang / @114b tshad ma rnam par nges pa la sogs pa las bshad pa dag gis so //
translated: This is explained in the first chapter of this text and in the Ascertainment of Valid Cognition and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa ni dbang po las skad cig ma ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni dbang po las skad cig ma ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The other is asserted to be non-momentary from the sense faculties.

original: rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid la rgyu bstan pa ni ma spros so zhes bya ba ni gang phyir phyogs gzhan du rigs pa mang po bshad zin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid la rgyu bstan pa ni ma spros so zhes bya ba ni gang phyir phyogs gzhan du rigs pa mang po bshad zin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The statement â€œI have not elaborated on the reason for a different natureâ€ means that since many reasonings have already been explained in other contexts,

original: mdo mdzad pas ni 'dir rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo mdzad pas ni 'dir rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: the author of the sÅ«tra has not elaborated on the reason for a different nature,ğŸ”½which is the probandum here,

original: 'gyur ba mthong phyir zhes bya ba rgyu bstan pa ni ma spros pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba mthong phyir zhes bya ba rgyu bstan pa ni ma spros pa ste /
translated: in the statement â€œbecause change is seen.â€

original: de tsam zhig bstan gyi rgyas par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tsam zhig bstan gyi rgyas par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he has not taught it extensively, but only briefly.

original: gzhan ni cir yang mi rung ngo zhes bya bar rnam par bcad nas 'dod par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan ni cir yang mi rung ngo zhes bya bar rnam par bcad nas 'dod par byed de /
translated: The statement â€œit is not suitable in any other wayâ€ is asserted through elimination.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid kyi rgyu bstan zin pas bshad ma thag pa'i skyon gyi rigs ni cir yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin rnam pa gzhan nyid kyi rgyu bstan zin pas bshad ma thag pa'i skyon gyi rigs ni cir yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that since the reason for a different nature has already been taught, the type of fault just explained is not suitable in any way.

original: gnas pa po las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin du gyur pa yin zhing phan tshun tha dad pa de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dngos po ga la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas pa po las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin du gyur pa yin zhing phan tshun tha dad pa de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par dngos po ga la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Because it is not different from the one who abides, it is the intrinsic nature. How could there be a thing that is a particular state that is mutually different in that way?

original: gal te lus las de skye na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te lus las de skye na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The example is empty of the probandum, beginning with â€œIf it arises from the body,â€ and so on.

original: skye mched lnga'i skad cig ma snga ma'i phyi ma'i skye mched lnga nyid mtshams sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skye mched lnga'i skad cig ma snga ma'i phyi ma'i skye mched lnga nyid mtshams sbyor ba ma yin gyi /

original: 'on kyang lus nyid las dbang po rnams 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang lus nyid las dbang po rnams 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: However, the faculties arise from the body itself.

original: dbang po las tha dad pa'i lus gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung gis skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa ma gtogs pa /

translated: That body that is different from the faculties also does not exist.

original: gson po'i lus dbang po'i bdag nyid can nyid 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gson po'i lus dbang po'i bdag nyid can nyid 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the living body is itself the self of the sense faculties.

original: gal te bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las dbang po las reg bya'i bdag nyid can gyi lus gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang /ğŸ”½'di skad du dbang po las tha dad pa dang ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: gal te bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las dbang po las reg bya'i bdag nyid can gyi lus gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang / 'di skad du dbang po las tha dad pa dang ma 'dres pa /
translated: Even if, according to the VaibhÄá¹£ika scriptures, there is no body that is a different substance from the sense faculties, having the nature of tangibility,ğŸ”½it should be explained that there is no body that is separate from the sense faculties, that is not mixed with them,

translated: Following that, the Autocommentary states:ğŸ”½

analyzed: de las lhag mar gyur pa 'di yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The elements of speech are the effect because they are the effect of the elements of the body.ğŸ”½The elements of the body are the cause because they are the material cause of speech.

original: 'jig rten gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i lus la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i lus la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase â€œin a body that is manifest in other worldsâ€ refers to the fact that the bodhisattvaâ€™s emanations are not dependent on his own physical body.

original: sngon gyi skye ba'i lus la gnas pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba'i lus la gnas pa can gyi'o //
translated: â€œThe mind that is in the body that is desired in another worldâ€ is the mind that is in the body of a previous birth.

analyzed: sems gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di'i lus la gnas pa can gyi sems dang ngo //
translated: â€œAnother mindâ€ is the mind that is in the body of this birth.

original: de ltar na ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la ltos @115b nas skye ba 'di la gnas pa can gyi sems ni 'jig rten gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i lus la gnas pa can gyi sems te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba mağŸ”½yin no // skyes bu gzhan gyi sems bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /

translated: That which is located in the body of a different continuum is not the one that links with death, for example, Maitreya's mind located in Maitreya's body is not the one that links with death.

analyzed: 'dod par ni 'gyur na rgyud gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa can nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were to be so, then that which is located in the body of another continuum would be the reason.

original: de'i phyir de yang ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, that is also unestablished.

analyzed: sems can gcig gi skye ba'i khyad par yang rgyud gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because the location in the body is refuted, because the location of the mind in the body is refuted earlier.

analyzed: lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The reason â€œbecause it exists in a different bodyâ€ is unestablished.

original: gal te 'di ltar lus la gnas pa nyid bkag na 'o na ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten nas skye bar brjod /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar lus la gnas pa nyid bkag na 'o na ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten nas skye bar brjod /
translated: If you refute the existence of consciousness in the body, then how do you explain the statement that the sense consciousnesses arise in dependence on the sense faculties?

analyzed: dbang po la brten nas skye na ni lus la brten nas skye bar khas blangs ba nyid yin te /
translated: If you say that they arise in dependence on the sense faculties, you are accepting that they arise in dependence on the body,

analyzed: lus ni de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar na lus la gnas pa nyid yin no zhe na / dbang po'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In that case, the consciousnesses exist in the body.ğŸ”½The root text states, â€œThe sense consciousnesses are not the mind that exists in the body.â€

analyzed: gzhan ni brten pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus la sems gnas par 'dod de /

analyzed: de la brten nas skye ba ni ma yin pa de ltar na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: However, we do not refute that consciousness arises in dependence on the body. Therefore there is no fault.

analyzed: ji ltar brtan pa nyid kyang mi rung zhe na yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: How is it not tenable that it is stable? He says, because it does not abide in a place.

analyzed: 'gyur ba ni 'dod na brten pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus la sems gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang de la brten nas skye ba nyid yin no // de ltar gtan tshigs ma @116a * //
translated: However, it is just that it arises in dependence on that.

original: grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established,

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i sems gzhan la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: rang gi rgyud la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the support, it would be uncertain, because it links up with oneâ€™s own continuum.

analyzed: de'i mi mthun phyogs kyang des 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gal ba'i rkyen bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: And so on. Thus, the condition of contradiction is taught.

original: dus mang por yang rnam pa mang pos zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu 'gal ba'i rang bzhin goms pa yod pa can yang bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dus mang por yang rnam pa mang pos zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu 'gal ba'i rang bzhin goms pa yod pa can yang bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: And for many times, in many ways, and so on. Thus, the existence of the cause of the nature of contradiction is also taught.

original: gal te 'bru'i rgyun tshig pa yang nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir sbyor ba dang po'i 'bru la sogs pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya bas ston pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bru'i rgyun tshig pa yang nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir sbyor ba dang po'i 'bru la sogs pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya bas ston pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the continuum of the grain is burned, because it remains in the nature of the potency, the example of the grain and so on of the first application is taught by the probandum.

original: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun nus pa'i ngo bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun nus pa'i ngo bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The continuum of the grain and so on remains in the nature of the potency.

original: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun nus pa'i ngo bo gnas skabs rgyun cad pa'i rgyu'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid rtsod pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun nus pa'i ngo bo gnas skabs rgyun cad pa'i rgyu'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid rtsod pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the cause of the continuum of the state, the argument that the probandum is devoid of existence is not tenable. Thus, it is applied.

original: 'bru la sogs pa ngo bo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa gang yin pa de shin tu rgyun chad pa nyid kyi phyir gang las bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa ngo bo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa gang yin pa de shin tu rgyun chad pa nyid kyi phyir gang las bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin no //
translated: Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.ğŸ”½If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?ğŸ”½Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.

original: gal te de shin tu rgyun @119b chad pa ji ltar rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de shin tu rgyun @119b chad pa ji ltar rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?

original: gang zhig gang la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //ğŸ”½gang la rgyu'i rang bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gang la rgyu'i rang bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.ğŸ”½If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?ğŸ”½Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.ğŸ”½If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.ğŸ”½If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?ğŸ”½Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.ğŸ”½If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?ğŸ”½Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.ğŸ”½If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?ğŸ”½Whatever is the nature of a thing, such as a seed, is completely cut off, and so it is devoid of the thing to be established.

original: de shes pa de nyid sgo yin la des bsgrub par bya ba ste nges pa bzlog pa zhes bya ba gnod pa cang yi phyogs kyi rang gi ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de shes pa de nyid sgo yin la des bsgrub par bya ba ste nges pa bzlog pa zhes bya ba gnod pa cang yi phyogs kyi rang gi ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: If it is completely cut off, how can it be understood?

original: dper na rlung la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi sel ba'i sgro nas de'i gnyen po til mar la sogs pa nges par byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rlung la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi sel ba'i sgro nas de'i gnyen po til mar la sogs pa nges par byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the case of determining sesame oil, etc. as the remedy for the disease of wind, etc.

original: gtan tshigs gsum pa yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum pa yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The third reason is also unestablished.

original: gang zhig gang zad pa'i thabs rig pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang zad pa'i thabs rig pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is explained by the passage beginning with â€œOne who is not aware of the means of eliminating something...â€.ğŸ”½That very...

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni kun ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni kun ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: ...is the one who teaches.ğŸ”½The miracle of instruction is well known.

original: rjes su ston pa'i cho 'phrul zhes grags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la cho 'phrul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rjes su ston pa'i cho 'phrul zhes grags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la cho 'phrul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three miracles:

original: de la rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
translated: Among them, the superknowledge of supernatural power is the miracle of supernatural power.

original: gzhan gyi sems mngon par shes pa ni kun ston pa'i cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems mngon par shes pa ni kun ston pa'i cho 'phrul lo //
translated: The superknowledge of others' minds is the miracle of teaching.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni rjes su ston pa'i cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni rjes su ston pa'i cho 'phrul lo //
translated: The superknowledge of the extinction of defilements is the miracle of instruction.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir kun tu ston pa la yang de skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir kun tu ston pa la yang de skad ces bstan to //
translated: And because it is the result of that, the teaching is also called â€œprotection.â€

original: ji ltar kun ston pa la skyob pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun ston pa la skyob pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How is the teaching called â€œprotectionâ€?

original: de'i phyir gang gis sems can skyob par mdzad par mdzad pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis sems can skyob par mdzad par mdzad pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œbecause it is that which protects sentient beings.â€ğŸ”½The previous cause refers to the desire to benefit migrating beings, and the attainment of the state of a sugata through teaching.

original: rgyu snga ma snga mas zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang / ston pa nyid kyis bde bar gshegs pa nyid dang / bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis skyob pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu snga ma snga mas zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang / ston pa nyid kyis bde bar gshegs pa nyid dang / bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis skyob pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The state of a sugata is the attainment of protection.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa de'i phyir thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa de'i phyir thabs rnams la ni mngon sbyor mdzad do //
translated: Because of the desire to benefit migrating beings, he applies himself to the methods.

original: de bas na bstan pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he attains the state of a teacher.

original: thabs goms pa can thabs las byung ba bde bar gshegs pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs goms pa can thabs las byung ba bde bar gshegs pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
translated: One who is skilled in methods attains the state of a sugata, which is the result of the methods.

original: thabs las byung ba dang de'i rgyu mngon sum du mdzad nad de dag phyin ci ma log par bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir skyob pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs las byung ba dang de'i rgyu mngon sum du mdzad nad de dag phyin ci ma log par bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir skyob pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
translated: He is the Protector because he has attained the state of being a protector by means of the method and by means of the cause, and because he has taught those methods and causes without error.

original: 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma rtog pa'i sgo nas rgyu phyi ma grub pa yang dag par ston pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu ni phyi ma phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma rtog pa'i sgo nas rgyu phyi ma grub pa yang dag par ston pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu ni phyi ma phyi ma yin te /
translated: He is the One who Shows the Correct Attainment of the Cause by means of the Subsequent Consequence of the Effect. The subsequent cause of the subsequent effect is the subsequent cause.

original: snga ma snga ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The prior cause of the prior effect is the prior cause.

original: de grub pa yang dag par ston pas zhes bya ba ni skyob pa nyid kyis bde bar @120a * //ğŸ”½gshegs pa nyid dang / bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis bstan pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de grub pa yang dag par ston pas zhes bya ba ni skyob pa nyid kyis bde bar @120a * // gshegs pa nyid dang / bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis bstan pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed do //
