original: bstan pa'i ngo bo can gyi zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rjes su dpag pas shin tu mi srid pa dgag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bstan pa'i ngo bo can gyi zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rjes su dpag pas shin tu mi srid pa dgag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: He is the One who Shows the Correct Attainment of the Cause by means of the Prior Consequence of the Effect because he is the One who has Gone to Bliss.

original: de lta bu rgyur pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bu rgyur pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: He is the One who Shows the Correct

original: 'di nyid ces bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not taught to be this.

original: yang na skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i dngos po yongs su mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma nyid bstan pa'i ngo bo can yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i dngos po yongs su mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma nyid bstan pa'i ngo bo can yin gyi /
translated: Or else, it is the valid cognition that has the characteristic of complete knowledge of things that are useful for the purpose of a person, and it has the nature of being taught.

original: srog chags kyi grangs la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srog chags kyi grangs la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the characteristic of complete knowledge of the number of living beings and so on.

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston mdzad yin //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston mdzad yin //
translated: He is the teacher of the four truths.

original: zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: kun 'byung gi bden ba ni gtsor sred pa dang ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden ba ni gtsor sred pa dang ma rig pa'o //
translated: The truth of origin is craving and ignorance, which are primary.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is the complete pacification of suffering.

original: lam gyi bden pa de ni thob pa'i thabs bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa de ni thob pa'i thabs bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the means of attaining it, which is the insight into selflessness.ğŸ”½Among them, each truth is impermanent, and so on.

original: de la bden pa re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la skye ba dang 'jig ba can nyid kyi phyir mi rag pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la skye ba dang 'jig ba can nyid kyi phyir mi rag pa'o //
translated: Among them, the truth of suffering is impermanent because it has the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //ğŸ”½bdag dang bral ba'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o // bdag dang bral ba'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: It is suffering because it is not in accordance with the will.ğŸ”½It is empty because it is devoid of a self.

original: bdag nyid rang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rang gi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is insubstantial because it is devoid of a self-nature.

original: bsdus nas byed pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: bsdus nas byed pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: It is the origin because it is the cause of the massing together.

original: rgyu'i rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu'o //ğŸ”½rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir rkyen no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu'o // rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir rkyen no //
translated: It is the cause because it is the root of the cause.ğŸ”½It is the condition because it is the cause of the production of the result that is in accordance with the cause.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: It is the production because it is the sign of the connection of the cause.

original: phung po zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: phung po zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is cessation because of the destruction of the aggregates.

original: yongs su gdung ba thams cad zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba thams cad zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because of the appeasement of all feverish conditions.

original: phan pa nyid kyi phyir dang mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gyi nom pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa nyid kyi phyir dang mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gyi nom pa'o //
translated: It is excellence because it is beneficial and desirable.

original: skyon thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skyon thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is definite release because it is free from all faults.

original: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir lam mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir lam mo //
translated: It is the path because it is the means of definite release from cyclic existence.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //ğŸ”½yang dag par grub pa'i don gyis na sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa'o // yang dag par grub pa'i don gyis na sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable because it is endowed with reason.ğŸ”½It is the establishment because it is the object of correct establishment.

original: shin tu yang dag par 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu yang dag par 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the definite release because it causes the attainment of the highest resemblance.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag ni sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor rab tu grung pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag ni sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor rab tu grung pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The truths of suffering and origination are well known as the nature of establishment.

original: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang // sred pa kun nas 'ching ba'i rgyu //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang // sred pa kun nas 'ching ba'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the bondage of craving, the mind of error regarding suffering,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: sdug bsngal bsgrub par bya ba nyid du rab tu bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgrub par bya ba nyid du rab tu bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The truth of suffering is well known as the object to be established.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa dag yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa dag yin pa de bas na /
translated: The establishment is the truth of origination, as explained.

original: re zhig sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / @120b kun 'byung gi rnam pa go rims bzhin du rab tu bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / @120b kun 'byung gi rnam pa go rims bzhin du rab tu bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the aspects of suffering and origination are established in order.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal dang / rgyur gyur pa kun 'byung gi zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal dang / rgyur gyur pa kun 'byung gi zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the truth of suffering is the result of that which is corruptible, and the truth of origination is the cause of that which is corruptible.

original: de bas na de'i rgyu can gyi dngos po'i khyad par dang / lhag ma kun 'byung gi rnam par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rgyu can gyi dngos po'i khyad par dang / lhag ma kun 'byung gi rnam par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the specific nature of the cause of that, and the remainder, are established as the aspects of origination.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung dang sbyar ro //ğŸ”½gang la de'i rgyu yod pa de ni rgyu can no //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung dang sbyar ro // gang la de'i rgyu yod pa de ni rgyu can no //
translated: The word â€œthatâ€ is connected with â€œorigination.â€ğŸ”½That which has the cause of that is possessed of the cause.

original: de'i rgyu can yang de yin la de ni rgyu can gyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can yang de yin la de ni rgyu can gyi dngos po ste /
translated: That which is possessed of the cause of that is the specific nature of the cause of that.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the truth of suffering.

original: de'i khyad par ni mi rtag pa dang stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni mi rtag pa dang stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The specific nature of that is the aspects of impermanence, emptiness, and non-self.

original: lhag ma kun 'byung gi rnam pa ni rgyu dang rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma kun 'byung gi rnam pa ni rgyu dang rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: The remainder, the aspects of origination, are the aspects of cause and origination.

original: de dag ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi rab tu dbye ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi rab tu dbye ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the nature of the classification of suffering and origination.

original: bdag med pa nyid goms pas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yod pa rab tu bsgrubs pas 'gog pa ni rnam par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid goms pas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yod pa rab tu bsgrubs pas 'gog pa ni rnam par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Since the cessation of the afflictions through the cultivation of selflessness is well established, cessation is well established.

original: de yod na rnam pa lhag ma zhib la sogs pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na rnam pa lhag ma zhib la sogs pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that exists, the remaining aspects such as cause are established.

original: de bzhin du lam yang rgyu de yang gnod pa can nyid ni bdag med mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam yang rgyu de yang gnod pa can nyid ni bdag med mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba'i thabs bstan pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the path is also well established. The cause of that is the seeing of selflessness, and so on. This teaches the method for the complete pacification of suffering.

original: de bstan pas rnam pa lhag ma grub bo //
analyzed: de bstan pas rnam pa lhag ma grub bo //
translated: By teaching that, the remaining aspects are established.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang rgyu dang rab tu zhi ba dang thabs zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang rgyu dang rab tu zhi ba dang thabs zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o /
translated: The suffering of cyclic existence, its cause, its complete pacification, and the method are the terms of the syllogism.

original: // / tshad na rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad na rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: The Commentary on the PramaÌ„nï¬ avaÌ„rttika

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa /
translated: Book Four

original: phung po gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phung po gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The aggregates are called form and so on, that is, form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three types of suffering are

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de la tshor ba sdug bsngal ni dngos su sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: de la tshor ba sdug bsngal ni dngos su sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: Painful feeling is suffering in itself, because it is suffering by reason of the suffering of suffering.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: The cause of that and the condition of that are by way of indirect cause.

original: tshor ba bde ba ni dngos su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba ni dngos su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: Pleasant feeling is suffering in itself, because it is suffering by reason of the suffering of change.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen ni rgyu de'i rkyen ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen ni rgyu de'i rkyen ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: The cause of that and the condition of that are by way of indirect cause.

original: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni dngos su 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa ni dngos su 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal te /
translated: Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is suffering in itself, because it is suffering by reason of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de'i rgyu ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: The cause of that is by way of indirect cause.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rab tu bsgrubs su zin kyang yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir yang gal te sems can snga ma gzhan 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig @121a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rab tu bsgrubs su zin kyang yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir yang gal te sems can snga ma gzhan 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig @121a * //
translated: Although the coming and going of sentient beings has been well established, in order to establish it in another way, he says, â€œIf a sentient being is different from a previous sentient being,â€ and so on.

original: rten rgyang phan pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: rten rgyang phan pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: This is an anticipation of an objection by a LokÄyata.

original: de la dang por zhes bya ba ni goms par ma byas pa'i rten dang byis pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: de la dang por zhes bya ba ni goms par ma byas pa'i rten dang byis pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: In this regard, â€œfirstâ€ means in the context of not being accustomed to it and being a child.ğŸ”½This shows that he has not seen the cultivation of virtue, and that he has not previously engaged in it.

original: gang la goms pa ma mthong ba can 'dis ni goms pa ma byas pa nyid ston pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin na gzhan la gsal ba bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: gang la goms pa ma mthong ba can 'dis ni goms pa ma byas pa nyid ston pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin na gzhan la gsal ba bsgrubs pas /
translated: Since he has established the clarity of the other,

original: skye ba 'di la goms pa mthong ba'i phyir shugs kyis 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin par 'gyur ba de ltar na skye ba snga ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la goms pa mthong ba'i phyir shugs kyis 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin par 'gyur ba de ltar na skye ba snga ma grub pa yin no //
translated: because he has seen the cultivation of virtue in this life, by implication, he has previously engaged in the cultivation of virtue in a previous world. Thus the previous birth is established.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can ma mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye ba 'di la sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan mig gsal ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can ma mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye ba 'di la sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan mig gsal ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Similarly, even though one does not see that the clarity of the eye and so on is due to prior habituation in a former life, it is not reasonable that it is otherwise.

original: 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can med na mi rigs de'i dbang gis goms pa sngon du song ba can du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can med na mi rigs de'i dbang gis goms pa sngon du song ba can du grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is due to prior habituation.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can ma mthong du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can ma mthong du zin kyang ngo //
translated: Similarly, even though one does not see that the clarity of desire and so on is due to prior habituation in a former life, it is not reasonable that it is otherwise.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is established that it is due to prior habituation.

original: dang por 'dod chags la sogs pa la gsal bar khas len na /
analyzed: dang por 'dod chags la sogs pa la gsal bar khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that desire and so on are clear from the beginning,

original: byis pas goms par ma byas pa'i gnas skabs su 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can med pa shugs kyis goms pa sngon du song ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: byis pas goms par ma byas pa'i gnas skabs su 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can med pa shugs kyis goms pa sngon du song ba can ma yin te /
translated: then in the state of not being habituated by childish beings, the clarity of desire and so on is not due to prior habituation in a former life, but is due to prior habituation by force of habit.

original: dang po thams cad gdon mi za bar gsal bar 'dod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dang po thams cad gdon mi za bar gsal bar 'dod par 'gyur na /
translated: If one accepts that all are clear from the beginning,ğŸ”½then it is not reasonable that they are not clear in the beginning.

original: goms pa mthong ba sngon du song ba can de yang 'gal ba yin te de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa mthong ba sngon du song ba can de yang 'gal ba yin te de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is also contradictory, because it is not seen.

original: de yang sngon du rang bzhin mtshungs par byas pa nyid yin mod kyi zhes bya ba skye ba snga ma dang rang bzhin 'dra ba des byas pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang sngon du rang bzhin mtshungs par byas pa nyid yin mod kyi zhes bya ba skye ba snga ma dang rang bzhin 'dra ba des byas pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: And that is also done by the similarity of nature in a previous birth, even though it is done by that similarity of nature in a previous birth.

original: de bas na tshe snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can med pa bsgrub par bya ba la dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas pa la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshe snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can med pa bsgrub par bya ba la dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas pa la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the proof of the absence of the prior practice in a previous life, the example is also to be proven as empty for the Buddhist.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gzhan la dpe las 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gzhan la dpe las 'jig rten snga mar goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ma yin te /
translated: Is the example not to be proven as empty? It is not so, because the prior practice in a previous world is not established for the other from the example.

original: thog ma med pa can nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa can nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what he means: â€œThe fact that it is preceded by habituation is the probandum, the general fact,

original: bsgrub par bya ba de las yang bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid ma yin pa dang / grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de las yang bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid ma yin pa dang / grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: because the probandum is not empty of another probandum, and there is no proof of what is already established.

original: dang po'i gsal ba goms pa mthong ba sngon du song ba can nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po'i gsal ba goms pa mthong ba sngon du song ba can nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the first manifestation does not have the prior seeing of habituation.

original: de ltar thog ma med pa can nyid grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan te //
analyzed: de ltar thog ma med pa can nyid grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan te //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the fact that it is beginningless is established.

original: gtan tshigs 'di'i zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i zhes bya ba 'di'o //ğŸ”½de'i rgyu @121b nyid la khyab par byed pa ni de la ma 'khrul pa can nyid yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di'i zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i zhes bya ba 'di'o // de'i rgyu @121b nyid la khyab par byed pa ni de la ma 'khrul pa can nyid yin la /
translated: â€œThis reasonâ€ is the â€œmanifestation.â€ğŸ”½The pervasion of its cause is its non-erroneous nature.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i yang 'khrul pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i yang 'khrul pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the contradiction of that is its erroneous nature. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: de'i rang bzhin nges pa'i yon tan la brten pa yin la zhes bya ba ni bad kan gyi rang bzhin du nges pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de de la brten pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nges pa'i yon tan la brten pa yin la zhes bya ba ni bad kan gyi rang bzhin du nges pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de de la brten pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œBased on the quality of ascertaining its natureâ€ means that whatever quality is ascertained as the nature of phlegm is based on that.

original: rang bzhin de'i zhes bya ba ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gyi'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin de'i zhes bya ba ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gyi'o //
translated: â€œThat natureâ€ means the nature of bile.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu can nyid la khyab par byed pa de ni de mtshungs pa yod na de mi mtshungs pa med pa nyid yin la de dang 'gal ba ni mi mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu can nyid la khyab par byed pa de ni de mtshungs pa yod na de mi mtshungs pa med pa nyid yin la de dang 'gal ba ni mi mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is that if there is that similarity, there is no dissimilarity. The contradiction of that is dissimilarity. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: thal ba dang thal ba zlog pa dag ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshungs pa can zhes gang yin pa de ni mtshungs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thal ba ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: thal ba dang thal ba zlog pa dag ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshungs pa can zhes gang yin pa de ni mtshungs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thal ba ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The reductio and the reversal of the reductio are uncertain, because the similarity that is the same reason is similar, etc. This is an uncertain reductio.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa med pa dag la yang rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa med pa dag la yang rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a cause that is similar for things that are dissimilar, such as form, etc.

original: gang zhig gang mtshungs su zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zlog pa ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang mtshungs su zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zlog pa ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The reversal, â€œeven though it is similar to something, etc.,â€ is not certain,

original: gzugs la sogs ba 'byung ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshungs pa yod kyang mtshungs pa ma yin pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ba 'byung ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshungs pa yod kyang mtshungs pa ma yin pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, although there is a cause that is similar to the mere occurrence of form, etc., the dissimilar is observed.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu can nyid yin par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu can nyid yin par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t it accepted that form, etc., have a cause?

original: de ji ltar na thal ba dang bzlog pa las gzugs la sogs pa phyogs su byed ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na thal ba dang bzlog pa las gzugs la sogs pa phyogs su byed ce na /
translated: How, then, is form, etc., posited as the subject of the reductio and its reversal?

original: de tsam rgyu nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de tsam rgyu nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, â€œbecause it is clear that that alone is the cause.â€

original: gal te thal ba la 'byung ba rnams kyang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la chos mngon pa las 'byung ba'i rgyu can nyid yin par mtshungs na yang gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te thal ba la 'byung ba rnams kyang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la chos mngon pa las 'byung ba'i rgyu can nyid yin par mtshungs na yang gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par khas len pa yin no //
translated: If you say that the elements are also posited as the subject in the reductio, then, although they are similar in being the cause that occurs in the Abhidharma, you accept that form and so on are different.

original: gal te thal ba 'byung ba la yang phyogs su byed na gzugs la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du mtshungs pa yang mtshungs pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na de'i tshe khas blangs pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thal ba 'byung ba la yang phyogs su byed na gzugs la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du mtshungs pa yang mtshungs pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na de'i tshe khas blangs pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you posit the elements that occur in the reductio as the subject, then the reason that the elements are the cause of form and so on is similar to the reason that the elements are the cause of the subject. In that case, you would be contradicting your own position.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: To respond to this, BhÄviveka says, â€œIf that were the case . . .â€

original: gal te de la zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la'o //
analyzed: gal te de la zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la'o //
translated: â€œIn that caseâ€ refers to his own philosophical system.

original: bsdus pa'i don las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa bdag por gyur pa rnams kyis tha dad pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i 'byung ba rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams kyi rgyu yin zhes grub pa'i mtha' las khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa bdag por gyur pa rnams kyis tha dad pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i 'byung ba rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams kyi rgyu yin zhes grub pa'i mtha' las khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the summary is that the elements that are established as different by those who are masters of the desired and the undesired are the cause of different form, etc. This is accepted in the tenets.

original: 'byung ba tsam du smra ba'i 'byung ba tha dad pa mad pa nyid dag las gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa skye bar 'dod pa de'i tshe thal ba ni 'di med do zhes bya ba 'di @122a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam du smra ba'i 'byung ba tha dad pa mad pa nyid dag las gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa skye bar 'dod pa de'i tshe thal ba ni 'di med do zhes bya ba 'di @122a * //
translated: When one asserts that different form, etc. arises from different elements that are merely elements, then this reductio is not the case.

original: yin no // 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ni gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin no // 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ni gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the special nature of the elements means from the attainment of a special transformation.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gyur pa'i khyad par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gyur pa'i khyad par yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is a special transformation by its very nature,

original: rgyu mtshan med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then one would have to say that it is causeless, etc.

original: nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir te gyur pa thams cad la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir te gyur pa thams cad la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not certain, i.e., it is not the case that all transformations are transformations of the elements.

original: brtags pa yang rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa yang rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is also reasonable to impute, i.e., it is reasonable to impute the difference of form, etc., to the difference of the elements.

original: de dag gi khyad par yin na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams kyi khyad par yin pa na ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi khyad par yin na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams kyi khyad par yin pa na ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If it is a difference of those, i.e., if it is a difference of the elements, it is not certain,

original: 'byung ba tha dad pa de dag nyid las gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba tha dad pa de dag nyid las gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference of form, etc., arises from just those different elements.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na nyes pa'i rgyu can nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na nyes pa'i rgyu can nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If it were so, i.e., if the difference of form, etc., were due to the difference of the elements, then the following would be the case.

original: gang la nyes pa'i rgyu yod pa zhes tshig rnams par sbyar ro //ğŸ”½skyon de'i 'gyur pa gzhan yod na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang la nyes pa'i rgyu yod pa zhes tshig rnams par sbyar ro // skyon de'i 'gyur pa gzhan yod na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The words â€œthat which has the cause of a faultâ€ are to be supplied.

original: yon tan shes rab kyi rgyu'i nyes pa de'i gyur pa gzhan yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan shes rab kyi rgyu'i nyes pa de'i gyur pa gzhan yod na yang ngo //
translated: Even if there is another transformation of that fault, i.e., even if there is another transformation of that fault which is the cause of the quality of wisdom.

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni dri nga ba dang khro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni dri nga ba dang khro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Other than thatâ€ refers to foul smell, anger, and so on.

original: de bzhin du skyon gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //ğŸ”½ji ltar skyes bu de'i shes rab mkhris pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ba de ltar na de las gzhan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyon gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o // ji ltar skyes bu de'i shes rab mkhris pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ba de ltar na de las gzhan te /
translated: And so too, one should state the other faults in the same way, as is appropriate.ğŸ”½Just as the wisdom of that person becomes of the nature of bile, in the same way, why wouldnâ€™t he also see other qualities, such as foul smell and dust, that are of that nature?

original: rang bzhin de'i gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba can gyi dring ba dang / rdul la sogs pa'i chos kyang ci'i phyir mi mthong zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin de'i gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba can gyi dring ba dang / rdul la sogs pa'i chos kyang ci'i phyir mi mthong zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the response to the objection that was stated above.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
translated: â€œEven soâ€ and so on is the response of the proponent of tenets.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis de'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan re re nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis de'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan re re nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the method just explained, each of those qualities would be of that nature.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: â€œIfâ€ and so on is the response of the opponent.

original: de dang de'i zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rgyu dang 'phro ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rgyu dang 'phro ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: â€œThat and thatâ€ refers to the cause of wisdom and the cause of the spreading of light, and so on.

original: de ni ji ltar shes rab la sogs pa'i rgyu mkhris pa'i gnas skabs de yongs su gyur pa de ltar khro ba'i rgyu dang rdul gyi rgyu yang yod pa yin no zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar shes rab la sogs pa'i rgyu mkhris pa'i gnas skabs de yongs su gyur pa de ltar khro ba'i rgyu dang rdul gyi rgyu yang yod pa yin no zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: It is said that just as the cause of wisdom, etc., is the condition of bile, so too the cause of anger and the cause of phlegm exist.

original: tha dad pa zhes smra ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes smra ba yin no //
translated: It is said that they are different.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gyur pa re re yon tan thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gyur pa re re yon tan thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œDifferentâ€ means that each condition is accepted as the cause of all the qualities.

original: ltos pa'i bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu la ma gtogs par skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ltos par bya ba gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa'i bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu la ma gtogs par skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ltos par bya ba gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other activity of dependence, because apart from the cause of mere seeing, another activity of dependence on homogeneous cause is not accepted.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reason is unestablished.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par yod na yang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par yod na yang khyad par du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i'o //
translated: This is because desire, etc., do not become different even when there is a difference in wind, etc.

original: 'dis ni skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang @122b zhes bya ba'i gzhung btsugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang /
analyzed: 'dis ni skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang @122b zhes bya ba'i gzhung btsugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyon rnams khyad par yod na yang /
translated: â€œEven though the faults are different,

original: khyad par med phyir grub nyid min //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir grub nyid min //
translated: they are not established because they are not different.â€

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de bsgrubs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the explanation.

original: khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi lnga pa yin te /
translated: â€œIn the homogeneous elements, etc.â€ is the fifth reason.

original: de las nang gi reg bya skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las nang gi reg bya skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the internal tactile objects arise from that.

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'i'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'i'o //
translated: â€œFrom that, otherâ€ is the sixth reason.

original: khu ba zad nas khrag 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba zad nas khrag 'dzag pa'o //
translated: The semen is exhausted and blood flows.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu can nyid la de nges pa yod na /
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu can nyid la de nges pa yod na /
translated: If there is a certainty in just that cause,

original: nges par yod pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: nges par yod pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: then there is the pervasion that it exists.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang yod par ma nges pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang yod par ma nges pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And if there is a contradiction with that, then there is the non-ascertainment of existence. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: gzugs dang khu ba la sogs pa dag yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i tshig gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang khu ba la sogs pa dag yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i tshig gnyis pa'o //
translated: â€œEven if form, semen, etc. existâ€ is the second part of the seventh verse.

original: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / khu ba tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin pa nyid ni 'dod chags la 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / khu ba tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin pa nyid ni 'dod chags la 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is just the establishment of what is already established, because the mere cause of form and semen is not desire, because of the desire for desire.

original: gzhan 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œThe teaching of another as the cause of desireâ€ is

original: khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½khro ba las bzlog pa 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid las gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: khams cha mnyam pa la sogs pa'o // khro ba las bzlog pa 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid las gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba las bzlog pa ste /
translated: the equal proportion of elements, etc.ğŸ”½â€œThe opposite of anger is the nature of desire, and it is locatedâ€ means that the opposite of anger is the nature of desire.

original: 'gal ba 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bad kan gyi bdag nyid can de la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin bad kan gyi bdag nyid can de la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opposite of desire is the nature of anger, and it is located in phlegm.

original: de las skyes pa la de dang mi 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de las skyes pa la de dang mi 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: That which is born from that is pervaded by the nature of not being opposed to that.

original: de las bzlog pa 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the case of a contradictory nature. Thus, there is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid la gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid la gnas pa'i'o //
translated: In that regard, in that state means in the state of the nature of passion.

original: rang bzhin gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gi bad kan dang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de 'dus pa las gnyis ga ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'jug go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gi bad kan dang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de 'dus pa las gnyis ga ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'jug go //
translated: As for both natures, etc., the nature of passion and the nature of hatred are phlegm and bile, respectively. From their combination, both passion and hatred occur.

original: de bas na 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid las zhe sdang 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin nyid las zhe sdang 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that hatred does not arise from the nature of passion alone.

original: gnyis ka 'jug par rtog pa 'di yang bsal ba ste spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka 'jug par rtog pa 'di yang bsal ba ste spangs pa yin no //
translated: This idea that both occur is also refuted, that is, rejected.ğŸ”½ How? It is said,

original: ji ltar zhe na 'jug pa mtshungs par thal bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'jug pa mtshungs par thal bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: by the consequence that there would be a similarity of occurrence.

original: mkhris pa'i rgyu'i nyes pa dang / shes rab dang phrag dog la sogs pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de dag kyang mtshungs par 'jug pa can du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rgyu'i nyes pa dang / shes rab dang phrag dog la sogs pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de dag kyang mtshungs par 'jug pa can du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: and the faults that are the causes of bile, and whatever good qualities there are such as wisdom and jealousy, would also absurdly follow that they are engaged in the same way.

original: gal te ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshungs par 'jug par thal ba'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /ğŸ”½mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las 'byung ba can gyi gnas @123a * //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshungs par 'jug par thal ba'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las 'byung ba can gyi gnas @123a * //
translated: If one says â€œjust as,â€ and so on, it is a response to the qualm that it would follow that they are engaged in the same way.ğŸ”½The occasion of something that arises from the nature of bile, and so on, is engaged and disengaged from some phenomena due to objects and so on.

original: skabs kyi yul la sogs pas chos 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jug pa dang ldog pa de dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gnyis su 'dus pa 'di la yang 'ga' zhig 'jug pa mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /

translated: In the same way, in this case, where the two natures are included, some are engaged in the same way, but

original: shes rab la sogs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: not all, such as wisdom and so on.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
translated: That is not so, and so on, refutes that.

original: rigs mthun bag chags khyad par las //
analyzed: rigs mthun bag chags khyad par las //
translated: From the special latent tendencies of the same type,

analyzed: rag las pas ni 'jug pa can //
