original: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The faults of wind and so on are of the nature of the elements.

original: 'di ltar mkhris pa ni 'byung ba chen po me dang / bad kan ni 'byung ba chen po chu'i rang bzhin yin la rlung ni rang gi sgra nyid kyis bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhris pa ni 'byung ba chen po me dang / bad kan ni 'byung ba chen po chu'i rang bzhin yin la rlung ni rang gi sgra nyid kyis bshad do //
translated: Thus, bile is of the nature of the great element fire, phlegm is of the nature of the great element water, and wind is explained by its own name.

original: gzhan nam gzhan cung zad kyang med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan nam gzhan cung zad kyang med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no other or even a slight other.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other than form and so on,

original: tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not observed as separate.

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma @123b yin te gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar du ma nyid du thal ba'i phyir dang gzhi nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma @123b yin te gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar du ma nyid du thal ba'i phyir dang gzhi nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not not other, because it would follow that it is multiple like form and so on, and because its basis would be impaired.

original: gang las de rten yin /ğŸ”½gzugs la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gang las de rten yin / gzugs la sogs pa'am /
translated: From what is it the support?ğŸ”½It is the support of form and so on,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin no //
translated: or it is the support of attachment and so on.

original: de ltar khas len na yang zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mang po nyid khas len par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: de ltar khas len na yang zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mang po nyid khas len par 'gyur na'o //
translated: Even if one accepts that,

original: rnam par shes pa de tsam dag ces bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de tsam dag ces bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag ste /
translated: â€œConsciousness aloneâ€ means the mental consciousness,

original: yid kyi blo nyid kyi rten bkag zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi blo nyid kyi rten bkag zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the support of the mental consciousness has already been refuted.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni lnga nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni lnga nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses are accepted as five in number.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa so so tha dad pa khas len na nyes pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa so so tha dad pa khas len na nyes pa 'di yin no //
translated: This fault arises if you accept that the four great elements have a separate power to generate consciousness.

original: dbang po gcig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni gcig skye na thams cad skye ba dang / gcig 'gog na thams cad 'gog pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po gcig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni gcig skye na thams cad skye ba dang / gcig 'gog na thams cad 'gog pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Because of the fault that what is grasped by one sense faculty is grasped by all, and so on. The term â€œand so onâ€ includes the faults that if one arises, all would arise, if one ceases, all would cease, and so on.

original: khas blangs nas 'byung ba bzhi po rang rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khas blangs nas 'byung ba bzhi po rang rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having accepted that, he says, â€œThe four great elements are not different in their engagement with their own supports,â€ and so on.

original: so sor 'jug pa ma yin pas na tha dad pa med par 'jug pa can no //
analyzed: so sor 'jug pa ma yin pas na tha dad pa med par 'jug pa can no //
translated: Because they do not engage separately, they engage without difference.

original: gang yin pa de ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin 'di yin pa zhes bya ba la 'byung ba'i rten du nges pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing gzugs la sogs pa'i brten par nges pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin 'di yin pa zhes bya ba la 'byung ba'i rten du nges pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing gzugs la sogs pa'i brten par nges pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That is to say, the nature of the primary elements is determined as the support, and the nature of form, etc. is determined as the supported.

original: gal te de ltar na mi 'dod pa de'i tshe de dag gi rang bzhin nges pa med pa na zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo med pas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mi 'dod pa de'i tshe de dag gi rang bzhin nges pa med pa na zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo med pas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If you do not accept this, then the explanation of this passage, â€œif their nature is not determined,â€ is that â€œthe nature of the primary elements is not determined as the support, and the nature of form, etc. is not determined as the supported.â€

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dag rgyur byas nas /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dag rgyur byas nas /
translated: Because it is not possible to determine derivative form itself.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gnas pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gnas pa de'i phyir /
translated: Form, etc. is supported by the primary elements.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi nges pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi nges pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, form, etc. is derivative form. It is not possible to determine derivative form itself in this way.

original: de bas na 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rten dang brten pa'i ngo bor nges pa'i rang bzhin yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is the intended meaning that one should view it as having the nature of being ascertained as the essence of the support and the supported, such as the elements, and so on.

original: de la yang de ltar rtog na ni zhes bya ba ni lus dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du rten dang brten pa'i dngos por rtog na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½brtan pa'i ngo bos lus kyi bdag nyid can gyi rten yod na zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang de ltar rtog na ni zhes bya ba ni lus dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du rten dang brten pa'i dngos por rtog na yang zhes bya ba'i don to // brtan pa'i ngo bos lus kyi bdag nyid can gyi rten yod na zhes bya ba ni gzhan ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, if one conceives of it in that way, it means that if one conceives of the body and attachment, and so on, as the entity of the support and the supported, like the elements and the derivative form, then.

original: lus brtan pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: lus brtan pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: If the support, which has the nature of stability, exists, it means that the body has the nature of stability.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ma lus pa'o //
translated: And those means all of attachment, and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin du'o //ğŸ”½tha @124a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin du'o //ğŸ”½tha @124a * //
translated: Just like that means just like form, and so on.

original: dad pa med par 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: dad pa med par 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: â€œWithout faith, it would engageâ€ means that all the states of mind, virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral, would be without faith.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni'o //ğŸ”½ci ste 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba'i gnas skabs su lus rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni'o // ci ste 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba'i gnas skabs su lus rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod na /
translated: â€œThoseâ€ refers to the body and attachment, etc.ğŸ”½If you assert that the body changes its state when attachment, etc., do not arise,

original: gang gis na 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis na 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba'am /
translated: then why would attachment, etc., not arise

original: nus pa med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: nus pa med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: or become powerless?

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba ni de'i rten gyi rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba ni de'i rten gyi rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: When that happens, the change in state is the absence of the nature of the basis.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa de la 'byung ba dag rten gyi rang bzhin de med pas 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa de la 'byung ba dag rten gyi rang bzhin de med pas 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of attachment, etc., would be destroyed by the absence of the nature of the basis.

original: de ltar na skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar na skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: Thus, it would lose its nonmomentariness.

original: 'jig pa med na ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i dus na yang 'byung ba dag sngar gyi ngo bo 'jig pa med pa de'i tshe sngar yang ste /ğŸ”½'dod chags la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dag rten nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: 'jig pa med na ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i dus na yang 'byung ba dag sngar gyi ngo bo 'jig pa med pa de'i tshe sngar yang ste / 'dod chags la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dag rten nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: If they do not disintegrate, then just as they are not supports of attachment and so on when attachment and so on have not yet arisen, they would also not be supports of attachment and so on when attachment and so on have arisen, because they would not disintegrate from their previous state.ğŸ”½If you accept that they are supports of attachment and so on when attachment and so on have arisen,

original: 'byung ba dag rten ma yin pa de ltar skyes pa'i gnas skabs la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag rten ma yin pa de ltar skyes pa'i gnas skabs la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then just as the primary elements are not supports of attachment and so on when attachment and so on have not yet arisen, they would also not be supports of attachment and so on when attachment and so on have arisen, because there would be no difference between the time when attachment and so on have arisen and the time when attachment and so on have not yet arisen.

original: 'dod par ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dod par ni 'gyur na /
translated: If you accept that,

original: dus thams cad du tha dad pa med par 'dod chags la sogs pa 'jug pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dus thams cad du tha dad pa med par 'dod chags la sogs pa 'jug pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then attachment and so on would operate at all times without distinction.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond: That is not so.

original: nyon mongs pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye ba yin gyi thams cad thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye ba yin gyi thams cad thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin no //
translated: Some afflictions arise at some times, but not all afflictions arise at all times.

original: rten dang brten pa nyid du so sor nges pa de la tha dad pa med par gnas pas khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang tha dad par gnas pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa nyid du so sor nges pa de la tha dad pa med par gnas pas khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang tha dad par gnas pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is that whatever is ascertained as a basis and something based on it must be non-different. The contradiction is that they are different. Thus, this is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: tshvar gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni skyar bar gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: tshvar gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni skyar bar gyur ba la'o //
translated: â€œIn the case of a substituteâ€ means in the case of a replacement.

original: don dam pa'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su yod pa'i'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su yod pa'i'o //
translated: â€œUltimateâ€ means of a subsequent existence.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni myos pa'i nus pa yang chang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni myos pa'i nus pa yang chang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe reason is not establishedâ€ means that the capacity for intoxication is alcohol.

original: dngos 'jig 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po de 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos 'jig 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po de 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: â€œThe thing would be destroyedâ€ and so on. The thing would be destroyed.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gzhan gyi myos pa'i nus pa'i tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa chang gnas pa na yang myos pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa 'di ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gzhan gyi myos pa'i nus pa'i tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa chang gnas pa na yang myos pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa 'di ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: â€œThe reason is not establishedâ€ means that the capacity for intoxication is established as different from alcohol, because this explanation is not established.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa 'dod pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pa 'dis kyang myos pa'i nus pa @124b tha dad pa grub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub par gnas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa 'dod pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pa 'dis kyang myos pa'i nus pa @124b tha dad pa grub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub par gnas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the reason is not established, because the capacity for intoxication is established as distinct.

original: chang ma tshang ba med par gnas pa'i ngo bor gnas pa myos pa'i nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chang ma tshang ba med par gnas pa'i ngo bor gnas pa myos pa'i nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the capacity for intoxication is established in the nature of the complete state of the beer.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs ni tha dad par grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs ni tha dad par grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, the reason is established as distinct.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos so //
translated: In this way, he says, â€œIf the capacity for intoxication is not established as distinct,â€ and so on.

original: gang gi tshe myos pa'i nus pa tha dad pa ma grub pa de'i tshe don dam pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po btsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe myos pa'i nus pa tha dad pa ma grub pa de'i tshe don dam pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po btsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: When the capacity for intoxication is not established as distinct, then in order to search for the ultimate basis and dependent thing,

original: sangs rgyas pas bshad pa'i gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas bshad pa'i gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: in order to show that the reason explained by the Buddhist is established, he says, â€œThat which is just that,â€ and so on.

original: snang ba tha dad pa can te rnam par shes pa gang la yul gyi rnam pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa can te rnam par shes pa gang la yul gyi rnam pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That consciousness which has the aspect of an object is called that.

original: de dag gis brtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis brtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are investigated.

original: lus dang sems dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul gzhan 'dzin ba can gyi rang gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul las gzhan ba lang la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul gzhan 'dzin ba can gyi rang gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul las gzhan ba lang la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of another's body and mind, etc. is the mental consciousness which is a conceptual discrimination of an object other than its own object, such as a cow, etc.

original: yang dag par rig par byed pa ni sems can gyi rnam pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na rang gis rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rig par byed pa ni sems can gyi rnam pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na rang gis rig pa'o //
translated: It is self-cognized when it becomes the state of the aspect of a sentient being.

original: gal te rang gi rgyud la lus dang sems lhan cig dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyud la lus dang sems lhan cig dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you ask, Are they the same because body and mind are observed together in one's own continuum?,

original: lhan cig dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: he says, Even though they are observed together, etc.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lus so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lus so //
translated: That refers to another's body.

original: dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthu pa dang / dmigs par byed pa'i skyes bu'i sems gang yin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthu pa dang / dmigs par byed pa'i skyes bu'i sems gang yin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The mind that is the object of observation is the basis, and the mind of the person who is the object of observation is the dominant condition.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, in another way,

original: snang ba tha dad can rtogs phyir //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad can rtogs phyir //
translated: because of the realization of different appearances,

original: zhes bya ba'i mdo de rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdo de rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: the meaning of this sutra is explained in another way.

original: lus kyang dbang po gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dbang po'am mig gi dbang pos so //
analyzed: lus kyang dbang po gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dbang po'am mig gi dbang pos so //
translated: The body is also by another faculty, that is, by the body faculty or the eye faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa yang gzhan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dbang pos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang gzhan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dbang pos so //
translated: Consciousness is also by another, that is, by the mental faculty.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa snga ma rnam par shes pa phyi mas dmigs pa na rang rig pa yin du zin kyang dbang po gzhan nyid yin pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa snga ma rnam par shes pa phyi mas dmigs pa na rang rig pa yin du zin kyang dbang po gzhan nyid yin pa de nyid yin te /
translated: When a prior consciousness is observed by a subsequent consciousness, even if it is reflexive awareness, the two are different faculties.

original: drug po 'gags ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'gags ma thag pa yi //
translated: The six that have just ceased

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: are the mental faculty.

original: zhes yid kyi dbang pos rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes yid kyi dbang pos rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by the mental faculty.

original: me'i gzugs dang rlung gi reg bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me'i gzugs dang rlung gi reg bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form of fire and the tactile of wind.

original: me'i gzugs mig gi dbang pos sam /
analyzed: me'i gzugs mig gi dbang pos sam /
translated: The form of fire is perceived by the eye faculty,

original: rlung gi reg bya lus kyi dbang pos gzung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rlung gi reg bya lus kyi dbang pos gzung ba lta bu'o //
translated: and the tactile of wind is perceived by the body faculty.

original: gal te mthong bas gzung bar bya ba dang / reg pas gzung bar bya ba bye brag la sogs pa rdzas gcig yin par @125a * //
analyzed: gal te mthong bas gzung bar bya ba dang / reg pas gzung bar bya ba bye brag la sogs pa rdzas gcig yin par @125a * //
translated: If you assert that what is perceived by sight and what is perceived by touch are the same substance, such as color and shape,

original: 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: then

original: snang ba tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba yang gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba yang gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: because what is perceived by different sense faculties would be the same, the first reason is indeterminate.

original: mthong ba dang reg pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œIf you assert that what is perceived by sight and what is perceived by touch are the same substance, such as color and shape, then because what is perceived by different sense faculties would be the same, the first reason is indeterminate.â€

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas sngar bkag zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas sngar bkag zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the substance of the whole has already been refuted,

original: gtan tshigs snga ma zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin gyi gnyis pa la yang rnam pa 'di nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin gyi gnyis pa la yang rnam pa 'di nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: the previous reason is an illustration, but the second reason is not indeterminate in the same way.

original: gzhan yid kyi dbang po mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yid kyi dbang po mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But donâ€™t you also not assert the mental faculty?

original: de bas na sems dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bas na sems dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: So isnâ€™t the mind also not something apprehended by a faculty?

original: de bas na lus dang sems dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na lus dang sems dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: So the collection of body, mind, and attachment and so on are also not established as reasons for being apprehended by different faculties.

original: gal te yang dbang po drug pa mi 'dod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //ğŸ”½de yang shes pa sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgra'i shes pa'i grub par byed pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don du brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te yang dbang po drug pa mi 'dod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // de yang shes pa sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgra'i shes pa'i grub par byed pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don du brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if you do not assert a sixth faculty, it is still not tenable that the mind is the self, because it is a collection.ğŸ”½And that is because the establishing causes of consciousness are different. The meaning of this is that the establishing causes of the consciousness of the eye faculty and so on are said to be the eye faculty and so on.

original: shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste gang la de tha dad pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste gang la de tha dad pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The establishing causes of consciousness are the establishing causes of consciousness. That which has those is said to have different establishing causes.

original: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gyur pa nyid med pa'i phyir sems bzung ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gyur pa nyid med pa'i phyir sems bzung ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind is not apprehended because it does not exist as the characteristic of an object,

original: sems nyid ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //ğŸ”½rang nyid kyi mkhal la zug gzer nyams su myong ba dang zlos gar mkhan zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: sems nyid ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // rang nyid kyi mkhal la zug gzer nyams su myong ba dang zlos gar mkhan zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: then we reply that the mind itself is not an object of apprehension.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œlike the pain in oneâ€™s own sideâ€ is a metaphor.

original: mkhal ma'i gzer ni bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du yin la /
analyzed: mkhal ma'i gzer ni bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du yin la /
translated: The pain in oneâ€™s own side is directly perceived by oneself.

original: zlos gar mkhan ni bdag dang gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: zlos gar mkhan ni bdag dang gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The actor is directly perceived by oneself and by others.

original: de dag kyang tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang tha dad pa yin no //
translated: And they are different.

original: de la brten pa'i gzugs sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lus la brten pa'i gzugs sogs bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i gzugs sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lus la brten pa'i gzugs sogs bzhin du'o //
translated: The phrase â€œlike form, etc., that is based on itâ€ means like form, etc., that is based on the body.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bad kan la sogs pa'i chos yin pa spangs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bad kan la sogs pa'i chos yin pa spangs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The phrase â€œin the manner just describedâ€ means in the manner in which desire, etc., are not properties of phlegm, etc.

original: rnam shes min pa'ang rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: rnam shes min pa'ang rnam shes kyi //
translated: And it is not consciousness.

original: nyer len min phyir zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyer len min phyir zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are not appropriated, that is, because the elements are not the cause of appropriating consciousness, which is not of the nature of the elements.

original: de ltar na phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad nyid ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par rnam par gzhag pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyus byas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad nyid ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par rnam par gzhag pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyus byas pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, all internal and external things are established as different or non-different by the cause of appropriation.

original: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ni nye bar len pa dang bral nas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ni nye bar len pa dang bral nas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The arising of things does not exist apart from appropriation.

original: bsnun pa las 'byung ba dang @125b ngag gi sgra dang / rlung gi khyad par dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa'i sgra'i khyad par gang yin pa de dag tu brtags pa de dag kyang rigs mthun pa'i rgyu'i khyad par phra ba yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsnun pa las 'byung ba dang @125b ngag gi sgra dang / rlung gi khyad par dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa'i sgra'i khyad par gang yin pa de dag tu brtags pa de dag kyang rigs mthun pa'i rgyu'i khyad par phra ba yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The difference of sound that arises from striking, the difference of sound of the breath, and so on, are also the existence of a subtle difference in the cause of a homogeneous type.

original: gal te nus pa thams cad yod pa ni yin na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa thams cad yod pa ni yin na /
translated: If all potentiality exists,

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs na 'di ni lhan cig byed pa yin la /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs na 'di ni lhan cig byed pa yin la /
translated: In the final stage, this is the cooperative condition and that is the appropriated.

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa 'di gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa 'di gang las yin zhe na /
translated: From what is this distinction derived?

original: 'jig rten snang ba dang bcas pa'i lam mtshungs pa la 'khrul pa ni ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten snang ba dang bcas pa'i lam mtshungs pa la 'khrul pa ni ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: It is amazing that you are confused about the path that is shared with those who have worldly insight.

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ni byis pa tshun chad la rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ni byis pa tshun chad la rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: For this distinction between the cooperative and the appropriated is well known even to the childish.

original: de ltar na mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa'i tshogs phan tshun lhan cig byed pa snga ma las phyis kyi mig la sogs pa'i tshogs ba skye par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa'i tshogs phan tshun lhan cig byed pa snga ma las phyis kyi mig la sogs pa'i tshogs ba skye par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the collection of eye, form, light, and attention are the cooperative conditions of the prior eye, etc.

original: de la lhan cig byed pa dang nye bar len pa dag tha dad pa med na /ğŸ”½ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skye ba rjes su byed de /
analyzed: de la lhan cig byed pa dang nye bar len pa dag tha dad pa med na / ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skye ba rjes su byed de /
translated: If there is no distinction between the cooperative and the appropriated,

original: mig dang gzugs dag gi ma yin /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dag gi ma yin /
translated: why does consciousness follow the arising of the mental faculty, but not the eye and form?

original: mig gi skad cig ma gnyis pa mig nyid kyi rjes su byed kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo'am phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi rgyun gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin /ğŸ”½gzugs kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa yang gzugs kyi skye ba'i rjes su byed pas 'jug gi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: mig gi skad cig ma gnyis pa mig nyid kyi rjes su byed kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo'am phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi rgyun gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin / gzugs kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa yang gzugs kyi skye ba'i rjes su byed pas 'jug gi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: The second moment of eye consciousness is a subsequent state of eye consciousness itself, but it is not a subsequent state of the nature of the object or the continuum of external form.

original: mig gi rang bzhin nyid kyi ma yin /
analyzed: mig gi rang bzhin nyid kyi ma yin /
translated: The second moment of form is also engaged through being a subsequent state of the arising of form, but it is not a subsequent state of the nature of the object or the nature of the eye.

original: de ltar na gal te nye bar len pas byas pa mi 'dod dri dang / ro dang reg bya ba la sogs pa phan tshun lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi rgyun gyi tha dad pa 'di gang gis byas pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te nye bar len pas byas pa mi 'dod dri dang / ro dang reg bya ba la sogs pa phan tshun lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi rgyun gyi tha dad pa 'di gang gis byas pa yin /
translated: Thus, if you do not assert that the object is created by the appropriator, then by what are the continua of form, smell, taste, and so on, which are mutually simultaneous coemergent causes, created?

original: gang gi tshe rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa bdag por gyur pa las rgyud gzhan la rnam par shes pa skye ba de ci'i phyir rgyud gzhan dang 'brel par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyud gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa bdag por gyur pa las rgyud gzhan la rnam par shes pa skye ba de ci'i phyir rgyud gzhan dang 'brel par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When consciousness arises in one continuum from the consciousness of another continuum that is its dominant condition, why does it not become connected to another continuum?

original: de bzhin dus la sogs pa dag las skyes par gyur pa'i myu gus bon gyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dus la sogs pa dag las skyes par gyur pa'i myu gus bon gyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the sprout, which is produced from time, etc., should be said to be the cause of the continuation of the seed.

original: de bas na rigs mthun pa dang rigs mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyun tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa ni nye bar len pas byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rigs mthun pa dang rigs mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyun tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa ni nye bar len pas byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the difference of the homogeneous and heterogeneous continua is made by the appropriator.

original: rigs mthun pa nyid kyang rigs mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa nyid kyang rigs mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: And the homogeneity is the cause of the homogeneity.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pas rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pas rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the establishment of the difference and non-difference would be causeless.

original: de bas na 'byung ba bzhi las tha dad pa'i sems nyid kyang rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pas skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'byung ba bzhi las tha dad pa'i sems nyid kyang rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pas skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the mind itself, which is different from the four elements, is produced by the homogeneous appropriator.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba de dag nyid tha dad pa med par 'jug pa yin du zin kyang thad dad pa'i rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba de dag nyid tha dad pa med par 'jug pa yin du zin kyang thad dad pa'i rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pas byas pa yin no //
translated: Even though the four elements themselves are engaged without difference, they are made by the homogeneous appropriator.

original: cig shos ltar na rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma @126a * //ğŸ”½yin pa'i nye bar len pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: cig shos ltar na rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma @126a * // yin pa'i nye bar len pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: If the mind arises from a cause that is not of the same nature as the mind, then the mind will arise from a cause that is not of the nature of a real entity.

original: 'byung bar gyur pa phyis 'byung ba dang 'dra ba rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa phyis 'byung ba dang 'dra ba rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is unacceptable.ğŸ”½The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas say that the sprout arises from the seed, and that the milk becomes curd.

original: ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las sha lu ka la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa gnyis pa mthong ba ma yin nam /ğŸ”½de dang de ni ma dpyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las sha lu ka la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir nye bar len pa gnyis pa mthong ba ma yin nam / de dang de ni ma dpyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: But this is not a good example, for the seed and the milk are not the cause of the sprout and the curd.ğŸ”½The seed produces the sprout by a transformation of its series; the milk produces the curd in the same way.ğŸ”½The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas say that the seed is the cause of the sprout, because the sprout is found after the seed, and because the sprout is not found when the seed is destroyed.ğŸ”½But this is not a good reason, for the same objections can be made against causality in general.

original: de ltar na re zhig bye brag ba dag gis ba lang gi lci ba nye bar len pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang des drangs pa'i sha lu ka'i rdul phra rab yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig bye brag ba dag gis ba lang gi lci ba nye bar len pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang des drangs pa'i sha lu ka'i rdul phra rab yin par 'dod do //
translated: The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas say that the seed is not the cause of the sprout, but that the subtle parts of the seed are the cause of the subtle parts of the sprout.

original: grangs can pa dag yang ba lang gi lci ba'i yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can las yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi sha lu ka'i rdzas skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grangs can pa dag yang ba lang gi lci ba'i yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can las yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi sha lu ka'i rdzas skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The SÄá¹ƒkhyas say that the seed, which is a substance consisting of the three qualities, produces the sprout, which is a substance consisting of the three qualities.

original: bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa dag gi gzhung gis kyang /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa dag gi gzhung gis kyang /
translated: The scriptures of the Vaibhaikas and so on also say this.

original: ba lang gi lci ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: VaibhÄá¹£ikas and so on assert that the substance called cow dung and so on is not a single substance,

original: 'on kyang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa rdzas brgyad 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa rdzas brgyad 'dus pa yin no //
translated: but rather it is a composite of eight substances such as form, smell, taste, tactility and so on.

original: de la gzugs kyi nye bar len pa las gzugs skye zhing de bzhin du rol las ro yin pa de lta na rigs mthun pa nyid nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi nye bar len pa las gzugs skye zhing de bzhin du rol las ro yin pa de lta na rigs mthun pa nyid nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: Form arises from the appropriation of form and taste arises from the appropriation of taste and so on. Thus it is the appropriation of a substance of similar type.

original: de kho na nyid bzhi tsam du smra ba dag kyang bzhi po nyid du gyur pa de ltar na rigs mi mthun pa'i nye bar len pa nyid las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhi tsam du smra ba dag kyang bzhi po nyid du gyur pa de ltar na rigs mi mthun pa'i nye bar len pa nyid las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Those who assert that there are only four elements assert that the four elements are the cause of the four elements. Thus they do not arise from the appropriation of dissimilar substances.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag la yang phyi rol gyi don grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa nyid las rnam par shes par 'byung ba yin pa de ltar na de la ni dpyad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag la yang phyi rol gyi don grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa nyid las rnam par shes par 'byung ba yin pa de ltar na de la ni dpyad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no /
translated: Even for those who maintain that consciousness is real, external objects are not established, and so consciousness arises from consciousness itself. In that case, there is no analysis of the object.

original: pha dang ma'i rnam par shes pa yang nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pha dang ma'i rnam par shes pa yang nye bar len pa ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness of the father and mother is not the appropriator of the body,

original: de nyid dang 'dra bar de'i rgyu dang 'brel par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang 'dra bar de'i rgyu dang 'brel par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be related to the cause of that body.

original: de ltar na de'i dran pa dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i dran pa dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow, absurdly, that it would possess memory, intelligence, and so on.

original: lam 'di dpyad pa mang bas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: lam 'di dpyad pa mang bas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Since there are many analyses of this path, I will leave it for the time being.

original: de bas na blo gang yin pa de rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i ngang tshul can blo snga ma'i nye bar len pa can yin te /
analyzed: de bas na blo gang yin pa de rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i ngang tshul can blo snga ma'i nye bar len pa can yin te /
translated: Therefore, whatever the mind is, it is of the nature of arising from its own continuum, and it is the appropriator of the previous mind,

original: dper na da ltar gyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi lta bu'o //
translated: just like the present mind.

original: mngal la sogs pa ni yod pa yang blo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so /
analyzed: mngal la sogs pa ni yod pa yang blo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so /
translated: The womb and so on are also the mind itself. This is a syllogism based on effect.

original: gzhan nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid bsal ba dang ; rgyu med pa smra ba bkag pa ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid bsal ba dang ; rgyu med pa smra ba bkag pa ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: The refutation of the other, the appropriating cause, and the refutation of the doctrine of causeless origination are the valid cognitions that undermine the opposite position.

original: de ltar na ldog pa la tshe tshom za ba can nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ldog pa la tshe tshom za ba can nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no doubt about the reversal.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs nas /
translated: Thus, having accepted that the elements are momentary,

original: 'jig rten rgyang ban ba rgol ba'i de dag kyang 'byung ba nye bar len pa nyid yin pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir @126b bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang ban ba rgol ba'i de dag kyang 'byung ba nye bar len pa nyid yin pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir @126b bsal ba yin no //
translated: the Lokayatasâ€™ argument is refuted because it is the elements themselves that are appropriated.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½rnam par shes min pa'ang rnam pa shes kyis //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ni / rnam par shes min pa'ang rnam pa shes kyis //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ in the verse meansğŸ”½that consciousness is not the self because it is not the appropriator.

original: nyer len min phyir zhes bya ba'i mdo'i gang gi sgra yin no //
analyzed: nyer len min phyir zhes bya ba'i mdo'i gang gi sgra yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the sutra statement, â€œIt is not consciousness.â€

original: gzhan gyi gzhung gis lus la sogs pa go rims nyid med pa can yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzhung gis lus la sogs pa go rims nyid med pa can yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu 'dod chags la sogs pa cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the body and so on of another are not in the same order, it follows that the effects of those, desire and so on, would arise simultaneously.

original: gal te yang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs can gyi 'dod pa'i dgos pa bsu ba yin no / grangs can gyis med pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dang thams cad du rim gyis rnam par shes pa gyur pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs can gyi 'dod pa'i dgos pa bsu ba yin no / grangs can gyis med pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dang thams cad du rim gyis rnam par shes pa gyur pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: If the SÄá¹ƒkhya says that the purpose of the statement beginning with â€œthe mindâ€ is to refute the assertion that consciousness arises from something nonexistent, and to prove that consciousness arises from something existent, then that is not the case, because the SÄá¹ƒkhya says that consciousness arises from the transformation of the self and the gunas.ğŸ”½The SÄá¹ƒkhya says that because something nonexistent does not arise and because consciousness is observed to transform gradually in all cases,

original: thams cad la rnam par shes pa'i nus pa khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad la rnam par shes pa'i nus pa khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: the potency of consciousness must be accepted in all things.

original: 'di ltar glang po che la sogs pa rtsva la sogs pa'i zas yongs su gyur pa thob pa can yin pa de bas na de dag gi nus pa ni rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la sogs pa la yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar glang po che la sogs pa rtsva la sogs pa'i zas yongs su gyur pa thob pa can yin pa de bas na de dag gi nus pa ni rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la sogs pa la yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because elephants and so on obtain food, such as grass, that is a transformation of grass, their potency exists even in the tips of grass and so on.

original: sems mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa can gyi ni 'byung ba rnams la snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi gnas skabs kyi ngo bo'i sems gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa can gyi ni 'byung ba rnams la snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi gnas skabs kyi ngo bo'i sems gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The mind of one who is not clearly conscious is the mind that exists in the form of a state that has the nature of illumination with regard to the primary elements.

original: de bzhin du rtsva ma chog gi rtse mo la snang ba'i bdag nyid gnas skabs kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsva ma chog gi rtse mo la snang ba'i bdag nyid gnas skabs kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, the mind of one who is unconscious, such as one who is in a coma, is the mind that exists in the form of a state that has the nature of illumination with regard to the primary elements.

original: sems dmigs pa'i sgrub par byed pa g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dmigs pa'i sgrub par byed pa g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mind is not the cause of the movement, etc., of the body, because the result of the mind, i.e., the body, is not seen to move, etc.

original: de ltar na gal te gson po'i lus bzhin du mngon par mi gsal gnas skabs na yang sems bdag nyid thams cad mtshang ba med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te gson po'i lus bzhin du mngon par mi gsal gnas skabs na yang sems bdag nyid thams cad mtshang ba med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If the mind exists in its entirety without any deficiency in the state of unconsciousness, just as it does in the living body,

original: 'bras bu rtsom pa la la gags byed pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsom pa la la gags byed pa ci zhig yod /
translated: then what prevents the result of the mind from arising?

original: gags byed pa yod na yang de de nyid yin no zhes khas blangs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gags byed pa yod na yang de de nyid yin no zhes khas blangs par mi bya'o //
translated: If there is something that prevents it, then it is not the mind that exists in the state of unconsciousness.

original: gzhan yod na de yod do zhes bya ba ni glang bo che la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: gzhan yod na de yod do zhes bya ba ni glang bo che la sogs pa'o ;
translated: If the other exists, it exists.

original: / bde ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni bde ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo can gyi sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: / bde ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni bde ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo can gyi sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: It is not of the nature of pleasure, i.e., it is of the nature of suffering, which is not pleasure.

original: de ni bde bar 'gyur ba ma yin no / de nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni bde bar 'gyur ba ma yin no / de nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not pleasure.

original: nus pa mngon par 'dod par glang po che brgya mngon par gsal ba dang sems nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: nus pa mngon par 'dod par glang po che brgya mngon par gsal ba dang sems nyid yin na'o //
translated: If it is the same, i.e., if the mind itself is the manifest hundred elephants, etc., which are the desired capacity.

original: gzhan yin pas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yin pas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ma tshang ba'o //
translated: If it is different, i.e., if the eyes, etc., are incomplete.

original: khyad par 'di rten can gang yin zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni 'byung ba phul du byung ba la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'di rten can gang yin zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni 'byung ba phul du byung ba la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of â€œwhat is the basis of this distinction?â€ is â€œbased on the excellence of the elements,â€ etc.

original: rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The existence of the phenomenon of interruption.

original: gang rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa de ni rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa can no //
analyzed: gang rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa de ni rgyun chad pa'i chos yod pa can no //
translated: That which has the existence of the phenomenon of interruption is the existence of the phenomenon of interruption.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi 'bras bu can zhes @127a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi 'bras bu can zhes @127a * //
translated: The phrase â€œpossessing a specific result such as attachmentâ€

analyzed: gyur ba'i khyad par 'jug med pas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
