original: gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan 'byung ba tsam cung zad gang yin pa de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan 'byung ba tsam cung zad gang yin pa de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The reason for the transformation is whatever is the mere occurrence of the elements, etc.

original: de rgyu med pa can nyid du 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de rgyu med pa can nyid du 'chad par byed do //
translated: This is explained as being causeless.

original: 'byung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang rtag tu nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang rtag tu nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The intrinsic identity of the elements is a single entity, and that is always capable.

original: gyur pa thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The point of the summary is that all transformations would occur simultaneously.

original: nyes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa ni de la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa ni de la zhen pa'o //
translated: The summary of the faults is this: Attachment to â€œIâ€ and â€œmineâ€ is clinging to them.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni zhe sdang dang nga rgyal la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni zhe sdang dang nga rgyal la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase â€œand so onâ€ includes hatred, pride, and so on.

original: de bas na skye ba'i dus na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba na bdag gi dngos po gdung bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba'i dus na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba na bdag gi dngos po gdung bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, when the afflictions arise, they torment oneâ€™s essential being.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i las ni bya ba yin zhing de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni longs spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i las ni bya ba yin zhing de'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni longs spyod pa yin no //
translated: Action is virtuous, etc. and its result is the experience of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: de dag gi rten ni gzhi'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rten ni gzhi'i dngos po'o //
translated: The basis is the entity that is the foundation of those two.

original: mtshan nyid de nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of those characteristics is called â€œhaving the nature of the three characteristics.â€

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i gang zag ces bya bas so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i gang zag ces bya bas so //
translated: â€œIt is not to be describedâ€ means that it is not to be described as a real entity.

original: dngos por 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa can gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i dang tshul can gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos por 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa can gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i dang tshul can gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: That which is a subsequent state of a real entity is called â€œhaving the nature of a subsequent state of a real entity.â€

original: gal te reg bya yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te reg bya yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is contact, then visual consciousness arises.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs reg bya dang ldan pa'i tshogs pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs reg bya dang ldan pa'i tshogs pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the collection of form that is the object of visual consciousness exists as being endowed with contact.

original: reg bya yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar sems pa yin no //
analyzed: reg bya yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar sems pa yin no //
translated: If there is a tactile object, he thinks that there is an eye consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa la zhes bya ba ni rgyu gcig thag nye ba bstan nas gnyis pa de la med par ston pa ni bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa la zhes bya ba ni rgyu gcig thag nye ba bstan nas gnyis pa de la med par ston pa ni bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa yin te /
translated: Otherwise, the exclusion that has the characteristic of the explanation is the second one that is shown to be absent in that.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i ldog pa nyid la rgyu gzhan du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i ldog pa nyid la rgyu gzhan du grub pa yin no //
translated: The exclusion that has such a nature is established as another cause.

original: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: That itself is shown by â€œin that caseâ€ and so forth.

original: srid pa la 'dod pa ni 'khor ba'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa la 'dod pa ni 'khor ba'i sred pa ste /
translated: Desire for existence is craving for saá¹ƒsÄra.

original: skye ba'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains it with â€œthe place of birthâ€ and so forth.

original: skye ba'i gnas ni mngal la sogs @129a * //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas ni mngal la sogs @129a * //
translated: The place of birth is the womb and so forth.

original: pa'o ; / gnas skabs ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / gnas skabs ni mi dang lha la sogs pa'o //
translated: The state is human, divine, and so forth.

original: nye bar mkho ba ni tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba ni tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pa'o //
translated: Necessities are sandalwood, saffron, and so forth.

original: sems can ni srog chags grogs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can ni srog chags grogs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Sentient beings are living beings who become friends.

original: bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i gsum pa'o //ğŸ”½bgrod par bya ba'i nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i gsum pa'o // bgrod par bya ba'i nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The third is by way of cause of pleasure.ğŸ”½The third is by way of what is to be traversed.

original: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gsum pa yin te /
translated: The third is characterized as that which is to be traversed.

original: bgrod par bya ba'i ngo bor yul du bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba'i ngo bor yul du bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is to be taken as an object in the nature of what is to be traversed.

original: sngar yod pa zhes bya ba ni mngal gyi gnas yongs su len pa las sngar te /
analyzed: sngar yod pa zhes bya ba ni mngal gyi gnas yongs su len pa las sngar te /
translated: That which exists previously is prior to the taking of a womb.

original: blo'i ni rang gi nye bar len pa las pa nyid kyis thog ma med pa can nyid du bsgrubs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: blo'i ni rang gi nye bar len pa las pa nyid kyis thog ma med pa can nyid du bsgrubs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The mind is established as being without beginning by the very fact that it is the appropriator of itself.

original: sngar yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established as existing previously.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni lung nye bar 'god pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni lung nye bar 'god pa'o //
translated: In this regard, he cites a scripture.

original: 'di las sdug bsngal 'byung bas na kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las sdug bsngal 'byung bas na kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since suffering arises from this, it is the origin.

original: sred pa ni spyir ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa can ni de nyid kyi phyir yang srid pa 'byung ba can ni //
analyzed: sred pa ni spyir ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa can ni de nyid kyi phyir yang srid pa 'byung ba can ni //
translated: Craving is the desire for future birth in general. It is the origin of renewed existence because it is the cause of future birth.

original: yang srid pa dgos pa nyid kyis phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid pa dgos pa nyid kyis phyir ro //
translated: and the future, because it is necessary.

original: dga' ba dang 'dod chags la dga' ba'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang 'dod chags la dga' ba'i 'dod chags te /
translated: Delight and attachment to delight are the attachment of delight.

original: de dag dang bcas pa ni rgyun gyi khyad par skye ba na rgyun la rnam par 'dres pa yin gyi mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang bcas pa ni rgyun gyi khyad par skye ba na rgyun la rnam par 'dres pa yin gyi mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin te /
translated: When the stream of the person who possesses these is born, it is mixed with the stream, but it is not associated,

original: 'dod chags gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two attachments are not associated.

original: de la dga' ba ni da ltar gyi dngos po la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni da ltar gyi dngos po la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba'o //
translated: Delight is the afflicted delight that has the present thing as its object.

original: 'dod chags kyang da ltar ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i mngon par chags pa nyid yin no //ğŸ”½de skad du gang gi phyir da ltar ba'i yul 'dod pa can gyi dga' ba dang / mngon par chags pa skye ba de'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang da ltar ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i mngon par chags pa nyid yin no // de skad du gang gi phyir da ltar ba'i yul 'dod pa can gyi dga' ba dang / mngon par chags pa skye ba de'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa'am /
translated: Attachment is the manifest attachment that has the present thing as its object.

original: de las khyad par du gyur pa can gyis ma 'ongs pa yang 'dod par byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de las khyad par du gyur pa can gyis ma 'ongs pa yang 'dod par byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Thus it is said: â€œBecause the delight and attachment of one who desires the present object arise, one desires the future that is like that or is distinguished from it.â€

original: / da ltar ba'i yul 'dod pa can nyid la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ji ltar ma 'ongs pa don du gnyer ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: / da ltar ba'i yul 'dod pa can nyid la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ji ltar ma 'ongs pa don du gnyer ba yin zhe na /
translated: The present object is the desire realm, which is explained as being associated with the passion of delight. How is it the pursuit of the future?

original: de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, â€œthe attitude of delighting in this and that.â€

original: srid pa dang longs spyod la sogs pa thams cad la khyad par med par don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srid pa dang longs spyod la sogs pa thams cad la khyad par med par don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the aspect of pursuit without distinction with regard to all existences, enjoyments, and so on.

original: 'dod ba'i khams don du gnyer ba ni 'dod pa'i srid pa'o gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams don du gnyer ba ni srid pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ba'i khams don du gnyer ba ni 'dod pa'i srid pa'o gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams don du gnyer ba ni srid pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: The pursuit of the desire realm is the craving for desire. The pursuit of the form and formless realms is the craving for existence.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: The craving for separation from suffering is the craving for annihilation.ğŸ”½The reason for the destruction of the craving for pleasure is called the craving for pleasure.

original: bde ba'i srid pa 'jig pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rgyu @129b mtshan gang yin pa ni bde ba'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i srid pa 'jig pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rgyu @129b mtshan gang yin pa ni bde ba'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The reason for the destruction of the craving for pleasure is called the craving for pleasure.

original: 'di las 'di bde ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di las 'di bde ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is happiness.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: dngos po dman pa bde ba'i rgyu nyid du gzung ba las so //
analyzed: dngos po dman pa bde ba'i rgyu nyid du gzung ba las so //
translated: This is the cause of pleasure means that he considers a lesser thing to be the cause of pleasure.

original: la lar 'jug pa'i bdag tu chags pa nyid la rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi gnyi ga la grub pa'i bgrod pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i'o //
analyzed: la lar 'jug pa'i bdag tu chags pa nyid la rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi gnyi ga la grub pa'i bgrod pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i'o //
translated: In some cases, attachment to self is the cause of engagement, means that in this very life, attachment to self is the cause of engagement in walking, etc.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la 'jug pa'i yang bdag tu chags pa rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la 'jug pa'i yang bdag tu chags pa rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, in other lives, attachment to self is the cause of engagement, means that in other lives, attachment to self is the cause of engagement.

original: yul gang la zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang la zhe na /
translated: What is the object?

original: kun la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: All is stated.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni de'i 'jug pa brtse ba'i dbang gis yin gyi /
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni de'i 'jug pa brtse ba'i dbang gis yin gyi /
translated: Other than one who is compassionate means that his engagement is due to the power of compassion.

original: bdag tu chags pa'i rgyus 'jug pa ni pa yin no //ğŸ”½dngos sam brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa'i rgyus 'jug pa ni pa yin no // dngos sam brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not due to the cause of attachment to self.

original: gang gi tshe lus snyoms pas rgyas par gyur pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus snyoms pas rgyas par gyur pa la /
translated: Directly or indirectly means that when the body is nourished by food,

original: nang gi reg bya'i khyad par skyes pa'i bde ba la brten nas /
analyzed: nang gi reg bya'i khyad par skyes pa'i bde ba la brten nas /
translated: he experiences pleasure based on the arising of a special internal tactile object.

original: 'dod pa skye ba de'i tshe ni brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa skye ba de'i tshe ni brgyud pa'o //
translated: When desire arises, it is indirect.

original: gang gi tshe ni lus la brten nas zhen pa la sogs pa skye ba de'i tshe dngos yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ni lus la brten nas zhen pa la sogs pa skye ba de'i tshe dngos yin no //
translated: When it arises in dependence on the body, it is direct.

original: phan 'dogs 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni lus kyis byas pa'i nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni lus kyis byas pa'i nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: â€œSome benefitâ€ refers to the special application of the body.

original: de ltar na de la dmigs pa byung ba yod pa de'i rnam pa can nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de la dmigs pa byung ba yod pa de'i rnam pa can nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the benefit of desire, etc. is that they have the aspect of the object that occurs in the body.

original: gang yang lus rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na brgyud pas 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba de lta na yang de'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba can gyi phan 'dogs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang lus rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na brgyud pas 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba de lta na yang de'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba can gyi phan 'dogs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Even when desire, etc. arise indirectly through the growth of the body, etc. , they still have the nature of benefiting that which occurs in that state.

original: de dag skye ba'i rgyun dang gags byed pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag skye ba'i rgyun rgyun gyis 'jug pa dang / gags byed pa ste 'gal ba'i rkyen bskyed pa la'o //
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i rgyun dang gags byed pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag skye ba'i rgyun rgyun gyis 'jug pa dang / gags byed pa ste 'gal ba'i rkyen bskyed pa la'o //
translated: â€œThe cause of their arising, the obstruction of their arising, etc.â€ means that the cause of the arising of desire, etc. is the continuous occurrence of their arising, and the obstruction of their arising is the generation of conditions that are incompatible with them.

original: ji ltar rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa nges par nye bar sbyor ba de ltar lus ma yin pa'i phyir nges par sbyor ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa nges par nye bar sbyor ba de ltar lus ma yin pa'i phyir nges par sbyor ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: Just as the appropriator is definitely connected with the object that is similar to its type, so the body is not definitely connected with it. Therefore, the connection is refuted.

original: 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba dag ni yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba dag ni yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: There is no contradiction. The contradiction with what is accepted is because the two have different objects.

original: 'dod chags med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi phyogs kyi skyon sdud par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi phyogs kyi skyon sdud par byed do //
translated: The otherâ€™s position is summarized in the statement, â€œThere is no desire without a body.â€

original: sangs rgyas pas 'dod chags med par skye ba ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas 'dod chags med par skye ba ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: The Buddhist says, â€œWe have not seen any desire that arises without a body.

original: skye ba 'di'i 'dod chags rgyu yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rigs gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: skye ba 'di'i 'dod chags rgyu yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rigs gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to explain that the desire of this life is the cause of the body.â€

original: rigs 'di lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid yin par 'dod pa na lus med par 'dod chags ma mthong ba'i phyir lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin par ro //
analyzed: rigs 'di lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu nyid yin par 'dod pa na lus med par 'dod chags ma mthong ba'i phyir lus 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin par ro //
translated: When this reason is accepted, it is reasonable to explain that the body is the cause of desire, because we have not seen any desire without a body.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This very reason

original: dus mnyam du 'byung ba can nyid @130a * //
analyzed: dus mnyam du 'byung ba can nyid @130a * //
translated: They occur simultaneously.ğŸ”½

original: yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they occur simultaneously.

original: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it causeless,

original: rtag tu yod pa dang med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa dang med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would always exist and never exist.

original: yon tan dang bcas pa'i rdzas skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul gyi yon tan gyi yon tan dang bcas pa'i lus skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan dang bcas pa'i rdzas skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul gyi yon tan gyi yon tan dang bcas pa'i lus skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase â€œthe arising of a substance endowed with qualitiesâ€ means that the body endowed with the qualities of the objects of attachment, etc., would not arise.

original: phyin ci log pa'i blo ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid can gyi ma rigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i blo ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid can gyi ma rigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œa mistaken cognitionâ€ means an understanding that is characterized by error, such as the belief in permanence, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthe nature of the cause as it has been describedâ€ refers to impermanence, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i sred pa ste rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i sred pa ste rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The phrase â€œthe nature of the cause as it has been describedâ€ refers to the craving for existence; it is the nature of the cause.

original: ma grub phyir yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma grub phyir yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nor is it established,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: because the reason is not established.

original: 'khor ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig kyang //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig kyang //
translated: and also, â€œNo one is seen in cyclic existence.â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: Thus, he explains that the self and so on do not exist.

original: bdag la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so /
translated: He thinks that the self and so on are refuted by the very fact that they are not perceived.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa /
translated: Book 47

original: gal te 'khor ba pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba'o //
translated: If someone in cyclic existence were to exist, then he would be seen.

original: cung zhig kyang mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: cung zhig kyang mi snang ba ste /
translated: But he is not seen at all.

original: lta ba po bdag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba po bdag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: He thinks that the seer does not exist because the self does not exist.

original: ci ste kho bo cag la sogs pa la brtsams pa yin pa de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ni kho bo cag la sogs pa la kho bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste kho bo cag la sogs pa la brtsams pa yin pa de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ni kho bo cag la sogs pa la kho bo 'bad rtsol byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is said that it is not established when it is based on us and so on, then it is because it generates the ascertainment that we and so on make effort.

original: gal te yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang rnam par shes pa nyid bdag dang gir sgro 'dogs pas 'khrul par skyes pa na /
analyzed: gal te yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang rnam par shes pa nyid bdag dang gir sgro 'dogs pas 'khrul par skyes pa na /
translated: Even though the self does not exist, consciousness itself is mistaken when it superimposes the self and mine.

original: shes pa bya ba dang bcas pa rgyur byas nas mthong ngo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: shes pa bya ba dang bcas pa rgyur byas nas mthong ngo zhes brjod do //
translated: and it is said that one sees by making the knowing that has activity as its cause.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi sgro 'dogs pa la gnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi sgro 'dogs pa la gnod pa'i phyir /
translated: And because that very cause of consciousness is the superimposition,

original: ji ltar bdag med du zin kyang thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba de ltar de nyid ni thos pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag med du zin kyang thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba de ltar de nyid ni thos pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: it is explained by â€œjust as, even though there is no self, the stages of hearing, thinking, and meditation, etc., are not without result,â€ etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis bdag tu chags pa 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan te /ğŸ”½gang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis bdag tu chags pa 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan te / gang gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pas so //
translated: The application is indicated by â€œthat which is the cause of the engagement of attachment to self,â€ etc.ğŸ”½It is the cause of the engagement of attachment to self because of the superimposition of that.

original: de la chags pas te mngon par chags pa de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la chags pas te mngon par chags pa de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has attachment to that, i.e., to the self, is so called.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i chags pas byas pa'i 'jug pa de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i chags pas byas pa'i 'jug pa de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the engagement that is made by the attachment of superimposition.
